loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Barbara works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dress shop. Barbara is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business such as needles, thread, etc. for her tailoring business.

Barbara has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business such as needles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 51 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Charita works very hard to provide for them.

Charita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries.

Charita has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Charita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 63 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a widowed woman with six children. She is 39 years old and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Josephine has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy variety of vegetables to sell to her customers.

Josephine has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a hard-working man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He grows tea and also sells it. He started this business with the hope of raising income for his family.

Wilson adores the tea business. He wants to increase the amount of tea he harvests to increase his income. He faces challenges of tea price fluctuation and unpredictable weather, which hinders his expected income.

Besides that, he dreams of improving his home.

Wilson needs another loan to help him rent a tea plantation for one year to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to rent a tea plantation for one year.

loans.name: Sidinyide Group

texts.fr:
Mr MAHAMOUDOU est responsable du groupe SIDINYIDE. Il est marié et père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans.  02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 08 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’agriculture et pratique aussi l’élevage depuis plus de 20 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 03 sacs d’engrais et 02 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne  acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr. Mahamoudou is the leader of the group called Sidinyide. He is married and the father of six children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest two years old. Two of the children go to school, and Mr. Mahamoudou is responsible for eight people in all.

Mr. Mahamoudou is engaged in agriculture and also has been doing livestock raising for more than 20 years. He buys what he needs in the surrounding markets. With the money from the loan, he intends to buy three sacks of fertilizer and two sheep.

He wants to use the profits from the loan to grow his business. His ambition is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer and two sheep

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, tiene como actividad económica la venta de semilla de marañón, mariscos y otros productos, el oficio lo aprendió poco a poco de sus amistades, cuando sintió que tenía la experiencia necesaria fundo su propio negocio, en sus inicios solo vendía semilla de marañón, con las ganancias que iba generando incorporo la venta de mariscos y otro tipo de mercadería, su negocio funciona desde hace ocho años. Es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos y en ocasiones tiene apoyo de su familia, sus hijos estudian nivel básico.
Necesita de un crédito para comprar 22 medios de semilla de marañón, los procesara y tendrá suficiente producto para vender mientras llega la próxima cosecha del fruto, espera generar nuevas ventas e ingresos para resarcir su deuda y disminuir las necesidades de su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar su negocio con nuevos productos y tener un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
María makes a living selling raw cashews, seafood and other products. She learned the business little by little from her friends. When she felt she had enough experience, she opened her own business. Initially, she only sold raw cashews. With the income she was generating, she incorporated the sale of seafood and other types of merchandise. She's been running her business for eight years.

She is a single mother who lives with her three children, who are in elementary school. She occasionally receives support from her family. She needs a loan to buy 22 half measures of raw cashews. She will process them and have sufficient product to sell until the next harvest arrives. She hopes to generate new sales and income to repay her debt and meet the needs of her family. She aspires to expand her business with new products and obtain a more dignified manner of living.

loans.use: to buy 22 half measures of raw cashews, which she will process to have sufficient product to sell until the next harvest arrives.

loans.name: Saint Joseph Tanvi Group

texts.fr:
Mr ISSAKA est responsable du groupe  SAINT JOSEPH TANVI. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et il a 06 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis plus de 25 ans et pratique aussi l'élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte  acheter 06 sacs d’engrais, 04 boîtes de graines et 01 carton d’herbicides.
Il  veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants et renforcer son activité.  Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Issaka is the representative of the 'Saint Joseph Tanvi' Group. He is married and father to five children. The eldest is fourteen and the youngest is three years old. One of his children currently attends school and he is responsible for a total of six people.

Issaka has been growing vegetables for more than twenty-five years. He also raises livestock. He plans to use this loan to buy six sacks of fertilizer, four boxes of seed and one box of herbicide from the local market. His profits will pay for schooling for his children and strengthen his business. One day, he hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer, 4 boxes of seed and 1 carton of herbicide.

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr: Tchilalo est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè  avec deux enfants à charge. Agée de 28 ans,  Tchilalo  est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Tchilalo  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice dans ce commerce qui rapporte plus et soutenir son mari dans les charges familiale puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Tchilalo is twenty-eight years old, married and lives in Agoè. She is responsible for two children. She sells charcoal which she buys twice a month from the market and sells from the front of her house.

Tchilalo has requested this loan to order sacks of charcoal to increase her profits and help her husband more with the expenses of their family and to provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Na Tau 20 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phong, 27, is Thai ethnic lady who has been married and become the mother of a boy at the age of 6. She lives with her husband and her child in a small house at a remote village and works at agricultural production for a living. Indeed, cultivating rice is the main business activity generating income for her family. Besides, they work at animal husbandry, including pig and fish farming to have additional income. This is the second time that Mrs. Phong has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food for the pigs. She hopes that her business activities will go well and bring good income for her family. 

Mrs. Phong dreams a better life for her family and a brighter future for her child. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs

loans.name: Nazar

texts.en:
Nazar is a hard-working man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1955. He is living poor in a small village with his family. He is married and has four children. His parents died when he was a child. He was raised in the family of his uncle and aunts. He was taught to take care of livestock and plant agricultural products.

Having learned how to look after livestock helps him now. He has many years of experience and knows his activity well.

Nazar's family members are sick now. He is a responsible father and has to take care of them all.

Nazar appealed to IMON asking for financial support to treat his family members and buy medicines. He awaits Kiva lender kindness and support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for family members, because they are sick.

loans.name: April Grace

texts.en:
At the young age of 19, April Grace is already working hard, trying to be a good entrepreneur. She runs a vegetable stall business in a public market in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She wants to help her parents and siblings with the profit derived from her business. She chose vegetable vending because it’s a healthy food and many people are now conscious about their health. It’s also an encouragement for her to eat healthy food beginning now in order to avoid serious illnesses in the future.

She’s a lady with many dreams. She wants to improve her business, buy a motorcycle soon, open a new enterprise like rice retailing two to three years from now, and buy a house and lot for her family someday. As an additional step in realizing these dreams, she applied for a PHP 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables that she can supply to her customers.

May God knock at your compassionate heart and may you be a blessing to her, because it will surely bring higher earnings and savings for her.

April Grace is an inspiration to her co-fellowship members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect on God’s Words and share stories about life and their businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is pictured here at her surplus store located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She offers quality affordable jeans, slack pants, shorts, shirts, blouses, and jackets. She’s been operating this store for 10 years as her main source of income to support her children’s daily needs and educational expenses. Lorelie is a widow who shoulders all responsibilities for her two children, one in college and the other still in elementary school.

Now, Lorelie wants to buy more items like sweaters and jackets in time for the rainy season. She also aims to renovate her stall to make it more appealing to customers. She is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan for this purpose. She hopes you are willing to help her so she can boost her profit and savings. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothing items like sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 42-year-old mother of 10 children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Maricel has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

Maricel has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a 25-year-old father of one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop and also runs a mobile money business that provides additional income. His goal is to have a wholesale shop in his area. Tom has asked for a loan to help him stock his shop with sugar, washing soap, Omo (detergent), rice, salt and cooking oil to sell. He is challenged by constant price fluctuations for the products he sells.

loans.use: to stock his shop with sugar, washing soap, Omo (detergent), rice, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rita Zuleyda

texts.es:
Rita, es maestra y tiene una tortillería, la casa es de su propiedad, vive con su madre y dos hijos que están estudiando, la venta de tortillas la aprendió a desarrollar con ayuda de su madre, luego se independizo y tiene sus propios clientes, su horario de venta es de cuatro de la tarde a ocho de la noche.
El financiamiento le servirá para comprar una cocina nueva para desempeñar su trabajo con equipo que le ayude a aumentar la producción de tortillas, pretende atender mejor a sus clientes y cubrir nuevas demandas.
Aspira aumentar sus ganancias para pagar su deuda y mantener el apoyo a su familia.
texts.en:
Rita is a teacher and has a tortilla stand. She lives with her mother and two children who study in a house that belongs to her. She learned to operate her tortillas sales with the help of her mother and later she became independent and has her own clients. Her hours of sales are from four in the afternoon until eight at night.

The loan will be used to buy a new stove to carry out her work with equipment which helps her increase her production of tortillas. She hopes to serve her customers better and cover new demand.

She wants to increase her profits to pay her debt and continue her support of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new stove to carry out her work with equipment that helps her increase her tortilla production.

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
At 31 years of age, Sinuon is married and blessed with two dependent children who are both in school. She lives in Battambang province, where she and her husband are growing cassava and working on her co-villager’s farm for a fee to supplement their income. She has been in her cassava farming business for ten years. 

Her cassava has grown not well lately, which has caused her to earn a very low income and lack working capital to do farming for this season. Thus, she decided to form a group of six to apply for a loan from VisionFund, which is the fourth loan cycle for her. The previous loans helped her to have a better house to stay, and she has fully paid back those loans. 

As the group leader, Sinuon will use her loan to buy organic fertilizers and pay the plowing fee to increase her crop yield. She hopes to earn more income for supporting her children’s studyies.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to increase her crop yield.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 49-year-old lady, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw, which consists of a motorbike) for several years now, but his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. Since his current rickshaw is out of order, he has to buy new moto rickshaw, but lacks sufficient cash-in-hand to do so.

Therefore, Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband will be able to buy a new moto rickshaw with the contribution of savings. She hopes that she would be able to save enough until the time comes for her children to be married in the future.

loans.use: to buy new moto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
Lai is 37 years old and married. She lives in Battambang province and has four dependent children, one of whom is in school. The main source of her family’s income is from cassava growing, while additional income comes from working for others for a fee. Together with her husband, she has been involved in cassava farming for five years. The main obstacle for her this season is a lack of working capital to support the cassava farming business. 

For the fist time, Lai is requesting a loan from VisionFund. In a group comprised of three members, Lai is the group leader and will use her loan to purchase organic fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fees for her cassava farming business. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her income so as to improve her family’s living standards and enhance her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to grow her crops healthily and fruitfully.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en: Hen’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Hen makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chamreun's Group

texts.en: Chamreun’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Chamreun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en: Orn’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Orn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mawouekpo

texts.fr: Mawouekpo est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè avec ses trois enfants à charge. Agée de 65 ans, Mawouekpo est une revendeuse de son cubé qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour commander des sacs de son cubé, Mawouekpo  nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mawouekpo is a married woman who lives in Agoè with her three children, for whom she is responsible. Aged 65, Mawouekpo retails bran cubes. She buys her stock twice a month in the market and resells it in front of her house.

So as to order some sacks of the bran cubes, Mawouekpo needs these funds to cover restocking her wares so that she can help her husband with the family expenses and permit her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of wheat bran cubes.

loans.name: Zarnisan

texts.en:
Zarnisan is 50 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are in school.

Zarnisan is in the agricultural sector. She is a farmer in Agjabadi and wants to expand her business. She has been a farmer for 20 years.

Zarnisan requested a loan of 490 AZN to buy seeds and other supplies for her farm.

In the future, Zarnisan would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college. Now she hopes Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other supplies for her farm

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 41 years old and married with nine children, six in school. Marites works very hard to provide for her family.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, rice, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marites has been in this business for three years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, rice, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Roqueta

texts.en:
Roqueta is a 53-year-old married woman with eight children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Roqueta has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Roqueta has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Antonia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Antonia, de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor en pequeño, tiene 3 hijos todos ya se acompañaron y solamente los dos viven en casa.  

Antonia, tiene una tienda desde hace 20 años, la cual es herencia de su familia, además de eso siembran granos básicos con su esposo, actualmente él siembra 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y de frijol siembra 3,500 metros cuadrados; esto lo realiza en un terreno propio cerca de su casa y en las labores agrícolas en ocasiones les ayuda su hijo y también pagan mano de obra extra  

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar maíz, ella quiere estar preparada antes que empiece a llover, para estar preparados con todos los insumos agrícolas, el cultivo que sembró anteriormente lo perdió todo debido a la sequía.  

Antonia, espera que en esta época las condiciones climáticas mejoren, para no perder nuevamente el dinero que se invierte.
texts.en:
Antonia, 61 years old, studied until fourth grade. She is married and her husband is a smallholder farmer. She has 3 children, they are all partnered and only the two live at home. Antonia has had a small store for the past 20 years, which is inheritance from her family. Additionally to this, she plants basic grains with her husband. Currently, he plants 10,500 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of beans. He does this on their own land near their house. On occasion, their son helps them and they also pay for extra labor on these agricultural labors.

She needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to plant corn. She wants to be prepared before it starts to rain to be prepared with all of the agricultural supplies. She lost all of the crop that she planted before due to a drought. Antonia hopes that in this season the climactic conditions improve in order to not lose the money she invests again.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to plant corn.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans résidant à Agoè . Afi est une coiffeuse qui s’approvisionne au marché une fois par mois des produits de beauté et expose dans son salon de coiffure  pour vendre à ses clients. Afi nécessite ce crédit pour commander des savons pour cheveux  et des mèches en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en:
A mother of three children, Afi is a married woman aged 30, living in Agoè. She is a hairdresser who buys her supplies at the market once a month. She purchases beauty products and displays them in her salon for resale to her clientele.

Afi needs this loan to order shampoo and hair extensions so as to make profits to help her husband care for their children as well as covering the food needs and healthcare costs of the family.

loans.use: to buy 20 relaxers and 13 hair extensions.

loans.name: Sreynoeun

texts.en:
Sreynoeun is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 21 years old and lives in a wooden pile house with her parents, one brother, and three sisters. Her family owns four hectares of rice fields, one hectare of cassava fields, and two pigs. 

In May 2014, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for the empowerment of women by training them and offering sustainable work in the village. Sreynoeun makes scarves, which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for the fertilizer for the field.

Thanks to the loan, Sreynoeun will buy silk material and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees.

loans.name: Ma. Morena

texts.en:
Ma. Morena is 42 years old and married with five children, two of them are still in school, Ma. Morena works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Morena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods, bread and other personal care products.

Ma. Morena has been in this business for 4 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa is 40 years old and has six children are presently in school.

Marissa has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 6500 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenalyn is 41 years old and has two children are still in school.

Jenalyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business like fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business like fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Janer David

texts.es:
Janer es un joven de 22 años de edad, con sueños y aspiraciones para su vida, desea convertirse en independiente y generar sus propios recursos para sus sostenimiento, estudios y para apoyar a sus padres.
No cuenta con mucho capital, solo tiene un gran espíritu y el optimismo que triunfara.
Janer quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de alimentos, con el dinero comprara un carro de perros, surtido de refrescos, utensilios, mesas, sillas y demás insumos para preparar comidas rápidas.
Este impulso de ser emprendedor lo tiene por querer crecer, por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, apóyalo, ayuda a la juventud que quieren sacar su familia adelante y vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Janer is a 22 year old youth who has dreams and aspirations for his life. He wants to become independent and generate his own resources for his sustenance, studies and to support his parents.

He doesn't have much capital only great spirit and optimism to succeed.

Janer wants to request a loan to start his own business selling food. With the money he will buy a food cart, an assortment of soft drinks, utensils, tables, chairs and other supplies to prepare fast food.

He has this urge to be an entrepreneur as he wants to grow and to improve the conditions of his life. Support him. Help the youth that want to get their families ahead and live in dignity.

loans.use: to buy a food cart, an assortment of soft drinks, utensils, tables, chairs and other supplies to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary is 58 years old and has one child is still in school.

Mary has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 6500 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her stall.

Mary has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her stall

loans.name: Ma. Jesusa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Jesusa works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Ma. Jesusa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Ma. Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Mary-An

texts.en:
Mary-an is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary-an is 39 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Mary-an has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mary-an requested a PHP 5500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell to her stall.

Mary-an has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell to her stall

loans.name: Tweyambe Kinogozi Village Group

texts.en: Noah is a very hardworking member of the Tweyambe Kinogozi Group, aged 39. He lives in Hoima, Uganda. He sells items like salt, sugar, and cooking oil among other items on a retail basis. In order to supplement his income he farms cassava. He has always wanted to expand his business so as to meet the growing demands of his clientele as well as improving the standards of living of his family; however, his desires are limited by stiff competition and bad debtors. He will use the loan facility to buy more salt and sugar to sell on retail basis.

loans.use: to buy more salt and sugar to sell at retail

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Alaka

texts.en:
Alaka, a young girl who wants to make her career in the banking sector, is 20 years old. She has completed her Bachelor's degree and recently got admission into a post-graduate diploma course in banking.

Alaka lives in Bhubaneswar with her friends. Her father is a farmer, and she has two siblings. Her father earns only 7,000 INR per month, so he was unable to pay the course fee for her professional studies as this professional degree course fee for the banking course is very high.

Alaka has applied for a loan of 59,000 INR to pay for her banking course fee. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to pay for her banking course fee.

loans.name: Damaso Enrique

texts.es:
Dámaso es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad, tiene dos muchachos menores de edad y vive en el municipio de Tolú viejo, precisamente en las zonas rurales donde ejerce un trabajo en el cual no tiene competencia que es el arreglo de aparatos eléctricos.
Al ser el único negocio de este tipo en el sector Dámaso tiene la obligación de prestar un servicio oportuno y tener a la mano los repuestos y herramienta necesaria para  realizar un trabajo de calidad.
En base a esta exigencia Dámaso quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de herramienta de mano y un taladro, implementos que le hacen falta en su trabajo y que ha tenido que prestar con vecinos.
Su sueño es tener varias sucursales de su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Damaso is a 43 year old father with two minor children and lives in the municipality of old Tolu, specifically in the rural areas where he does a job in which he has no competition, fixing electric appliances. By being the only business of this type in the area Damaso has the obligation to provide timely service and to have available the tools and spare parts necessary to do quality work. Due to these demands Damaso wants to apply for financial support to pay for labor and a drill, tools that he needs for his job and that he's had to borrow from neighbors. His dream is to have several branches for his business and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for labor and a drill, tools that he needs for his work.

loans.name: Bibhu Prasad

texts.en:
Bibhu Prasad is a young man with clear objectives. At his 22 years of age, he is almost ready with his bachelor's degree in accounting and finance.

Supported by his father, who is a farmer, and his mother, who is a homemaker, he has been able to move ahead, putting into practice all the values he learned at home. This studious young man, who is almost ready with his profession, is eager to pursue a post-graduate diploma in a banking and finance course. He needs to finish paying off his banking course fees and certification expenses; therefore, he is requesting a loan amount of 72,000 INR.

In the future, he wishes to work at a bank. He also wants to study for a master's degree and, especially, to give back to his parents for all they have sacrificed for him.

loans.use: to finish paying off his banking course fees and certification expenses.

loans.name: Toeur's Group

texts.en: Aged 42, Toeur is a villager from a rural area of Banteay Meanchey province where she resides with three dependent children who are all still in school. Growing rice has been her main business for 17 years. Additional income comes from a pig-raising business. There is insufficient water to supply to the farmland and the pigs also got ill; these are the challenges for her in earning income to support her family. About 11 USD of income is earned every single day and about 3.50 USD is being saved for future needs. This is Toeur’s second time with VisionFund and the past loan, which was paid back completely, has had a positive impact on her family; she can improve the business and able to send her children to school. Now she is leading a group of two to apply for a new loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer to increase her crop yield and take the rest of money to buy pig feed to support her pig-raising business. She hopes she can increase more income and expand her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to increase her crop yield so as to earn more income to save for future needs.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a 40-year-old married mother of one child, who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur..

Rosanna has a bakery business in the Philippines. Rosanna requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour and sugar for her bakery business.

Rosanna has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosanna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and sugar for her bakery business.

loans.name: Carmen Tatiana

texts.es:
Carmen es una energética y hermosa joven de 20 años de edad, una mujer nacida en el campo que tiene mucho entusiasmo y es muy recursiva, ella desde pequeña mostro sus cualidades y habilidades para el comercio. 
Ella tiene su negocio de venta de mercancía, principalmente ropa y productos de uso personal, dicho negocio lo ejerce en su hogar pero también sale a las calles y recorre veredas cercanas vendiendo puerta a puerta.
EL sueño y motivo por el cual Carmen tiene su propia actividad económica es que quiere crecer, lograr alcanzar sus sueños por sus propios méritos, tener un hogar comprado por ella, generar calidad de vida, no dejar que su familia pase necesidades, tiene un gran corazón y siempre piensa en su familia.
Carmen quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de productos como ropa juvenil para hombre y mujer, es con la intención de tener nueva mercancía para mostrar, también aprovechara las promociones de revistas para comprar productos de uso personal, revenderlos y tener mejor utilidad por estos. 
El propósito central del préstamo es llegar a más clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen is an energetic and beautiful young 20 year old woman. Born in a rural area, she has lots of enthusiasm and is very resourceful. Since she was a little girl she has demonstrated her talents and knack for business. She has a business where she sells merchandise, mainly clothes and personal products. She operates said business in her home but she also goes out into the streets and travels through nearby avenues selling door to door. Her dream and the reason that she has her own business is her desire to grow, and to achieve her dreams through her own merit, to buy a home of her own, raise her standard of living, and ensure that her family's needs don't go unmet.

She has a big heart and always thinks about her family. Carmen wants to apply for financial assistance to purchase products like children's clothing for boys and girls, with the intention of acquiring new merchandise to display. She'll also take advantage of the sales in the magazines to buy personal use products, and resell them so she can make more of a profit. The main purpose of the loan is to reach more customers.

loans.use: To purchase products such as children's clothing for boys and girls, with the intention of acquiring new merchandise to display

loans.name: Rose Jean

texts.en:
Rose Jean is 25 years old and married with two children, one in school. Rose Jean works very hard to provide for her family.

Rose Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rose Jean has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Rose Jean would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, who is single, works hard to support herself. Myrna has a general store business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for three years now and earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre sonriente, una persona de 37 años de edad que disfruta su trabajo y ama a su familia, con sus dos negocios de cría de ganado porcino y venta de productos de la canasta familiar, con ambos negocios logra generar el sustento y alimento para su familia conformada por su hija de 14 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando y su pareja con la que vive en unión libre y se desempeña como ama de casa y en ocasiones le ayuda en sus negocios.
Para Luis es un orgullo mantener su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo y perseverancia ha mejorado su calidad de vida y pasar de un nivel de simplemente trabajar para sobrevivir a uno siguiente de trabajar por mejorar y tener mejores cosas.
Siguiendo sus sueños de comprar vivienda, tener un negocio más amplio y asegurar la educación de su hija, Luis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, alimento de engorde y surtido de snacks, refrescos y cerveza para su tienda.
texts.en:
Luis is a man who smiles. He is 37 years old who enjoys his work and loves his family. With his two businesses of raising pigs and selling basic food items he manages to generate the sustenance and food for his family made up of his 14 year old daughter who is studying and his partner. He lives with her in a common-law realtionship and she works as a housewife and at times helps him with his businesses.

It makes Luis proud to support his family. Thanks to his efforts and perseverance he has improved their quality of living and climbed from a level of simply working to survive to the next level of working to improve and have better things.

He continues with his dream of buying a house, having a bigger business and assuring his daughter's education.

Luis wants to request a loan to buy pigs, balanced feed and an assortment of snacks, soft drinks and beer for his store.

loans.use: to buy pigs, balanced feed and an assortment of snacks, soft drinks and beer to stock his store.

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Chamroeun is 35 years old and he is single.

He is growing rice and selling soap to earn income to support his living. The decreasing yield of his crops, due to drought, causes him to earn a very low income.

Chamroeun is new to VisionFund Cambodia and in applying for a Kiva loan. He will use his loan to buy a motorcycle he can ride in order to sell soap in other areas of his village, to increase the number of sales.

He wants to gain more income and hopes to provide better support to his family members.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle he can ride in order to sell soap in other areas of his village, to increase the number of sales.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jitendra

texts.en:
Jitendra, 21, is a first-year banking diploma student at IFBI in Bhubaneswar. He grew up in rural village and is the first member of his family to attend university. He was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose IFBI because it offers the opportunity to gain work experience as you learn.

An outstanding student, Jitendra plans to major in banking with a concentration in business. He will graduate IFBI with a PGDBO (Post-Graduate Diploma in Banking Operations) from an accredited university. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR. He also hopes to improve his public speaking skills, one of the many skills he will need to pursue his dream of being a successful entrepreneur and a banker.

Reflecting on life after university, Jitendra would like to give back to his family and the members of his community who helped lift him up.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education costs.

loans.name: Rafiqa's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqua is 48 and she is married. She lives with her husband and ten children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Rafiqua purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this for many years, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to the upcoming Eid festival, the demand for clothing will increase as well.

This is the reason Rafiqua showed an interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for reselling by herself from her home.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
NASEEM is a 43-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of six children.
Her husband provides white wash and oil paint services to his customers in the community; sometimes he has to go out of city also. 
He has gotten a new contract for white wash and oil paint of newly constructed house but he has no paint brush or rollers for providing services.
NASEEM has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc.
His savings is very poor that is why he is unable to buy new tools for providing white wash services. She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.
She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new paint brushes, rollers and kerosene oil for her husband's whitewash services.

loans.name: Niñazita

texts.en:
Niñazita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Niñazita is 32 years old, and her child is in school.

Niñazita has a peanut-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, oil, peanuts, and other supplies to use in her business.

Niñazita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, oil, peanuts, and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Theresa works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Theresa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remedios is 47 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Remedios has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Remedios has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, relata tristemente que el crédito anterior lo utilizo para cultivar granos básicos pero que por la sequía que afecta al país sus cosechas han sido malas, enfrenta inestabilidad económica y su familia se mantiene igual.
Necesita de un nuevo crédito para continuar trabajando en la agricultura, comprara insumos agrícolas y pagara la preparación del terreno en el que tiene planificado sembrar granos básicos en la nueva temporada, tiene fe que en esta ocasión los resultados sean positivos y agradece el apoyo que la institución le brinda.
texts.en:
Reina sadly shares that she used the previous loan to plant basic grains but due to the drought that affected the country, her harvests were poor. She is facing economic instability and her family finds itself in the same situation as before.

She needs a new loan to continue working in agriculture. She will buy agricultural supplies and pay for the preparation of the land where she plans to plant basic grains during the new season. She has faith that her results will be positive this time and is thankful for the support the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay to prepare the land where she plans to plant basic grains during the new season.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old, and her two children are in school.

Robelyn has a poultry business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Robelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosa has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Rosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Wilson De Jesus

texts.es:
En el año 2004 empezó a emprender un sueño de comprar una vivienda el señor Wilson quien se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino. Wilson es un hombre de 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene una hija de 14 años de edad, con perseverancia, paciencia, superando adversidades, el señor Wilson ha logrado mantenerse en el mercado, su experiencia de más de 10 años en el mercado la generado clientes fieles y ya que se viene la temporada alta de venta quiere estar bien preparado, buscara nuevos clientes y tener unas excelentes ventas.
Para estar a punto necesita capital para comprar lechones, vacunas, vitaminas y alimento de engorde.
texts.en: In 2004 Wilson started on the path to his dream of buying a house. He works in pig raising and is 43 years old, married, and has a 14 year old daughter. With perseverance, patience, and by overcoming obstacles Wilson has managed to keep himself in the market. His 10+ years of experience in the market has given him loyal customers and with peak selling season approaching he wants to really be ready. He'll be looking to attract new customers and make excellent sales. To be ready he needs capital to buy pigs, vaccines, vitamins, and feed.

loans.use: To buy pigs, vaccines, vitamins, and feed.

loans.name: Put's Group

texts.en:
Put, at the age of 42, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of seven children, two of whom are in school. She earns income via growing cassava, rice and soybean as the main sources of income. Supplemental income of this family is from working for others for a fee. Cassava and rice grow unhealthily because they were threatened by pests and weeds, which is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family.

Put has been with VisionFund for five cycles already, which she fully paid back. She can make more income and be able to expand the business to be better than before through her past loans. For this sixth loan, Put, who is the leader of six-member group, will use her loan portion to buy seeds and to purchase organic fertilizer to support the farmland and the rest of money will be used to pay for plowing fee. She hopes to expand her business so as to upgrade the standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to purchase organic fertilizer to enhance her crop yield so as to increase her income for supporting her children's studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals to spray for a better harvest, and use the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Yamir

texts.es:
Él es Yamir es un orgullo agricultor de 32 años de edad que con un sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia empezó a cultivar frutas, precisamente maracuyá, desde que inicio con su negocio ha encontrado en este buena rentabilidad, pero ha tenido que enfrentarse con diferentes problemas ocasionados en gran parte por las condiciones climáticas. 


Yamir en el momento se encuentra en proceso de ampliación, quiere plantar mayor número de palor de maracuyá, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, riegos y venenos, con los que iniciara una nueva plantación y dará sostenimiento al cultivo existente.

Si decides apoyar a un empresario agrícola como Yamir le estarás dando la oportunidad a una persona de ampliarse para generar mayores recursos y en un futuro no necesitar tanto de apoyos económicos para realizar sus proyectos, sino hacerlo a partir de ahorros propios.
texts.en:
This is Yamir, a proud 32 year old farmer who began to grow fruits, specifically passion fruit, as part of his dream to improve his family's standard of living. Since he began this business he has found profitability in it but has had to face a range of problems that in large part are due to climate conditions.

At the moment Yamir finds himself in a process of expansion. He wishes to plant a larger number of passion fruit plants. For this reason he is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies including seeds, irrigation equipment and pesticides. With these supplies, he will begin planting new crops and provide maintenance for the crops that have already been planted.

If you choose to support a farmer like Yamir, you will be offering someone with the opportunity to expand his business to generate greater resources and in the future not require as much economic support to carry out his projects, but instead allow him to do so with his own savings.

loans.use: to purchase passion fruit seeds and farming supplies to plant and maintain the crop.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 68 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Narcisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 45 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, diapers, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Angjelina

texts.en:
Angjelina’s son Miguel, who is in the photograph with her, is sick and needs to go to a specialist; this is where your money will go.

Angjelina is 46 and married with a daughter and a son in their early twenties. Their family lives in the rural area in the northern part of the country. For the past almost ten years, she’s been pursuing agriculture/livestock to earn an income in addition to the small monthly income of her husband, who works as a night man in a nearby factory.

At the moment, she has one milk cow with a male calf, two sows, and ten chickens. On the little land that their family owns, she has some orchards and also plants fodder for the animals and seasonal veggies.

loans.use: to pay for her son's visit to a health specialist and other related health costs.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Мария, 59 лет, вдова, 2 детей. У нее - высшее образование, торгует женской одеждой в магазине. Ежемесячный доход - около 42,000 сом (KGS). Мария обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для расширения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить на образование своих внуков.
texts.en: Mariya is a 59 year old widow with two children. She has a college education, and has a shop where she sells women's clothing. Her monthly income is around 42,000 som (KGS). Mariya came to Bai-Tushum Bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy clothing to expand her inventory. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further expansion of her business, in order to save for her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to buy women clothes for retail sale in her shop

loans.name: Kisoga Group

texts.en:
Vumilia, who is in her late thirties, is married with two kids who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for two years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Vumilia’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her mamalishe (food stall) business and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe business. She dreams of building her own house.

Vumilia will share this loan with her loan group, Kisoga, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Dúo San Cristóbal Group

texts.es:
Historia de Dúo San Cristóbal
Este dúo está conformado por Juana es originaria de San Andres Itzapa Ella es casada y madre de familia, Doña Juana es dueña de una fábrica de ropa que tiene en San Pedro Sacatepéquez, ella y su esposo trabajan confeccionando trajes para caballeros y niños, Juana necesita de capital para poder Comprar tela de lona ya que tiene una oferta no puede desaprovechar por lo que solicita a kiva le brinde la ayuda que siempre le ha brindado ya que con los dos créditos que ha tenido a podido cumplir sus sueños y no duda que con este otro crédito le ira muy bien.
texts.en:
The History of the San Cristóbal Duo:
This duo includes Juana, a native of San Andrés Itzapa. She is married and a mother. Juana is the owner of a clothing factory in San Pedro Sacatepéquez. She and her husband work producing suits for men and boys.

Juana needs capital to buy canvas fabric beacuse she has an offer she can't miss out on. For this reason she is requesting that Kiva help her as it always has. With the two loans she has received she has been able to achieve her dreams and does not doubt that this loan will go very well for her.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 52 years old. She is married and has five children to support. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last five years, earning an income of KES 17,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers such as D.A.P and C.A.N for top dressing her crop for a better harvest.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and the surplus to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams include being financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as D.A.P and C.A.N. for top dressing her crop for a better harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more palm sugar syrup for her palm sugar drink business.

loans.name: Sanavar

texts.ru: Санавар, 51 год, вдова, 4 детей, образование среднее. Санавар 10 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 20 овец на продажу. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации по высокой цене. Доходы от бизнес деятельности Санавар будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Sanavar is a 51 year old widow with four children and a high school education. Ten years ago she began raising livestock. She owns three cows and 20 sheep which she will re-sell. Her monthly income is around 14,000 som (KGS). In order to increase the number of animals she has, she came to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and resale at a higher price. Savannah plans to save income from use of the loan for further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer guerrera, luchadora, pujante de 49 años de edad, una persona dedica en cuerpo y alma al capo y a su esposo, se desempeña como criadora de cerdos, peces y gallinas, negocios que aprendió gracias a sus padres y que ejerce por necesidad económica. 
Flor cansada de solo trabajar por sobrevivir, quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para adecuar sus negocios y surtir, dicho préstamo le permitirá tener instalaciones más adecuadas para la actividad, tener mayor número de animales, aumentara sus ventas y su ingresos no solo le permitirán sobrevivir sino tener capital para mejorar su vivienda, comer mejor, vivir mejor, comprar medicamentos entre otros.
texts.en:
Flor is a warrior woman, a fighter, still strong at 49 years of age, dedicated body and soul to her enterprises and to her husband. She labors raising pigs, fish, and hens, businesses that she learned from her parents and that she carries out from economic necessity.

Flor, tired of working just to survive, wishes to request a loan to upgrade and restock her businesses. This loan will allow her to have more adequate installations for her activities, and have a larger number of animals, thereby augmenting her sales and income. It will not only permit her to survive but, also, to have the capital to improve her home, and to eat better, live better, and buy medicines, among other items.

loans.use: make improvements on her fish-raising ponds and purchase stocking ponds for fry.

loans.name: Temirlan

texts.ru: Темирлан, 36 лет, женат, 2 детей. У него среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. Главной ценностью жизни он считает благополучие своей семьи, процветание бизнеса и счастье детей. Благодаря целеустремленности, трудолюбию и нацеленности на результат, на сегодняшний день у Темирлана в хозяйстве есть 5 овец. Темирлан обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сомов (KGS) для покупки удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания фасоли и картофеля, часть средств направит на увеличение поголовья скота. Он намерен увеличить свой бизнес, что приведет к развитию бизнеса.
texts.en: Temirlan is a 36 year old married man with two children. He has a high school education and works as a farmer. The most important things in his life are his family's wellbeing, his business's success, and his children's happiness. Thanks to his dedication, hard working nature and determination to reach his goals, today Temirlan owns five sheep. He came to Bai-Tushum bank for a 30,000 som (KGS) loan to buy fertilizer for soil preparation and growing beans and potatoes. Part of the funds will go to obtaining more livestock. He is determined to expand and thus develop his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming, and to purchase livestock

loans.name: Srum

texts.en:
A 58-year-old woman who lives in Kratie province, Srum is married and has two children. She and her husband have been growing rice for 40 years, and they are fishing to earn supplemental income. She can earn about 7 USD per day and can save approximately 3 USD after deducting daily expenses. Drought leads her crop to produce lower-than-expected outputs; this is the main challenge for her rice-growing business.

Srum has been with VisionFund for two times already, and those past two loans, which were paid back completely, enabled Srum to provide family members with sufficient meals.

The entire loan will be used to buy rice seeds to plant and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that this purchase will help her to improve business, so as to earn more income to better support her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to grow in order to earn income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben is a 31-year-old married man with two children, who attend school. Ben has a retail shop that is his major source of income. He has operated this business for over five years; however, Ben has been affected by limited capital. To overcome this challenge, Ben decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance to boost his business. Ben has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX to add inventory to his shop. He needs to buy items like soap, sugar, beer and local gin to increase his sales and earn more profit, which will sustain his business and meet all his financial needs. Ben has hopes of expanding his business using financial assistance from Ugafode.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Isaura

texts.pt:
A sra Isaura tem 40 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 04 filhos, todos na sua responsabilidade. Negociante de profissão, tem uma mercearia, vende produtos da primeira necessidade. Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar tomate, arroz, cebola, acucar, oleo de cozinha e outros produtos para revender.
Ela  sonha em construir uma casa propria para confortar os seus filhos, pois, vive em casa da sua mãe. O desafio é trabalhar mais para poder reembolsar o emprestimo de ntro do prazo estabelecido.
texts.en:
Isaura is 40 years old, single, and the mother of four children, all of them under her care. She is a businesswoman and has a store where she sells essential products.

With this loan, she is planning to buy tomatoes, rice, onions, sugar, cooking oil, and other products for resale.

She dreams of building her own house in order to have a more comfortable place for her children to live, since she lives now with her mother. Her challenge is to work more and be able to pay off the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, rice, onion, sugar, cooking oil, and other products for resale.

loans.name: Steramaris

texts.en:
Steramaris is 54 years old. She is married and has five children. Her business is operating a food cafe and she has been doing this for 10 years. 

She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings. This is her sixth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy cooking oil and food items for the cafe. 

She will use the profits from her expanded business to meet her domestic expenses. Her hopes and dreams are to see her family well catered for.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and food items for the cafe.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia, 47, is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lilia has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 23 years. She requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a retailer living in Fort Portal, Uganda. With the previous loan, she managed to add more stock like water, salt, jelly and other items to sell. With the proceeds she was able to change the family's feeding menu, pay for health services and pay back the loan advanced to her.

Florence is still operating the same business, alongside running a tea room, which adds to her income. She is determined to transform her business into both retail and wholesale to explore the market more. Florence needs another loan to buy washing soap, sugar,salt and bread to sell.

In the future, she has hopes of constructing a good house for her family.

loans.use: to buy washing soap, sugar, salt and bread to sell.

loans.name: Feliks

texts.ru: Феликс, 51 год, женат, 3 детей. У него высшее образование, на протяжении 3 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, супруга работает в школе. Бизнес начал с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря непосильному труду Феликс достиг больших успехов и получает прибыль в сумме около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На сегодняшний день у него есть 2 бычка и нетель. Он ищет любую возможность заработать для своей семьи, поэтому решил развить свою деятельность и обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Феликс планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своей деятельности, также он хочет приобрести бытовую технику для дома.
texts.en: Feliks is a 51 year old married man with three children. He has a college education, and for the past three years has been farming while his wife works in a school. He began his business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to his tireless work Feliks has been very successful and now earns around 12,000 som (KGS) a month. Today he owns two steers and a heifer. He looks for every possibility to earn money for his family, so he decided to expand his business, and came to Bai-Tushum Bank for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to buy more cows. He plans to invest income from use of the loan into further development of his business, and he also wants to buy some household appliances.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to expand his livestock herd.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 45-year-old lady with 9 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She owns a restaurant as her business, which she started with a hope of raising enough income for her family. She hopes of constructing a good house in future. Rose has asked for a loan to help her buy food and a refrigerator for the restaurant. The reason behind buying a refrigerator is because her customers are demanding cold drinks.

loans.use: to buy food and a refrigerator for the restaurant.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is a bright and sensitive woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1991. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an emigrant. She is a business lady. She keeps livestock and breeds them to sell at the animal market.

After getting married she felt hard times in her life, because her husband’s family was poor and her husband didn’t work. They always had problems and misunderstandings with finances in the family budget. She set a goal to do business in agriculture. She borrowed money from her parents and bought livestock for breeding. Years passed and she achieved her goal. She has three head of livestock now. Her children drink soft milk every day. The rest of the milk she sells to local residents.

Unfortunately, she is sick. She feels bad. She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to be treated at the hospital and to buy warm clothing for her children. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to be treated at the hospital and to buy warm clothing for her children.

loans.name: David Jose

texts.es:
David es un empresario situado en el municipio de Lorica,  vive en unión libre con su pareja, es padre de 4 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad. 
En el año 2013 inicio su actividad como independiente, la cría de ganado porcino, la ubica en la parte trasera de su hogar tal y como se ve en la foto.
Su propósito con su negocio era mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, tener un ingreso sostenible y no tener que estar buscando trabajo cada dos meses.
David al iniciar su negocio lo hizo con un capital muy bajo, solo tenía dinero suficiente para comprar cerdos, ahora que tiene experiencia en la labor, quiere dedicar todo su empeño y esfuerzo para crecer, por ello solicita un aliento económico para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para construcción de cocheras que como ven los cerdos están al aire libre y pueden extraviarse.
El dinero será invertido en la compra de; cemento, palma, bloques (ladrillos), madera, clavos, entre otros.
texts.en:
David is an entrepreneur that lives in the municipality of Lorica. He lives in a common-law marriage and has four children, all of them underage.

In 2013, he started working independently, raising pigs. For this, he uses his backyard, as it can be seen in the picture.

His goals with this business are to improve his family’s living conditions, receive a stable income, and not having to search for a job every two months.

David started his business with little money; he just had enough to buy pigs. He is now experienced and wants to work hard to grow with his business. This is why he is requesting economic support to invest in buying construction materials to build pig pens. As you can see, his pigs live outdoors and could get lost.

He will use the money to buy cement, palm fronds, bricks, wood, nails, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy cement, palm fronds, bricks, wood, nails, and other materials to build a pen for his animals.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 31 years old, living along with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing metallic coins and pots for the many years. His practice is to buy metallic sheets, cut them into specific sizes and rounded shapes. After that, he welds the joints for giving it pot shape and then sells it into the market.

Nowadays, metallic sheet prices have inflated in the market, which decreases his purchasing capacity. This is the reason Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy metallic sheets and continue his manufacturing business.
Nasreen thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy metallic sheets for her husband's manufacturing business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old, and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a 46-year-old married woman with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Amy has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 4 years. She also earns money from pig fattening and selling rice.

Amy has requested a loan of 26,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, cooking oil, and personal care products. She has previously borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF.

Amy aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, beverages, bread, eggs, cooking oil, and personal care products.

loans.name: Analeza

texts.en:
Analeza is a 36-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a pig fattening agricultural business in the Philippines. Analeza has been in this business for 3 years and she earns additional income from selling food.

Analeza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Artan

texts.en:
Artan wants to pay for his daughter’s education; she is pursuing a master's degree.

Artan in 45 and has 22-year-old and 17-year-old children; they all live in the rural, southeastern part of the country. During the past 25 years, his focus has been on livestock; more specifically, he raises mules and then sells them.

“What I do for a living makes me happy. I love animals and mostly horses and mules. In our region these animals are considered the source of transportation, and almost every family has got to have one. To secure food for them, it is not cheap at all; it comes with a high price. However, I am happy to make as much as this activity allows me to.” (quoted from his interview while at the stable of the mules)

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's master's degree tuition fees.

loans.name: Merida

texts.es:
La socia Merida  se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, zanahorias, cebollas y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Merida works in the business of selling vegetables, and she is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead and provide for her family by this means.
She is asking for a loan to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions and pumpkins. She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her repayments.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions and pumpkins.

loans.name: Ma. Erlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Erlinda is 48 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Erlinda requested a 12,000  PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ma. Erlinda has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ma. Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and all seven children are attending school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Hilda requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Hilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize for selling.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy used her previous loan to buy more crates of beer, soda and cartons of water to boost her business. She lives with her five children in Kamwenge, Uganda and runs a bar as her main source of income.

She started the business with the intention of educating her children and improving her standards of living. She also earns extra income from farming. She hopes to have a modern bar and become a prominent business woman. Just like other business people, inadequate capital hinders all her intentions.
