Teddy needs a loan to buy more crates of beer, soda and cartons of water to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, soda and cartons of water to sell.

loans.name: Bukenya

texts.en: Bukenya has requested a loan to buy mulch for his coffee garden. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda with his four children where he buys and sells dry agricultural produce like coffee. He also earns additional income from food crop growing and selling local brew called waragi. He loves to be self-employed, buying and selling coffee so he can educate all his children but all this has not been possible due to inadequate capital. He believes the advanced loan to buy mulch for his coffee garden will help him out by increasing his coffee productivity.

loans.use: to buy mulch for his coffee garden

loans.name: Emedis Sofia

texts.es:
Emedis es una empresaria agrícola de 39 años de edad, una persona tierna y carismática entregada a su familia y trabajo, vive con su pareja en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos y un negocio de cría de cerdos en su hogar.
La cría de cerdos que empleo Emedis por necesidad económica ha representado un progreso en su familia, gracias a los ingresos extras, puede alimentar mejor a sus muchachos, realizar reparaciones a su hogar y así poco a poco ha crecido y espera seguir por esa buena senda.
Emedis pensando en la temporada alta de venta de cerdos que es en el mes de diciembre quiere solicitar un préstamo, dicho apoyo servirá para estar prepara y tener lechones para vender y sacar una buena rentabilidad para seguir mejorando las cosas en su hogar, por ello con el monto desea comprar cerdos, aparte de esto vacunas, vitaminas y alimento de engorde, le gusta entregar un cerdo criado bajo los estándares de calidad exigidos por las entidades reguladoras.
texts.en:
Emedis is a 39 year old agricultural entrepreneur. She's a tender and charismatic person who's dedicated to her family and her job. She cohabitates with her partner, has 3 children, and a pig raising business at her home. Raising pigs has been Emedis' employment due to financial need and it has helped her family get ahead thanks to the extra income, and she can provide better nutrition for her kids, do repairs on the house and this is how things have improved bit by bit and she hopes that things continue down this positive path..

Emedis is thinking about the peak pig selling season, which is in December, and wants to apply for a loan. This assistance would enable her to get ready and have pigs available to sell and obtain a good profit to keep improving things for her household. This is why she wants to use the sum to buy pigs, and in addition to that vaccines, vitamins, and feed. She likes to deliver pigs raised in accordance with the quality control standards that regulators demand.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, and in addition vaccines, vitamins, and feed.

loans.name: Cruz Marina

texts.es:
Cruz Marina es una mujer de 57 años de edad dedica a la confecciones, vive en relación libre con su pareja y es madre de dos hijos que depende de ella. 
Trabaja desde la comodidad de su hogar, tiene contratos pequeños que le sirven para complementar los ingresos que se necesitan para mantener su hogar.
Cruz Marina siempre ha soñado con tener una mejor calidad de vida, de ser independiente económicamente, generar empleo, asegurar un futuro para sus muchachos y sabe perfectamente que con los ingresos que tiene actualmente es muy difícil lograrlo, por ello quiere arriesgarse, dejar de temer al futuro e invertir en su negocio.
Solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de una máquina fileteadora e insumos, con esta máquina se le podrán abrir las puertas de convenios y negocios con empresas, que es lo que está buscando la empresaria.
texts.en:
Cruz Marina is a women who is 57 years old and is dedicated to tailoring. She lives in a civil union with her partner and is mother to two children who depend on her.

She works from the comfort of her home. She has small contracts which provide the income needed to maintain her home.

Cruz Marina has always dreamed to have a better quality of life, to be economically independent, generate employment, and ensure a future for her boys. She knows perfectly well that with the income she has now, it is very difficult to achieve this. Therefore, she wants to take a risk, stop fearing the future and invest in her business.

She is requesting economic support to purchase a sewing machine and materials. With this machine, new doors can open towards new agreements and business with enterprises, which is what this entrepreneur is looking for.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine. With this machine, she can have contracts with enterprises which require a sewing machine as a minimum.

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela, who is in her mid 40s, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been conducting a hardware business for seven years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Michaela’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy the fast-moving hardware to meet her customers' request. She dreams of becoming an international businesswoman.

Michaela will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan's scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy the fast-moving hardware to meet her customers' request.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John es un hombre de 53 años de edad, una persona que se encuentra sin empleo, pero con muchas ganas de trabajar y luchar por su familia, tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja.

John tiene una idea de negocio, ahora que se encuentra desempleado y que es un poco difícil de encontrar algún empleo, gran parte debido a su edad, desea convertirse en independiente y montar una empresa productora de alimento, pero para ello necesita capital, es por este razón que solicita un gran impulso económico para iniciar el negocio que servirá de sustento y será el motor del futuro de su familia.
Con el apoyo el empresario desea comprar dos licuadoras industriales, un enfriador, una vitrina, silletería x 4, realizar mejoras locativas al local que ven en la foto e insumos para empezar rápidamente a producir dinero.
Su sueño es triunfar en el negocio, mantener a su familia, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
John is a 53 year old man who is currently unemployed, but who is very keen to work and fight for his family. He has an 8 year old son and lives in a common law marriage with his partner.
John has an idea for a business, now that he is unemployed and is finding it hard to find a job, thanks largely to his age. He wants to become independent and set up a food production business, but for that he needs capital.
For that reason he is asking for a large economic boost to start the business which will serve as sustenance and will be the driving force for the future of his family. With the support of investors he wants to buy two industrial blenders, a fridge, a display cabinet, four sets of chairs and other things to improve the store which you can see in the photo. He will also buy supplies so that he can quickly start to make money.
His dream is to succeed with his business and to provide for his family, and he promises to pay his fees promptly.

loans.use: to start a business producing food. He will buy blenders, a fridge, a display cabinet, a set of chairs and other things to improve his store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Elizabeth has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 6 years where she sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. She has requested loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Karelis Esther

texts.es: Karelis de 25 años es una ama de casa residenciada en el municipio de Cartagena de Indias y desde la comodidad de su hogar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio en el año 2012, ofreciendo servicio de minutos y recargas, así mismo comercializa productos lácteos; leche, queso, suero y yogures. Ella diariamente apertura su negocio a las 8 a.m. con la finalidad de que sus clientes tengan acceso a sus servicios y a la venta de productos lácteos a primera hora de la mañana.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir su negocio con productos lácteos y paquetes de recargas.  Esta inversión permitirá que Karelis continúe más consolidada en su actividad y pueda continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia. Su meta a futuro es tener un local bien organizado y poder continuar velando por la crianza de su hijo.
texts.en:
Karelis is 25 years old and is a stay-at-home mom who lives in the municipality of Cartagena de Indias. From the comfort of her home, she decided to start her own business in the year 2012. She offers services in cell phone minutes and refills. Meanwhile, she also sells milk-based products: milk, cheese, buttermilk, yogurt.

Everyday, she opens her store at 8 a.m. so that her customers are able to access her services and sales of milk products first thing in the morning. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, which is the first financing she requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to stock her store with milk products and refill packages. This investment will allow Karelis to continue consolidating her business and continue providing comfort for her family. Her goal for the future is to have a well-organized shop and to be able to continue raising her son.

loans.use: to stock her store with milk-based products and cell phone refill packages.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are currently in school.

Anabelle runs a pig fattening agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. Anabelle has been in this business for the past 2 years, and she has taken out 2 previous loans from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Macario Alcides

texts.es:
Macario, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, actualmente está acompañado, tiene 3 hijos pero actualmente solo uno depende de ellos, su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos y su hijo esta estudiando, en su casa también vive una hijastra que estudia.

Macario, trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 31 años de experiencia en la siembra de maíz, también trabaja en la carpintería desde hace 26 años, esa actividad la aprendió gracias a su padre.

Macario, necesita el crédito para sembrar granos básicos y comprar 2 galones de herbicidas, 4 sacos de abono y 2 de formulas.

El deseo de Macario, es comprar los insumos a tiempo, para aplicar al cultivo y asegurar una buena producción de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Macario, who is 46 years old, has a third-grade education. Currently he is married and has three children, only one of whom is dependent on them at this time. His wife takes care of the household chores and their son is in school. Also living in their house is a step-daughter who is in school.

Macario works in agriculture and has 31 years of experience growing corn. He has also worked in carpentry for 26 years; he learned that trade thanks to his father.

Macario needs the loan to plant staple grains and to buy two gallons of herbicide, four sacks of soil amendments, and two sacks of fertilizer. Macario's desire is to buy the supplies on time in order to apply them to the crop and assure a good production of staple grains.

loans.use: to plant staple grains and to buy two gallons of herbicides, four sacks of soil amendments, and two of fertilizer

loans.name: Patron Santiago-Lamay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO-LAMAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Matilde ella es conviviente y tiene 31 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the 'PATRON SANTIAGO-LAMAY' communal bank. It is located in the Lamay district, which belongs to the Calca province in the state of Cusco.
Maria Matilde has a partner, is 31 years old and has 1 child. She works in her grocery store and restaurant, selling basic necessities like rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. Through her business she wants to get ahead as she is enterprising and hard working.
Her dream is to grow her grocery store business, and she is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.
The other members work selling animals, in agriculture, in a grocery store and in a restaurant.
Maria thanks those who help her to reach her dream by this means and she promises to meet her repayment schedule as agreed.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva lives in Piat with her family. She is 47 years old, married and has four children. She is managing a store for income. She manages her business well to provide for the needs of her family, especially for education purposes.

She wants to sell more grocery items, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, breads, eggs and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to continue extending good products and services to all of her customers. Someday, this will help her achieve income stability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, eggs and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Messil

texts.en:
Messil is 40 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Messil works very hard to provide for them.

Messil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home-care products, and other groceries.

Messil has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Messil would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home-care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Arpenik

texts.en:
Arpenik is from Metsamor town of Armavir region, where she lives with her husband and son. Arpenik trades in clothing and shoes from her house.

The business she is involved in is four years old, and a profit started to appear during the first year. Arpenik now asks for this loan to purchase new stock of clothing so she is prepared for September 1, the start of the academic year.

She requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her start-up business without success. Her loan request was rejected every time because her business isn't registered as a formal business. Arpenik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Arpenik to make an investment and get ready for a high-demand season.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of clothing so she is prepared for September 1, the start of the academic year.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 41-year-old married woman with one child who attends school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Daisy sells rice in the Philippines and she has been in this business for the past 12 years. Daisy has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries.

In the future Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosario, de 44 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos, el menor de ellos estudia y los otros dos trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos familiares, mientras que su pareja se dedica a la pesca artesanal en una laguna cercana a su casa.

Rosario, en su adolescencia le ayudaba a su madre a comprar y vender pescado extraído de la laguna; ahora que está acompañada, también se dedica a esa misma actividad junto a su pareja, ella también vende verduras para ayudar con los gastos familiares; la pesca la realizan en las primeras horas del día, porque en ocasiones sus hijos y pareja, no logran pescar lo suficiente y tiene que ir al muelle para comprar más pescado, para que luego ella pueda salir a venderlos casa por casa.- Rosario, también tiene que comprar la verdura un día antes, para tenerla lista para el día siguiente.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para comprar insumos pesqueros, trasmallos y otros instrumentos para que su esposo e hijos puedan extraer los peces.

Los sueños de Rosario son, apoyar a su hija menor para que estudie y que sus otros hijos puedan construir su propia casa, además desea construir su vivienda de bloque, porque actualmente donde viven es de lámina.
texts.en:
Rosario is 44 years old. She lives with her partner and three children. The youngest studies and the other two work and help her with the houshold expenses while her partner earns a living in artesan fishing in a lagoon close to the house.


When she was a teenager, Rosario helped her mother buy and sell fish taken from the lagoon. Now she is married and she also earns a living in the same activity along with her partner. She also sells vegetables to help with the household costs.They fish early morning because sometimes her children and her partner do not manage to fish enough and have to go to the dock to buy more fish so that she can later go and sell them door to door. Rosario also has to buy vegetables a day before in order to have them ready for the next day.


The funds of the loan will be used to buy fishing supplies, trammel nets and other equipment so that her husband and children can catch the fish.


The dreams of Rosario are to support her young daughter so that she can study and so that her other children can build their own home. Furthermore, she wants to build a house with bricks because where she lives now is made from metal sheeting.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies, trammel nets and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Nalen's Group

texts.en:
Nalen, 27, is a farmer who lives in the Snoul district of Kratie province. She is a married mother of a dependent child.

Nalen grows cassava to better support her family. To earn additional income, she works for others for a fee. Cassava was too unhealthy to produce good yields as it was threatened by pests. Moreover, the cost of paid workers is getting higher while the crop price is getting lower and lower. These are the challenges for Nalen's main business.

This is Nalen's first loan cycle with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic pesticides to protect her crop from the threat posed by insect pest. She hopes that the crops can be sold at a good price so that she can afford to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticides to protect her crop from the threat of insect pests so that her crop will grow well.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Ella es Romelia una empresaria muy inteligente de 58 años de edad que se dedica a la cría de aves, vive en unión libre con su pareja y es madre de una hija. 
Romelia al analizar su negocio encontró ciertas falencias que podría mejorar, para tener mayores ventas y mejores ingresos que caerían muy bien en su hogar ya que su principal sueño es no solo vender pollos para sobrevivir, quiere modificar su hogar, tener la oportunidad de viajar, conocer su municipio, su país, deseos que espera en algún momento  de su vida cumplir, también está muy empeñada en asegurar el futuro de su hija y cuando llegue el momento vivir una vejez tranquila.
Romelia quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para cambiar drásticamente su negocio, hará lo siguiente:
•	Comprar inventario de pollos para mejorar el escalamiento de engorde, en promedio comprara unos 50 pollos.
•	Adecuara un segundo galpón para crías, ya que solo cuenta con uno divido a la mitad y los pollos quedan muy apretados,
•	Compra alimento de engorde
texts.en:
This is Romelia, an entrepreneur who is very intelligent. She is 58 years old and works in raising chickens. She lives in a civil union with her partner and is mother to one daughter.

Upon analyzing her business, Romelia found several weakness which she can improve on in order to have the most sales and better income which will serve her home well. Her biggest dream is not only to sell chickens to survive, but to modify her home, have the opportunity to travel, and get to know her municipality and her country. She hopes to achieve these wishes at some point in her life. She is also very committed to ensuring a future for her daughter, and when the moment comes, to live a tranquil life in old age.

Romelia wants to request economic support to drastically change her business. She will do the following:

• Purchase an inventory of chickens to improve the scaling of fattening. She will buy an average of 50 chickens.

• Adapt a second shed for raising, since she only relies on one which is divided in half and the chickens are very tight.

• Purchase feed for fattening.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of chickens, and adjust a second ranch for raising and fattening chickens.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia Zenovia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras,arroz, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Zenovia continues to work in the business of selling food. Through this business she wants to get her family ahead in life. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, rice, chicken and meat.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, rice, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Raksa

texts.en: Raksa is a 25-year-old, married factory worker of a dependent child who lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has worked as a worker in a factory since 2014, earning around $6 each day. Her husband is 30 years old, and he works in a garment factory as well, earning approximately $6 each day. Raksa would like to buy lumber and zinc sheets to renovate her house, but she is short of money and needs a loan. This loan will help her have enough money to renovate her house and have a proper house to live in. For her future, Raksa hopes that she will be able to help her child in earning bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy lumber and zinc sheets to renovate her house

loans.name: Give And Get - N05Vthắng7Nbình Group

texts.en: Mrs Hải is 46 years old and she is married. She has been working as a farmer for more than 10 years. Hải lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market demand is low in this region and the income from this job is not high enough for her to cover her living expenses and to save money. The main hardship that Hải faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary equipment for farming in order to raise labor productivity. This is Hải's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standards. Hải is the group leader of N05VThắng7NBình, which consists of four members. With her business profit, Hải hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment for farming

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Rice is a staple food in the Philippines; thus it is always in demand. It is therefore wise to include it in a “sari-sari” (variety) store inventory if a vendor has enough capital.

Fatima, 53, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental is trying her best to roll her capital wisely, and she combines her variety store business with rice retailing. She is a widow with three children; two of them are already working abroad, and the youngest is studying in college. She’s a strong woman because she’s able to perform all her responsibilities as a solo parent for her children. Her business has also been very helpful in sending them to school.

Now that she is supporting only her youngest child and is slowly recovering from huge expenses, she wants to concentrate on developing her business. She plans to convert it into a grocery store in the near future. To make another step forward, she appeals for PHP 30,000 in additional capital to buy more sacks of rice, grocery items, and beverages for her variety store. Your kind generosity will help her a lot in strengthening her business.

She already availed herself of a previous loan from CCT Credit Cooperative, and she has been faithful in repaying it. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice, grocery items, and beverages for her variety store.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 60 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Nelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nera

texts.en:
Nera is 37 years old with three children. With her three children in school, Nera works very hard to provide for them.

Nera runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, home care products, and other groceries.

Nera has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Nera would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a father of eight children in Kamwenge, Uganda.

Gerald buys and sells coffee. He supplements this business with income from a retail shop. This helps him get income and care for his family. He wants to expand his business and educate his children but he is unable to because of unfavorable prices and seasonal changes.

Gerald needs a loan to buy more bags of coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married, 47 year-old woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Edna has a fruit & vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Edna requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen, opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar tintes, acondicionadores, gel para el cabello, lociones, cosméticos y otros productos importantes para mantener su salón de belleza funcionando.
Al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio ha podido atender a las necesidades de sus clientes, tiene menos necesidades familiares porque sus ingresos son mejores y tiene una hija más.
texts.en:
Carmen is choosing to request another loan in order to purchase dyes, conditioners, hair gel, lotions, cosmetics, and other products in order to keep her beauty salon running.

Thanks to her last loan, she has been able to take care of the needs of her customers; her family has fewer unmet needs because she has better income; and she has another daughter.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, conditioners, hair gel, lotions, cosmetics, and other important products to keep her beauty salon running.

loans.name: José Marcos

texts.es:
José, de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, no pudo seguir estudiando porque su familia era bastante numerosa y sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos para que él y todos sus hermanos estudiaran, tuvo 4 hijos con su esposa, pero todos ya están casados y en casa solo vive con su esposa. 

José, desde muy pequeño su padre le enseño a comprar y vender productos lácteos y cuando se casó, se dedicó a esta misma actividad; al pasar los años fue obteniendo más clientes y esto lo obligaba a trasladarse a muchos lugares para poder vender sus productos.- Hace dos años, con mucho esfuerzo logró colocar una tienda en su casa, donde vende productos de la canasta básica y productos lácteos, ahora se le hace más fácil cuidar de su casa y de su esposa, porque cuando lo hacia fuera de la comunidad, tenía que pasar fuera de su casa por semanas, porque no le era rentable estar regresando todos los días. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar productos como arroz, frijoles, jabón, detergente, pan, café, entre otros, para poder surtir su tienda y poder cubrir la demanda que tiene.

José, desea siempre poder trabajar para valerse por sí mismo y cuidar de su esposa y espera en un futuro tener una tienda más grande y tener más productos que puedan satisfacerla demanda de sus clientes
texts.en:
José, 67 years old, studied up to the fourth grade but could not continue studying because his family was large and his parents didn't have sufficient funds for him and his brothers and sisters to study. He has 4 children with his wife, but they are all already married and he now lives alone with his wife.
From when he was very young, José's father taught him to buy and sell dairy products, and when he got married he worked doing just that. As the years passed he accumulated more customers and this obliged him to travel to many places to be able to sell his products.
Two years ago, with a lot of effort, he managed to build a shop in his house, where he sells basic goods and dairy products. Now it is much easier for him to take care of his home and his wife, as when he did it outside of his community he had to spend weeks away from home because it wasn't profitable to return every day.
He needs the loan to buy products like rice, beans, soap, detergent, bread, coffee, etc. to be able to stock his shop and meet the demand.
José has always wanted to be able to fend for himself and take care of his wife, and he hopes that in the future he will have a bigger shop with more products to satisfy the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, beans, soap, detergent, bread, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products and meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is a 35-year-old woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena buys and sells spices in the Philippines and she has been in this business for the past 3 years. Rowena has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a variety of spices to sell. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell.

loans.name: Bandilina

texts.en:
Bandilina is a 38-year-old married woman and has one child, who attends school.

Bandilina runs a pig fattening agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past two years and has taken out 2 previous loans from NWTF to sustain it. Bandilina has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Yem's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Mondulkiri province, Yem is 35 years old and married. She is blessed with three dependent children, two of whom are in school. The remaining one is too young to attend school.

Cassava growing is really important to this family since it is the main source of income. In addition, in order to meet her family’s needs in a timely manner, Yem uses her spare time to work for others for a fee.

Being under the threat of drought and pests, the crops have produced very low yields, which is her main challenge that she has recently faced.

Now, Yem is leading a group member to apply for a loan, which will be her second loan with VisionFund Cambodia. Yem will use her loan to buy organic pesticide, to protect her farm from threats by insects. She hopes that the cassava will grow well and return good outputs, to sell at a good price.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide, to protect her farm from threats by insects, so that her cassava will grow well and return good outputs.

loans.name: Heim's Group

texts.en:
A 43-year-old mother who lives in Mondulkiri province, Heim has four children, two of whom are in school. Her family’s income comes from cassava growing, which she and her husband have been involved in for 10 years. To meet the family’s needs, especially the children’s education, she spends her spare time working for others for a fee to earn additional income. Recently, her crop has been unhealthly and it produces lower outputs than her expected.

Since she wants to support the family’s business, she formed a group of three members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. Previously, she has been with VisionFund once and that loan enabled her to afford to buy school materials and improve her living conditions. As the group leader for this new loan, she will use her loan portion to buy weedicide so that the cassava crop can grow healthily. She hopes she can increase her income to uplift the family's lifestyle and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy weedicide so that the cassava crop can grow healthily and earn her more income, which will enable her to keep sending her children to school.

loans.name: Donaldo Raúl

texts.es: Donaldo de 33 años de edad fue motivado por sus amigos de oficina a iniciarse en el comercio de mercancías, las cuales compró con sus propios ahorros y poco a poco pudo ir incrementando y diversificando su oferta de productos; relojes, bolsos y perfumes. Siendo sus compañeros de trabajos sus principales clientes les brindan facilidad de pago, aunque sus compras las realice de contado a almacenes reconocidos en la ciudad de Cartagena, por esta razón está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en una nueva colección de relojes, bolsos y perfumes, previamente encargados por sus amigos.  Esta inversión es muy significativa para su negocio, puesto que dinamiza las ventas, permiten reinvertir el capital y ofrecer nuevas tendencias. Donaldo cuenta con once años en esta labor, la cual le ha permitido brindar a su cónyuge y sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.  Su meta a futuro encontrar nuevos proveedores que le ofrezcan mejores precios y así tener una mejor rentabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Donaldo, at 33 years old, became motivated by his office friends to start his own business selling merchandise. He bought merchandise with his own savings and little by little, he was able to start increasing and diversifying the products he offers, including watches, purses and perfumes.

His main customers are his coworkers which offer ease in payment; however, he carries out his purchases by cash with well-known markets in the city of Cartagena. For this reason, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest in a new collection of watches, purses, and perfumes, which were previously commissioned by his friends. This investment is very significant for his business, since it boosts sales, allows him to reinvest in capital, and offers new merchandise.

Donaldo has eleven years in this business, which has permitted him to offer his spouse and his children a better quality of life. His future goal is to find new providers which offer better prices and therefore, will result in better profits in his business.

loans.use: to invest in a new collection of watches, purses and perfumes.

loans.name: Moving Forward - N08Bachètđôthóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoan is 61 years old and married with one child. She has worked in agriculture raising cattle for more than 10 years. Hoan lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. In addition, the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases in cattle happen, the cattle may die so she would have nothing to sell and would be in trouble financially.

The main hardship that Hoan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hoan has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the leader of the N08BaChèTĐôTHoá group, which consists of four members.

With her business profit, Hoan hopes to maintain a successful business, for her child to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pulseras y aretes,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pulseras y aretes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pulseras,aretes y collares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to work selling bracelets and earrings. Through this business she wants to get her family ahead in life. Her dream is to expand her business of selling bracelets and earrings. She is asking for a loan to buy bracelets, earrings and necklaces.


She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, earrings and necklaces.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Kea, 55 years old, is a farmer and mother with three children living in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 29 years. Her husband is a 61-year-old rice farmer as well.

Kea's three grown children are employed as garment factory workers. Together, they earn approximately $24 a day. Since her children spend a lot on traveling, Kea would like a loan to purchase a motorbike for them to commute to work. This loan will help to improve her family’s finances.

In the future, Kea is going to save money to build a new proper house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Her name is Bernadita, aged 54, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Pernilito, a tricycle driver with whom she has two children. They may not enjoy the luxuries in life but her family is happy and content for as long as they are together.

Bernadita has been a tricycle operator for fifteen years already. She has two tricycle units, one of which her husband drives and she has another driver for the other one. A tricycle carries about four passengers. In the Philippines, a tricycle is a common means of short distance transportation within a community. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to pay for maintenance of her tricycle and buy spare parts. She is praying for a positive response. Her tricycles mean a lot to her family for this is their main source of income to cover their daily sustenance and send her children to school.

Bernadita aims to acquire an additional tricycle. She wants both her children to get a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and buy spare parts for her tricycle service.

loans.name: Leonabel

texts.en:
Leonabel is 59 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leonabel has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Leonabel has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Leonabel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia lives in Kamwenge, Uganda with her five children and two relatives of her husband. She used her previous loan to buy more bicycle spare parts for resale and still deals in selling bicycle spare parts. She earns additional income from battery charging and rentals. She started this business to increase her profits and improve her standard of living. She complains of price fluctuation, competition and increased local tax rates.

She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Big Family Heroine - N03T10Qtháiqxương Group

texts.en:
Sang is 53 years old and married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Sang lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoá province.

Her family is a low-income household in a village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. In addition, there are many people also selling fishes in this area, so if she wants to sell more than others, she has to make sure to be selling good quality fish at competitive prices. This is not easy at all.

The main hardship that Sang faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fishes to resell so as to increase her monthly income. Sang joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution in 2014 to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Sang is the group leader of N03T10Qtháiqxương Group, which consists of four members. She hopes that her business profit can help her family to be healthy and happy, and she hopes for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more fishes to resell

loans.name: Anajean

texts.en:
Jheamae is 18 years old and the first of eight children in the family. Her mother Anajean supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Jheamae is studying for a bachelor's degree in elementary education and is currently on her second year of this three-year course.

Anajean is borrowing 6,000 PHP to pay tuition fees for her daughter for the first semester.

When she graduates, Jheamae plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Manuel Arnulfo

texts.es:
Manuel, es propietario de una panadería, vive en casa familiar, con su compañera de vida y una hija de 5 años de edad, distribuye el pan en la comunidad donde vive, tiene un empleado que le ayuda a realizar los trabajos, su horario es de once de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, aprendió el oficio cuando estuvo como empleado en una panadería.
Opta por solicitar un crédito con el que comprara latas, harina y manteca para hornear, aumentara su productividad de pan, pues contara con equipo apropiado y los materiales necesarios, además cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes.
Su finalidad es establecer mejor su negocio, generar más ganancias y pagar con puntualidad su deuda.
texts.en:
Manuel owns a bakery. He lives in his family home with his partner and a daughter who s 5 years old. He sells his bread in the community where he lives. He has one employee who helps him with the work. He works from 11 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon. He learned the skill when he was employed in a bakery.

He has decided to ask for a loan with which to buy tins, flour and butter for baking to increase his bread production. Then he will have the necessary equipment and materials and he will also meet the demand of his customers.

His aim is to better establish his business, to generate more income and to pay off his loan punctually.

loans.use: to buy tins, flour and butter for baking, to increase his bread production.

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал, 34 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Гулжамал на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы и 15 овец. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает картофель, кукурузу, есть фруктовые сады. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сомов (KGS) на проведение полевых работ для выращивания экологически-чистой кукурузы. Гулжамал планирует увеличить доходы от бизнеса и направить прибыль на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en:
Gulzhamal is 34 and married and the mother of four children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows and 15 sheep on her farm as well as 2 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and corn and has an orchard. 

Gulzhamal has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to work her soil in order to grow organic corn. She plans to increase her business income and put profits toward further developing her farm.

loans.use: to cultivate her land to grow organic corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood to use in the furniture shop.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is 39 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is farming and green grocery. She has been in this business for five years. She earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES. 

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy tomatoes, kales, cabbages, potatoes etc. for the green grocery. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to increase her savings to borrow a bigger loan next round. Her hopes and dreams are to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, kales, cabbages, potatoes etc. for her green grocery

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois is 58 years old. She is a widow and has six children. Her business is farming and livestock keeping. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

She earns a monthly income of 23,000 KES. This is her sixth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and animal feeds. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to service her loan and increase her savings to borrow a bigger loan next round. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and animal feeds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is farming and green grocery. She has been in this business for 17 years. She earns a monthly income of eleven thousand shillings. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy tomatoes, kales, cabbages, potatoes, carrots, and other vegetables for the green grocery. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan and also increase her savings to borrow a bigger loan next round. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, kales, cabbages, potatoes, carrots, and other vegetables for the green grocery

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 32 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has an internet café business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy computer supplies.

Jean has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a repeat customer of UGAFODE who benefitted from Kiva previously. He cannot thank the Kiva lenders enough for the previous support because he was able to roof and buy shutters for his house. He, however, was unable able to plaster it because of the high cost of the materials. He now needs another loan to buy paint cement, sand and paint to complete the house. With the completed house, Benon's household will be able to be accommodated well.

Benon is aged 35 years old and married with three children who all attend school. He operates a general merchandise mobile shop in Rukungiri town, which he operates on various market days in Rukungiri District. The major challenges he is facing are weather and competition since there are many people who deal in the same business.

Benon decided to apply for a loan so he does not have to affect his business cash flow by withdrawing money from it to finish his house. He hopes that with the available funds, he is going to have his business running smoothly and finish his house at the same time.

loans.use: To complete construction of his house

loans.name: St.ann Busanga Group

texts.en:
Judith is a member of St.ann Busanga. She is a very hard working married woman charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children in Hoima, Uganda.

Judith is a farmer, growing mainly maize, groundnuts (g-nuts) and beans. In order to supplement her income, she ventured into rearing cows, which has stabilized her income. Judith desires to expand her farm to meet the growing demand of foodstuff like maize and g-nuts. However, unfavorable weather changes affect her productivity. She will use the loan facility to set up a new coffee plantation.

loans.use: to set up a new coffee plantation.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras,arroz y carne y tambien sillas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Elena continues her business selling food. She is a hardworking member of the group and through her job she helps her family get ahead. She is seeking a loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat, as well as some chairs.

Maria Elena is happy to have this loan and promises to pay it back.

loans.use: buy chickens, vegetables, rice and meat, and also some chairs

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Juana Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de accesorios para carros,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de accesorios para carros.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ventanas,parabrisas y llantas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Elizabeth is continuing with her business selling car accessories. She is a very hardworking and enterprising member of the group. Her dream is to expand her business.

Juana Elizabeth is seeking a loan to buy windows, windscreens, and tyres. She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay it.

loans.use: buy windows, windscreens, and tyres

loans.name: Dufatanye Sub Group B

texts.en: Clemantine is the group leader, 43 years old. She is married with five children between 8 and 17 years old. The group is called Dufatanye, which means “Work Together” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change to a better future. She has a shop and has been running a business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Azucena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Azucena has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 34 ans, Afiwa est une femme qui vit à Baguida  pour exercer ses activités. Avec quatre enfants à charge, Afiwa  se bat efficacement  pour atteindre ses objectifs en vendant des produits alimentaires au bord de la route. Afiwa  achète toutes ses marchandises au marché et espère ce crédit pour commander des cartons de spiral anti-moustique, de lait  peak et de free touch  afin de pouvoir bien revendre et gagner plus de bénéfice. Avec ce résultat, Afiwa viendra en aide aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en: Afiwa, age 34, is married with four dependent children. She lives in Baguida where she also conducts her activity. She works hard to achieve her goals by selling grocery and household items by the roadside. She buys all her merchandise at the market. She is seeking this loan to purchase boxes of mosquito coils, Peak milk and Free Touch deodorant that she will sell, hoping to bolster her profits. This will help her to support some of her family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy boxes of mosquito coils, two cartons of Free Touch deodorant and three cartons of Peak milk.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is a constructor and furniture maker from Armavir. He has a workshop where he makes furniture and repairs different home appliances.

Artak is the father of two minor children who attend secondary school. He and his wife work hard to sustain their living and cover the family's daily costs. Artak has applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials that he needs to provide repair service and to make furniture.

He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his start-up business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as formal. Artak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Artak to have new tools that are vital for his work.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials that he needs for providing furniture making and repair services.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz,trigo y quinua,la socia es una mujer trabjadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos secos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz,trigo y quinua.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Bernardina, is still working selling dry grains such as corn, wheat and quinoa.

She is a hard working woman who is able to provide for her family through this business.

Bernardina's dream is to expand her grain selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy corn, wheat and quinoa.

She is happy with the loan, and is committed to meeting the agreed repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat and quinoa

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi, 54 years old, creates different sizes and styles of bags with the use of beautifully designed ethnic cloth, commonly known in the Philippines as “batik”. He has a great appreciation for indigenous people’s creativity and he strives to promote it by using their intricately woven or printed cloth as raw materials for his products. He distributes the finished bags to stores that sell native products. Sometimes he accepts bulk orders from companies that use his products as gifts to employees and guests. It’s really attractive to foreign and local tourists who usually visit their area.

Levi has hired three employees to help him, from the purchasing of raw materials to sewing, designing and marketing. His wife, Cecilia, is also a skilled sewer who lovingly assists him at all times. Despite some problems like delayed collection of payments, they persist because it’s their source of livelihood. Their employees also depend on it. Levi would like to enhance his business and buy a volume of raw materials such as cloth, zippers, sliders, thread, and other accessories for his business. Additional capital amounting to PHP 20,000 would be enough to meet his need. This will not only help him generate higher income and savings, but most importantly, it will endorse the use of locally made products and uphold the creativity of indigenous people.

Levi dreams for genuine happiness and a peaceful life with his wife and children. He wants to serve God together with them and his employees. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume of raw materials such as cloth, zippers, sliders, thread, and other accessories for his ethnic bag making.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 41 years old. He is married and has two children. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for five years.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He wants to include cereals in his retail shop and will use the loan to purchase maize, beans, peas and green grams to sell.

He will use the profit from his business to expand the cereal business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, peas and green grams to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 60 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alma has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alma has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains and a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, tiene casa propia y la comparte con su esposo y dos hijos, ella elabora totillas para vender, está actividad la desarrolla desde hace varios años y su horario de trabajo es de diez de la mañana a una de la tarde, así puede tener entradas de dinero para apoyar en los gastos familiares.
Requiere de un crédito para comprar maíz y leña tendrá materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas, podrá aumentar la producción para atender a nuevos clientes y generar mejores ingresos.
Sus objetivos son administrar bien las ganancias para cancelar su deuda y costear gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Sonia owns her home, which she shares with her husband and two children. She makes tortillas to sell, and she has done this work for many years. Her work schedule is from 10:00 am until 1:00 pm and this allows her to generate an income to support the household expenses.

She needs a loan to buy corn and firewood so she will have raw materials to make and sell tortillas. She will be able to increase production to serve new customers and generate a larger income.

Her goals are to properly manage the profit so she can pay off her debt and pay for the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood so she will have raw materials to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Diadema

texts.en:
Diadema is 52 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Diadema has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Diadema has been in this business for five years. In the future, Diadema would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher`is a very hardworking married man, aged 52, and the father of nine children, six of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into the business of buying and selling groundnuts and rice in 2008 in order to generate income to sustain his family. Christopher desires to expand his business more so as to become the main supplier of rice in his area as well as pay school fees for his children. He is only limited by inadequate capital. He is seeking a loan facility to buy more rice and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Giovanny Antonio

texts.es: Giovanny de 30 años habita en un barrio ubicado en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias y su cercanía al mar le permitió ser un apasionado de la pesca y disfrutar de los exóticos paisajes de su ciudad natal.  Diariamente antes de salir a pescar, él verifica condiciones favorables para esta actividad como la fase lunar, la marea, horarios de salida y puesta del sol y de la luna; con lo que corrobora cuales son las horas de máxima actividad de los peces. A partir de febrero de 2012, tomó la decisión de hacer de este oficio su propio negocio  y así ofrecer a su familia bienestar, él comercializa diversidad de peces y mariscos entre ellos, bocachico, mojarra, camarón y los que se encuentren en temporada.   Cuando no logra conseguir todo el surtido de peces necesario para su negocio en el mar y por sus propios esfuerzos,  compra a proveedores mayoristas, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar mojarra, bocachico y camarón.  Con esta inversión continuará ofreciéndoles a sus clientes el mejor surtido. Su meta a futuro es ser comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
30-year old Giovanny lives in a neighbourhood in the town of Cartagena de Indias. His proximity to the ocean means he can be a keen fisherman and enjoy the exotic countryside of his home town.

Before setting off to fish each day, Giovannay checks whether conditions are favourable for fishing: the moon's phase, the tides, time of sunset and sunrise. With this information he can then decide when are the best times of day for catching fish.

In February 2012 Giovanny decided to start his own fishing business and support his family in this way. He sells a range of fish and seafood such as bocachico, sea bream, shrimps, and whatever else is in season. When he cannot stock his business through his own efforts, he buys from wholesalers.

Now Giovanny is seeking a Kiva loan, his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy sea bream, bocachico, and shrimps. Using this money he will continue to offer his customers the best fish available. His goal in the future is to be a wholesale businessman.

loans.use: to purchase sea bream, bocachico, and shrimps

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José, tiene la necesidad de un nuevo crédito ya que se acerca la nueva temporada de siembra, lo invertirá en insumos agrícolas y en los gastos de preparación del terreno en el que cultivara granos básicos, espera que la temporada sea muy productiva.
 Manifiesta que al crédito anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para tener los materiales necesarios con los que sembró granos básicos, desafortunadamente el mal clima provoco que la cosecha fuera mala, su situación financiera es la misma pero lucha constantemente por salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan as the new season for sewing seeds is coming. He will spend it on farming supplies and on the costs of preparing the ground on which he will grow basic grains. He hopes that the season will be very productive.

He says that the last loan was very helpful in order to get the necessary materials to sew basic grains. Unfortunately the bad weather caused the harvest to be bad. His financial situation is the same but he constantly fights to get ahead in life with his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to invest in the cost of preparing the ground on which he will grow basic grains.

loans.name: Tegawende Homme Gonce Group

texts.fr:
Mr JACOB est le responsable du TEGAWENDE HOMME GONCE. Il est marié et père  de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 11 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis 09 ans et pratique aussi l'élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, Il compte acheter 05 sacs d’engrais, 06 boîtes de graines, et 01 carton d’herbicide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr. JACOB is the head of the group TEGAWENDE HOMME GONCE. He is married with five children ages 11 to 27, four of whom go to school. He supports a total of seven people.

Mr. Jacob has been a gardener for nine years, and he also breeds animals. He makes his purchases at the local market.

With this loan, he will buy 5 bags of fertilizers, 6 boxes of seeds and 1 carton of herbicide.

He plans to use his profits to pay for his children's tuition and to support his family's needs. His goal is to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of fertilizers, 6 boxes of seeds and one carton of herbicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his boda-boda (motorcycle transportation) business

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул, 37 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает поваром в Войсковой части. ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 34,500 сомов (KGS). Рыскул решила отремонтировать свою квартиру, в частности ванную комнату, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства приобретет ванну, краску, клей, окно. В будущем Рыскул планирует направлять свои доходы на дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Ryskul is 37 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has a post-secondary education, and she works as a cook for a military unit. Her monthly salary is 34,500 som (KGS).

Ryskul has decided to renovate her apartment, in particular her bathroom. Therefore, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS). With the funds she receives, she will purchase a bathtub, sink, adhesive, and a window. In the future, Ryskul plans to use her income to further improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a bath, a window, paint, and other construction materials for renovating her house.

loans.name: Maalimkan

texts.ru: Маалимкан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Маалимкан есть 7 коров, 8 овец, лошадь. На 0,88 Га собственной и 1,60 Га арендованной земли выращивает арбузы, кукурузу и перец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически-чистых арбузов и болгарского перца. Доходы от кредита Маалимкан планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Maalimkan successfully repaid her loan, using it as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with her financing.

Maalimkan has 7 cows, 8 sheep, and a horse on her farm. On 0.88 hectares of her own land and 1.60 hectares of rented land, she grows watermelons, corn, and peppers.

In order to continue developing her business, she has again applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer to work her soil and grow organic watermelons and bell peppers. Maalimkan plans to use the profits from her loan to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing organic watermelons and peppers.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
This is Julie Ann, 41 years old and single, from Polomolok, South Cotabato. She drives her own tricycle to earn some money to support her parents and siblings, nieces and nephews.

In the Philippines, single persons are expected to contribute to meal expenses, pay monthly utilities, offer transportation allowances, and contribute other sorts of financial support. As much as possible, she has to do this while saving for her future.

However, there are times when her tricycle breaks down and her income also stops. When it happens, she has no ready spare parts and tools necessary for troubleshooting. As a result, her tricycle will be idle for days.

This time, she wants to prepare early, and she plans to buy an extra tire, oil, a battery, and other spare parts. With these, she can repair her tricycle right away when sudden mechanical problems arise.

A loan worth PHP 10,000 would be of great help for her. She implores your heartfelt generosity to lend her this amount to ensure her continuous income.

She aspires to acquire another tricycle unit that she can rent out to a friend. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy an extra tire, oil, a battery, and other spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham, age 53 and widowed, operates a used clothing business to earn an income. She lives in a Palestinian refugee camp located in the northern part of Lebanon, and her business has proved profitable inside the camp. She lives with her only son, age 25, and they are among the many Palestinian refugees trying to adapt to this difficult living situation. 

Since the death of her husband, Elham has been doing her best to increase her income to provide herself and her son with decent living conditions and to help him build his future. In order to cut down business expenses, she has been running the shop alone, without assistance, since she opened it in 2014.
 
Elham is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,029,765 Lebanese pounds. This will be her first loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She will use her loan funds to buy additional used clothes to offer for sale in her shop. Elham is confident that this loan will allow her to serve more clients, and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey, age 60, farms crops and raises poultry to earn his living. He has been engaged in these activities for 20 years, and earns a monthly income of eight thousand shillings. He and his wife have two children.

This is Humphrey's third loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use his loan funds to buy chicks and chicken feed. 

He intends to use the profits from his expanded business eventually to open a shop. His hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Elsy

texts.es: Elsy es una mujer de 34 años de edad que encontró la manera de crecer comercialmente a través de la venta de mercancías en la población donde reside en Turbana; ella observaba que los residentes de su pueblo tenían que dirigirse a poblaciones aledañas e incluso a Cartagena para poder realizar sus compras de enseres para el hogar.  Frente a esta problemática ella encontró la oportunidad de invertir sus ahorros en alcobas, colchones, cunas, sillas, closet, mecedoras y demás enseres y adecuó un local del municipio en donde exhibe sus productos. Hoy en día cuenta con cinco años de experiencia y una amplia clientela, que encuentra a la mano todo tipo de artículos para el hogar a buenos precios y facilidades de pago. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará camas, sillas, colchones y closet, encargados a su proveedor en Sampues para posteriormente ser comercializados entre los moradores del municipio.  Esta inversión permitirá ampliar el surtido y con ello incrementar las ventas.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio para ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elsy is a 34 year old mother who has found a way of growing a business through the sales of goods in her home town of Turbana.

She noticed that the local residents had to go to neighboring towns or even to Cartagena to buy essentials for the home. Faced with this problem, she found an opportunity to invest her savings in beds, mattresses, cribs, wardrobes, rocking chairs and other things, and adapted a local premises to show her products.

She now has five years experience and an extensive clientele, who can find all sorts of products for the home at good prices and payment plans.

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, the first time she is taking a loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will use to buy beds, chairs, mattresses and wardrobe from her supplier in Sampues to then sell to the local inhabitants.

This loan will allow her to broaden her selection, and increase her sales. Her aim for the future is to expand her business to provide well-being for her children.

loans.use: to buy beds, chairs, mattresses and wardrobes.

loans.name: Marling

texts.en:
Marling, age 59, raises pigs to earn an income. She has operated her business for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She and her husband have eleven children, two of whom are still in school.

Marling requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Marling would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Tynara

texts.ru: Тынара, 37 лет, замужем, есть дочь. У Тынары высшее образование. С 2009 года она занимается сельским хозяйством.  Благодаря упорному труду Тынары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 14 овец, 2 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль - 31,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тынара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Tynara is 37 years old, married, and has a daughter. Tynara has a post-secondary education, and she has been doing agricultural work since 2009. Thanks to Tynara's very hard work, she now has 2 cows, 14 sheep, and 2 horses on her farm. Her monthly income is 31,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farm, Tynara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase her headcount of livestock. Tynara plans to use the proceeds from her loan to continue adding to her number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy some cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Franklin Esau

texts.es:
Franklin, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casado, solo tiene 1 hija de 3 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Franklin, trabaja en la agricultura sembrando granos básicos desde hace 12 años, también trabaja como ayudante de albañil desde hace 3 años, los conocimientos en la albañilería los adquirido gracias a un primo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una plancha para vender pupusas.

Franklin, sueña con tener una pupuseria grande.
texts.en:
Franklin is 24 years old. He studied up to seventh grade. He is married and has only one child, a 3-year-old daughter. His wife dedicates herself to taking care of their home and family.

Franklin works in agriculture, growing basic crops. He has done this work for 12 years. He has also worked for 3 years as a mason's assistant. He acquired his knowledge of masonry thanks to a cousin.

He needs the loan to buy a grill in order to sell pupusas [filled tortillas].

Franklin dreams of having a large pupusa shop.

loans.use: to buy a grill to sell pupusas [filled tortillas].

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira, age 42, is a mother of two children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market and is their family's only source of income.

Her husband needs to purchase a variety of new embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money her husband finds it difficult.

This loan will help him offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally.

Tahira is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase an embroidery machine and a variety of embroidery materials.

She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
