Noureen is a 30-year-old woman and a simple housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall. He sells different types of eatable items such as samosas, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, kebab paratha, etc. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Noureen's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Noureen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to increase his food stall business

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in the family of farmers. She is married and has two children.

Mavjuda is a light-hearted, honest and generous person. She grew up in the educated and behaved family.

After her marriage Mavjuda felt hit hard times in her life. In 2008 her husband had problems with his heart. Mavjuda and her husband flew to Russia to treat her husband in a special medical clinic.

Mavjuda borrowed money from neighbors to start her business in agriculture and she also keeps livestock.

Her husband’s heart is hurting again and she worries about his health now. She appealed to IMON and KIVA asking for financial support to treat her husband at the medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her husband at medical clinic.

loans.name: Sreynak

texts.en:
Sreynak is 25 years old, single, and lives with her family at Muk Kompul district Kandal province. Cambodia.

Presently, Sreynak is an accounting student at Vanda Institute in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She also teaches English.

Now Sreynak needs money to pay for her school fees, so she applied to Maxima.

She is going to pay money back to Maxima with her salary.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher has been a coffee farmer in Kamwenge, Uganda since 2000. He used his previous loan to buy farm inputs like seedlings, fertilizers and manure to boost his farm outputs.

Christopher is hardworking and he also sells produce in order to develop and educate his children.

He wishes to be a modern farmer but he is limited by inadequate capital and bad weather.

Christopher is requesting a loan to buy more bags of coffee, maize and millet to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, maize and millet to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 29, is a university graduate living in a Palestinian refugee camp located in the northern part of Lebanon. He lives with his parents and six brothers in a rented house inside the camp. Job opportunities here are scarce, and those that can be found offer low wages. Therefore, Ali decided three years ago to continue his father's career as a butcher.
  
In order to improve his shop's decor, as well as to buy new tables, butchering supplies, and equipment, Ali is asking for his first loan in the amount of 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He believes that by improving his shop and changing its decor, he will attract more clients to his business, especially since he keeps his prices very competitive in the area. 
 
Ali is an ambitious man, and he would like to develop his business in order to secure his future and improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy new tables, butchering supplies, and equipment, as well as to improve his shop's decor

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 45 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children.

Her husband has been running a tailoring shop in the local market for five years.

Farzana's husband needs to buy tailoring and sewing machine accessories. But, due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy these accessories.

Therefore Farzana has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to assist her husband, so he can earn more income.

Farzana is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is an ambitious Palestinian refugee who owns a dental clinic inside one of the refugee camps located in North Lebanon, He lives there with his wife and three daughters who all go to high school.

As a child, Hasan dreamed of becoming one of the best doctors in Palestine, but due to the war in his country, he had to move to Lebanon and work there. He is now 53 years old, and after long years of experience, he built a very good reputation among his patients for being extremely professional and trustworthy. Hasan's clinic is located in a strategic area, where he is surrounded by potential clients.

Hasan is asking for a loan of 4,111,000 LBP (Lebanese pounds) for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa in order to buy a new teeth cleaning and whitening machine. He also plans to improve his clinic's decor with the rest of the amount.

He believes that renovating his clinic will enable his patients to feel more comfortable visiting him, which will attract more patients. He will also have all the equipment required to provide all the needed services and consultations.

loans.use: to buy a teeth cleaning and whitening machine

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: Mère de sept enfants, Koko est une femme  mariée âgée de 43 ans. Résidant à Adidogomé, Koko est une revendeuse de produits ménagés en plastique qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Koko sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de plats en vue de réaliser plus de revenus pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The mother of seven children, Koko is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives in Adidogomé and is a retailer of various plastic goods, which she stocks up on once per month at the market and resells in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Koko is seeking this loan in order to purchase dozens of plates with the goal of producing greater income to help her husband see to the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: purchase 15 dozen plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds as well as fertilizers for top-dressing her crops

loans.name: Qasim

texts.en:
Qasim has had his own cafe business for 19 years. His father helped him learn how to engage in business. His work schedule is from six in the morning until five in the afternoon. He works alone. His business is popular in the area.

Qasim is single, and an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with parents in Bilasuvar region.

Qasim needs some money to buy furniture and some foods for his café. This he says will help his family.

Qasim hopes Kiva lenders will show support.

loans.use: to buy furniture and some food for his café.

loans.name: En

texts.en: En is a 60-year-old widowed mother of two children who lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She earns income from cultivating rice and has been in business for over 35 years. Her two children are working in a factory. En and her children can earn about (USD) $17 per day. En is lacking the money to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use. The loan would provide enough money to buy a motorcycle for her children.  In the future, she is going to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 57 years old, married and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business as well as pig fattening in the Philippines.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Mary Jane has been in business for five years and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor, age 40, is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amor has three children who attend school.

Amor has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, perfumes, etc..

Amor has been in this business for three years. In the future, Amor would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 33 years old, married and has three children, all still in school.

Elvira is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elvira has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Delia Emma

texts.en:
Delia Emma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Delia Emma is 52 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Delia Emma has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Delia Emma requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

Delia Emma has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Delia Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy garments, thread, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is a 52-year-old, married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Susie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Susie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Avlimé

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Avlimé est une femme âgée de 41 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Avlimé est une commerçante de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché et le revend dans un hangar et dans les quartiers environnant. Avlimé  sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de poissons fumés des sacs de farine de manioc afin d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit en vue d’aider son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Avlimé is a 41-year-old woman living in Adidogomé. She is a shopkeeper selling general foodstuffs who purchases her wares once per month at the market and resells them from a covered stall and in the surrounding areas.

Avlimé is seeking this loan to purchase baskets of smoked fish [and] sacks of cassava flour in order to have a large reserve and to maximize her profit with the goal of helping her husband [with] her children's education and the regular day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: purchase nine baskets of smoked fish and two sacks of cassava flour.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 52 years old and married with seven children. Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Emma has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 45 years old and married.

Ma. Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, cooking oil, and other personal care products.

Ma. Elena has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Ma. Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, cooking oil, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 36 years old and married with three children.

Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Sally has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for three years, and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Sally aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita, age 55, runs a general store business to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She earns an additional income from raising pigs. She and her husband have two children, and she works hard to provide for her family.

Nelita requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF. She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She will use her new loan funds to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, beverages, bread, eggs, and cooking oil.

Nelita's goal is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 55 years old and married with five children, one still in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, cooking oil and personal care products.

Elvira has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, cooking oil and personal care products

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Maricel has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Fabio Nelson

texts.es:
Él es Fabio es un hombre dedicado, amoroso, tierno y comprometido, tiene una familia conformada por su hijo de 6 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Su actividad económica es el transporte de mercancía desde las veredas hacia las poblaciones más cercanas, principalmente lleva alimentos, tales como panela, caña y fruta principalmente, con este negocio aspira a lograr comprar una vivienda propia para darle más confort y tranquilidad a sus seres amados.
Fabio siempre busca alternativas para mejorar su negocio, vender mayor cantidad de productos para aumentar sus ganancias. En el momento tiene pendiente en las próximas semanas un surtido de panela, caña, frutas y verduras, en base a este pedido necesita un apoyo económico para comprar el surtido de los productos anteriormente mencionados que de segura traerán una buena utilidad y podrá fidelizar un cliente más, que con el tiempo aportara al cumplimiento de su sueño de comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Fabio is a dedicated, loving, tender and committed man. His family consists of his six year old child and his partner, with whom he lives.

He works transporting goods from the local neighborhoods to nearby towns. He works principally with foods, such as cane sugar and fruit. With this business he hopes to be able to buy his own home to give his loved ones more comfort and calm.

Fabio is always looking for alternative ways to improve his business, selling higher quantities of products to increase his earnings.

Over the next few weeks he has an order of products lined up, including cane sugar, fruits and vegetables, for which he will need a loan to buy the selection of products mentioned above which will be very useful and will encourage further customer loyalty, which will in time lead to him fulfilling his dream of buying his own home.

loans.use: to buy cane sugar, fruit and vegetables to carry as cargo.

loans.name: Maria Rosmery

texts.es:
María es una campesina de 50 años de edad, una mujer imponente con gran carácter, responsable y fiel a sus principios, una mujer que siempre cumple con sus obligaciones. Siempre se le ha conocido por ser una persona que le gusta depender de otra, ella tiene todas las habilidades y cualidades para ser independiente y su negocio de cría de ganando avala lo dicho. 
Su familia está conformada por su esposo, que junto a ella trabajan para generar buenas oportunidades y un prometedor futuro a su hija de 17 años de edad.
Mirando hacia el futuro, con el firme propósito de crecer, de aumentar su cantidad de animales, de darle sostenibilidad al negocio, de ser cada día más competitiva, María quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de mínimo 8 ejemplares de ganado de levante, puesto que cuenta con el terreno y la experiencia para criarlos.
texts.en:
María is a 50 year old farmer. She is an extraordinary woman with a great personality. She is responsible and loyal to her principles and she always carries out her responsibilities. She has always been known for being a dependable person. She has all the skills and qualities to be independent, and her business of raising cattle is sure to be a success.

Her family consists of her husband, who, just like her, works to create good opportunities and a promising future for their 17 year old daughter.

María looks to the future with a strong intent to grow, to increase the number of animals she has to make her business sustainable, and to become more competitive every day. María is requesting a loan to buy a minimum of 8 specimens of cattle to raise, since she has the land and the experience to raise them.

loans.use: to buy 8 specimens of cattle to raise so that she can jump-start her career.

loans.name: Sy's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Mondulkiri province, Sy is 36 years old and a married father of three dependent children, one of whom attends school. Another one is under the age of school.

He and his wife, have grown cassava for ten years to support their family. They are also grow paddy rice to supplement their income.

Pests damaged his cassava crop, which results in reducing yield, which is the challenge. This will be Sy’s first loan with VisionFund and he is a leader of three-member group.

Sy will use his loan to buy organic fertilizer for his farmland to increase the productivity of his crops.

He hopes to have enough money to support family and provide his school-aged child with proper clothes and school supplies.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to increase the productivity of his crop.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, a mother of two children, lives and works in Vedit town of the Ararat region. Eight years ago, Flora started her home-based retail business selling clothes.
. 
Flora brings her clothing stock from Yerevan town twice a month and receives orders from her local clients from Vedi town. 
Flora seeks this loan to purchase clothing for women and kids to be prepared for start of academic year in September. In that season, demand for new clothing is very high and Flora wants to be prepared for the coming boom season to make good sales.   

Flora had repeatedly requested a loan from local financial institutions for her business but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because her business isn't registered as a formal business. Flora has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Flora to be able to meet the market demand.

loans.use: to pay for clothing for women and kids to be prepared for start of the academic year in September

loans.name: Kumush

texts.ru: Кумуш, 43 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. Образование - среднее. Она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Кумуш достигла хороших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 16,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Кумуш имеется 3 коровы, 15 овец. Также 1,40 Га арендованной и 0,90 Га собственной земли, где она выращивает арбузы, клевер, кукурузу, картофель, морковь и хлопок для реализации. Все накопленные средства стараются вкладывать в бизнес. Однако, в этом году Кумуш и ее семья решили отремонтировать дом, поэтому Кумуш и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Доходы Кумуш планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en: Kumush is 43, married, and a mother of five. She has a secondary education and raises livestock and plants crops. Thanks to her hard work she has made progress in developing her farm and began earning a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS). She currently has three cows and fifteen sheep. She also has a 1.4 hectare plot of rented land and 0.9 hectares of her own land where she plants watermelon, clover, corn, potatoes, carrots, and cotton to sell. She tries to invest her profits back in her business. However, this year Kumush and her family decided to renovate their house, and this is why Kumush applied for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy building materials. Kumush plants to invest her profits in increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and renovate her house

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 34 year-old divorced mother of a five year-old son; they live in the secluded rural area with Diana’s mother who is a retiree who receives a pension of $112 per month.

Diana raises crops and livestock to earn a living. “I work all day and doing agro activities is very hard labour, especially for women. I feel so exhausted that I can’t find words to explain it. I want to grow my business and make a decent income for my family and set aside some money for my child, so he can go to school and get an education,” said Diana in the interview.

Currently Diana's got cows and baby calves, goats and sheep. In the little land she and her mother own, she plants mainly food for the animals besides some veggies and grains for their own use.

The reason Diana is requesting this loan is to pay for some goats she got from some neighbors on a promise that she will pay the money to them immediately.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Umutuzo Sub Group A

texts.en:
Cosolee, age 38, is the UMUTUZO group leader. She is married with four children aged four to 13 year. The group is called means “BELIEVE GROUP” in English.

They sell different products and wish to expand their business to help create a better future.

Cosolee has had a shop for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more construction equipment to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more construction equipment to sell.

loans.name: Eryl

texts.en:
Eryl works hard to support her family. Eryl is single with one child and has a E-Loading station business in the Philippines.

Eryl requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional load wallet to sell.

Eryl has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Eryl would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional load wallet to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, age 41, runs a general store business to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for five years. In her store, she sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, beverages, snacks, and home care products. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy items to offer for sale in her store, such as sugar, canned goods, beverages, snacks, and home care products. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to offer for sale in her store, such as sugar, canned goods, beverages, snacks, and home care products

loans.name: Muong Phang 31 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hien, 28, is Thai lady who is married and has an eight year old son. She lives with her husband and her child in a small Thai ethnic traditional house.

Despite plenty of difficulties in life, Mrs. Hien has sent her child to primary school and always worked hard at agricultural production to provide better for her family, especially for her child.

She and her husband cultivate rice, breed pigs, fish and duck[s.

They have recently taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy baby fish and expand fish farming. She hopes that her investment will go well, especially with the constant support of the Program.

Mrs. Hien dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a brighter future for her child. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish and expand her fish farming.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 30 years old lady and a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a catering business for past 12 years. Asia's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandises e.g crockery, wood tables, chairs and tents etc for his business. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these items.

To fulfill the need of her husband, Asia has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband buy these items for business purposes. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support their family.

Asia is very Thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband's catering business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 48 years old and a mother of three children living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other income sources to cope with these needs. For this reason, he has decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. Therefore, Nasreen, his wife, has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables. Nasreen says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruits in bulk for resale purposes for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 55 years old. She is married and has two children. Her has a green grocery business that has been in operation for nine years.

Beatrice earns a monthly income of thirteen thousand shillings.

This is Beatrice's second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onion, cabbages and kale.

Beatrice will use the profits to expand her business and pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onion, cabbages and kale.

loans.name: Vilma Aleja

texts.es:
La socia Vilma Aleja se dedica al trabaja como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio para vender la ropa. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vilma Aleja makes a living working as an elementary school teacher. She works from 8:00 am until 2:00 pm. She has been in this line of work for eight years and things are going well for her.

Her dream is to have a business where she can sell clothing. She is requesting a loan to buy a television for her home.

She is grateful for the loan and she promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy a television for her home.

loans.name: Dúo Los Encantos Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS ENCANTOS
Doña Lilian Lucrecia es originaria de Tecpan, ella tiene 26 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad esta su hijo menor de edad, ella se dedica a la confección de trajes típicos y venta de materiales para corte y confección de ropa típica.
El crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo para comprar materia prima para su negocio, como zippers, botones, retazos, hilos y otros, ya que gracias a Dios los clientes le llegan a visitar en su negocio y le hacen pedidos y encargos de su trabajo y a veces ella no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para realizar los trabajos.
Ella sueña con  ampliar mas su negocio, ofrecer más   variedad de productos a sus clientes,  así obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mejorar su casa y darle una mejor educación a su hijo,ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para elaborar trajes tipicos para vender
texts.en:
DUO LOS ENCANTOS

Liliana Lucrecia is from Tecpan. She is 26 years old, and she has a minor child under her care. She makes typical clothes, and she sells materials to make typical clothing.

She used the loan that she received to buy raw material for her business. She bought things like zippers, buttons, remnants, thread, and others. Thanks to God the customers come to her business and make orders for her work. At times she does not have the resources needed to do the jobs.

She dreams of expanding her business and offering her customers a greater variety of products. This way she will get better earnings, and she will be able to improve her house and give her son a better education. She is requesting this loan to buy raw material to make typical clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make typical clothing to sell.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabjadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras,arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Erika devotes herself to the business of selling food. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who wants to get ahead through this business.

Her dream is to expand her business of selling food.

She is requesting the loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat. She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Efrida

texts.en:
Efrida, age 26, prepares and sells cakes from her home to earn her living. She started this business with an initial investment of IDR 250,000, and she has been running it for one year now. She lives with her husband Yosep, a 33-year-old bricklayer, and their four-year-old son Yohanis. 

Efrida's dream is to build a stable business that will enable her to generate more income for her family. She intends to use her profits to support the education of her son Yohanis, since she would like to offer him the opportunity to stay in school through graduation. It is this goal that has led her to seek a loan to improve her business. She would like to purchase a larger number of ingredients such as wheat, sugar, eggs, and butter in order to produce cakes in larger quantities. 

She approached TLM after learning that the organization provides loans for entrepreneurs like her, and she requested a loan in the amount of IDR 2,000,000. 

She thanks TLM and her Kiva lenders for caring, and for helping her and other members of her community.

loans.use: to purchase baking ingredients such as wheat, sugar, eggs, and butter

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de cafetin,la socia prepara sandwichs,jugos,empanadas y pasteles,la socia es una persona muy trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tortas,empanadas y pasteles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with her coffee shop. She prepares sandwiches, juices, empanadas, and pies. She is a very hard-working person who wants to get her family ahead through this business.

She is requesting the loan to buy sandwiches, empanadas, and pies. She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy 'tortas' [sandwiches], empanadas, and pies.

loans.name: Araceli Raquel

texts.es:
Araceli, es soltera, vive con su madre y sus hermanas, su negocio es vender golosinas, pan, bebidas y otros productos en su domicilio, tiene un horario de siete de la mañana a ocho de la noche, el oficio lo heredó de su madre y su mayor ventaja es que los precios de sus productos son accesibles.
Su negocio es de subsistencia y necesita de un crédito para comprar café instantáneo, azúcar, sal, aceite, detergentes, velas, etc., para surtir mejor su negocio y mantener los buenos precios para tener clientes satisfechos, espera que las ventas e ingresos sean mayores.
Sus aspiraciones son mantener su negocio y seguir ayudando a su familia para tener una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Araceli is single and lives with her mother and sisters. Her business is selling sweets, bread, drinks and other products in her home. She works from seven in the morning to eight at night. She took over the business from her mother. Her greatest advantage is that her prices are affordable.

It is a subsistence level business, and she needs a loan to buy instant coffee, sugar, salt, oil, detergents, candles, etc. to better stock her business and maintain good prices in order to have satisfied customers. She hopes that her sales and income will increase. She aspires to keep her business going and continue helping her family so that they can have a life with more dignity.

loans.use: to buy instant coffee, sugar, salt, oil, detergents, candles, etc. to better stock her store and maintain good prices in order to have satisfied customers.

loans.name: Lalaoarisoa Yvonne

texts.fr:
38 ans, mariée, Yvonne est une mère de deux enfants de 16 et 18 ans. Ces enfants ne vont plus à l'école actuellement. L'ainée travaille comme femme de ménage et le second l'aide dans l'exercice de son activité.
L'activité principale, source de revenu d'Yvonne est la vente de légumes mais à chaque mois de mai de l'année depuis 2009, elle fabrique des briques en argile avec son mari pour augmenter le revenu familial afin de pouvoir améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille. La quantité des briques à produire augmente petit à petit, et en cette saison, l'objectif est de 40 mille briques.
Chaque année, le revenu généré par la fabrication des briques sont toujours destiné à un investissement, comme l'année dernière par exemple, elle a acheté une rizière et cette année, elle envisage d'acheter une charrette et un zébu si possible. 
A part tout ça, le mari exerce une activité de vente de charbon en bois.
texts.en: Yvonne is a 38-year-old married mother of two, ages 16 and 18. These children currently do longer attend school. The eldest works as a housekeeper and the second child helps her with her business. Yvonne’s principle business and source of revenue consists of selling vegetables, but every May since 2009, she has made clay bricks with her husband to augment the family income in order to improve the family’s living conditions. The number of bricks to make grows little by little, and this season, the goal is 40,000 bricks. Each year, the revenue generated by the production of bricks is always designated for an investment. Last year, for example, she bought a rice field, and this year, she envisions buying a cart and a zebu if possible. Aside from that, her husband also sells charcoal.

loans.use: to rent rice fields and buy a bale truck

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de jugos, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de jugos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papayas, uvas, manzanas y naranjas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Judith continues in her business selling juices. Through her business she is moving her family ahead. Her dream is to expand her juice sales business.

She seeks a loan to buy papayas, grapes, apples and oranges. She is happy to receive the loan and promises to comply with the required payments.

loans.use: to buy papayas, grapes, apples and oranges.

loans.name: Sarum's Group

texts.en:
Sarum, age 28, is a cassava farmer. She and her husband plant, grow, and harvest cassava, and this has been their main source of income for six years. They also work for others for a fee in order to earn additional income. Their primary business challenge is the depreciation of cassava prices, which has led to a reduction in the family's income and a decrease in the working capital used to support the growth of their business.

Sarum and her husband live in the province of Karatie. They have one young son who is not yet of school age.

This is Sarum's first cycle loan with VisionFund. As the leader of a group consisting of three members, Sarum will wisely spend her loan funds on purchasing weedicide to promote the healthy growth of her cassava plants. She intends to place her expected profits into savings toward future needs.

She is hopeful that this loan will help her to upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy weedicide to promote the healthy growth of her cassava plants

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: stock up on 200kg of milk.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is 49 years old and he is an IDP (internally displaced person). He lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. He is a dairy farmer; he is an intelligent and determined man.

Nabi has experience, but he wants to develop himself in this job. He has started this work 15 years ago. He knows that being a dairy farmer is not easy job, but Nabi loves animals and natural life.

He wants to buy cows and a little food for them.

This will help him get some funds for his increasing standard of his living. For that Kiva lenders should support Nabi.

loans.use: to buy cows and a little food for them.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a farmer in Kamwenge. He grows and sells bananas as his main source of income. He also rears livestock for additional income. By diversifying his skills in this way, he is hopeful that he can develop into a prominent businessman in the area. His goal is to provide for the education of all his children. However, his intentions are limited by inadequate capital as well as by the banana bacterial wilt disease affecting many farmers. 

He is now requesting a loan in order to buy mulch and fertilizers for his banana crop.

loans.use: to buy mulch and fertilizers for his banana crop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to augment her capital and buy a large quantity of rice, flour, and palm oil to resell and earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavluda is confident woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is widow and has four children. She alone takes care of her children. She is an honest, kind and intelligent person. It was hard for her to work and take care of the children at the same time.

She has many years of experience working as a cleaning woman and a manager of a regional hospital. She has worked at the hospital for almost 10 years. Her colleagues, employees and friends appreciate and respect her.

She has persistent health problems. Also, she needs to pay her son’s higher education costs.

She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to pay her son's tuition fee and to be treated at the hospital. She hopes and awaits KIVA lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee and for her to be treated at the hospital.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is a cattle farmer. He has been rearing cattle for 14 years, and has kept the business running by supplementing his income via activities like crop farming, operating a milling machine, and selling spare parts. 

His goal is to better support his wife and family by integrating new, modern farming methods, which he also believes will allow him to provide the financial support for his children's education. However, he is challenged in these aspirations by inadequate capital, as well as by a prolonged drought, which has sometimes caused his animals to lack sufficient water and grass.

Asaph has requested a credit facility in order to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm

loans.name: Femme Group

texts.fr:
Mme JUSTINE est la représentante du groupe FEMME. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Mme fait du jardinage depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter 04 sacs d’engrais, 03 boîtes de graines et 01 carton d’herbicide.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne  acheter une moto.
texts.en: Mrs. JUSTINE is the representative of the FEMME group. She is a married mother of five. The eldest is 15 and the youngest is 1. Two of the children attend school, and she is responsible for seven people. Mrs. JUSTINE has been gardening for more than 10 years. She stocks up in the surrounding markets. With the obtained funds, she plans to buy 4 bags of fertilizer, 3 boxes of seeds, and 1 carton of herbicide. She wants to use the earnings from the loan to grow her business. She has the ambition to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of fertilizer, 3 boxes of seeds, and 1 carton of herbicide.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta primaria, debido a las pocas condiciones económicas de su familia no pudo seguir estudiando, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, de 17, 7 y 4 años de edad respectivamente, su pareja la abandonó y desde entonces ella ha trabajado para cuidar a sus hijos y que asistan a la escuela.

Ana, se ha dedicado a trabajar comprando y vendiendo pescado, pero cuando se acompañó se le hizo difícil realizar este trabajo, en ese entonces su pareja le ayudaba, pero después que la abandonó tuvo que tomar la responsabilidad de su familia ella sola y ya no pudo seguir mandando a la escuela a su hijo mayor, es por eso que él joven decidió trabajar para ayudarle a su mamá a obtener los ingresos para la casa.- Ana, en la mañana sale a vender el pescado a las comunidades cercanas, también vende verduras y otros productos necesarios para preparar los alimentos y por las tardes vende pupusas y otros alimentos que le puedan generar ingresos.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para comprar pescado, verduras y comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas, porque la que tiene es de su madre, quien se la ha prestado para mientras ella comprar su propia plancha.

Los sueños de Ana, son poder construir su propia vivienda, para no andar alquilando casa por casa con sus hijos; también sueña con que sus hijos estudien y se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old. She went to elementary school, but due to the economic conditions of her family she couldn't continue her studies. She is a single mother with 3 children aged 17, 7 and 4. Her partner abandoned her. Since then she has worked to care for her children and keep them in school.

Ana works buying and selling fish, but it has become difficult. Previously, her partner helped her, but once he abandoned her, she had to take sole responsibility for her family. She wasn't able to continue sending her oldest son to school, so he decided to work to help his mother obtain greater income for the home.

In the mornings, Ana leaves to sell fish in the nearby communities. She also sells vegetables and other products needed to prepare dishes. In the afternoons she sells pupusas and other dishes that will generate income.

The proceeds from the loan will be used to buy fish, vegetables and a griddle to make pupusas. The one she is currently using is her mother's, who lent it to Ana until she can buy her own. Ana's dream is to build her own house, so that she no longer rents home to home with her children. She also wants her children to study and be academically prepared.

loans.use: to buy fish, vegetables, and a griddle to make pupusas.

loans.name: Dynamique Group

texts.fr:
Mr SOUMAÏLA est le responsable du groupe DYNAMIQUE. Il est célibataire sans enfant et avec 0 charge.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis 05 ans et pratique aussi l’élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 06 sacs d’engrais, 03 boîtes de graines d’oignons et 01 carton d’herbicide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne  prendre en charge sa famille et acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr. Soumaila is the leader of the group called DYNAMIQUE. He is single, without children, and is responsible only for himself. .

Mr. Soumaila has been doing gardening for five years and also practices livestock raising. He buys his supplies in the neighboring markets.

With the loan, he intends to buy six sacks of fertilizer, three containers of onion seeds, and one carton of herbicide. He wants to use the profits from the loan to grow his activity. His ambition is to support his own family and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of fertilizer, three containers of onion seeds, and one carton of herbicide.

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
Amil, age 26, is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) living with his wife and child in the Bilasuvar region. He is a hard-working and respected seller of building materials. He has already built up a good amount of experience over the past three years since he started this business, and his goal is to continue to develop his skills and abilities. 

Amil would like to buy new, cheaper building materials to offer for sale at the local bazaar, so he has requested a loan for this purpose. He will use his expected profits to improve his family's standard of living. 

He is grateful to his Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials to offer for sale at the local bazaar

loans.name: Tegawende Pecheurs Group

texts.fr:
Mr LASSANE BERNARD est le responsable du groupe TEGAWENDE PECHEURS. Il est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. Le plus âgé a  18 mois. 0 enfant ne va à l'école et il a 03 personnes en charges. Mr fait de l'agriculture depuis 10 ans et pratique aussi l'élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 01 sac d’engrais, et 04 boîtes d’herbicides.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité et prendre soin de sa famille. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr. Lassane Bernard is the leader of the group called Tegawende Pecheurs. He is married and the father of one child who is 18 months old. He does not have children in school and he is responsible for three people.

He has been doing agriculture for 10 years and also does livestock raising. He buys his supplies in the nearby markets. With the loan money, he intends to buy one sack of fertilizer and four cans of herbicide.

He wants to use the profits from the loan to grow his activity and take care of his family. His ambition is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy one sack of fertilizer and four cans of herbicide.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a coffee trader in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more coffee, beans, and maize to sell.

His main business is still produce, but he has managed to develop and diversify more in terms of business. For example, in addition to his phone-charging shop, he has added coffee farming and a retail shop in order to earn additional income.

He has hardships of price fluctuations, seasonal changes, and inadequate capital, however, that affect dealers in produce, especially when they tend to do hoarding and also, they sell raw materials which are bought at a low price. However, his vision is to educate his children to higher levels and to own a wholesale produce store.

Patrick intends to use the requested loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea, 35, is married and lives in Kartie Province with her three children, two of whom are in school. Farming cassava is the family’s source of income, and working for others brings in additional money. She has taken and successfully paid off a previous loan with VisionFund, and it helped her to support her children’s education.


Sophea is also the leader of this group of three members. She has applied for a 5,000,000 KHR loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia to be apportioned among her group. She will use her share to buy weed killer to improve her crops’ yield. She hopes to earn more income so as to support her family and pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy weed killer to improve her crops’ yield.

loans.name: Gantungo

texts.en:
Gantungo has a family and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. In 1998 he started trading in cattle. He also sells waragi, a domestic distilled beverage much like gin.

Gantungo took out and successfully repaid a prior loan to buy cattle and waragi to sell. With his profits he was able to look after his family, buy a cow and pay back his loan.

Gantungo has applied for a 4,000,000 UGX through Kiva's field partner Hofokam, which he will use to buy more cattle and waragi to sell. He plans to further develop his ventures but lack of enough capital is still a challenge for him.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and waragi to sell.

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru: 23 летного самостоятельного парня зовут Сухробчон. Он из города Турсунзаде. Сухробчон молодой строитель. Он занимается этим делом 2 года. Сухробчон раньше занимался этим делом с отцом. Сейчас его отец уже вышел на пенсию. Он освоил все навыки строительства, и до сегодняшнего дня продвигает свою работу. Сухробчон хочет купить строительные инструменты для расширения деятельности. Есть строительные инструменты, которые они очень нужно Сухробчону. Он решил взять кредит и приобрести необходимое средство. Сухробчон надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This independent 23-year-old guy is called Suhrobjon. He is from the city of Tursun-zoda. Suhrobjon is a young construction worker who has been in the business for two years. Suhrobjon used to do this kind of work with his father. Now his father is retired. Suhrobjon has mastered the skills of a construction worker and has been continuing his work up until now. Suhrobjon wants to buy construction tools to expand his business. There are tools that he really needs. He decided to take out a loan for the necessary funds. Suhrobjon hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy construction tools

loans.name: Zamuka Group

texts.en:
Zamuka is a group led by Triphine who is 45 years old. In English, the group name means “Ride”. Triphine is married with six children aged 9-23 years. She owns a butcher shop and has been doing this business for the past three years. Her group members sell different items but they have the same idea for changing their life.

With the loan, Triphine would like to buy more cows for meat. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cows for meat.

loans.name: Nowa

texts.en:
Nowa, age 42,  trades in produce, especially maize and groundnuts. He sometimes trades in waragi, a local brew, as well. He started his business 10 years ago, and he supplements his income with cattle trading. 

He lives with his wife and child in Kagadi.

Nowa has a dream of expanding his business; however, his major challenge is the lack of enough capital to purchase enough stock to meet demand, since he has many customers in his community. He therefore requested a loan in order to buy maize, groundnuts, and waragi to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, groundnuts, and waragi (a local brew) to offer for sale

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is 25 years old and married. He is an IDP (internally displaced person), and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. He earns money for his family by raising animals and selling their meat and wool at a local bazaar. He has been working in this field for two years, and his monthly income is 900 AZN.

Rovshan is not not happy because his earnings are not enough for his family. Besides, he has a serious problem in that his wife is sick. His wife is suffering from a respiratory illness. He needs a loan to buy medicines.

Kiva lenders could assist him greatly.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилчон житель района Шахринав. Ему 37 лет. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Детям 14, 13, 8 и 1.5 лет. Одилчон спокойный, ответственный и активный человек. У него есть свой постоянный источник доход. Одилчон 15 лет изготавливает белую муку из злака и зёрен и изготавливает других мучных изделий. На фотографии снята Одилчон и его аппарат (мельница) который производить муки. Он трудится, чтобы прокормит и обеспечить семью. Одилчон хочет расширить деятельность  и увеличить доход. Он просит кредит для купли пшеницы. Одилчону очень нужно помощь. Вы можете поддержать его сейчас.
texts.en: Odiljon is a resident of the Shahrinav district. He is 37, married, and a father of four. His children are ages 14, 13, 8, and 1.5. Odiljon is a calm, responsible, active person who has a steady source of income. For fifteen years he has prepared white flour and other flour products from cereals and grains. The photo shows Odiljon and his mill that produces flour. He works hard to feed and care for his family. Odiljon wants to expand his business and increase his profits and asked for a loan to purchase wheat. He really needs help. You can support him now.

loans.use: to purchase wheat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Leuben Stephen

texts.en:
Leuben Stephen lives in Masindi-Uganda, and operates a retail shop selling general merchandise. His passion to serve the people in his area is the key reason that prompted him to start this business, alongside teaching in a primary school. The increasing demand for general merchandise goods has created the need for expanding his business.

Leuben Stephen requests a loan to buy shop items to sell, like cooking oil, sweets, biscuits and others.

loans.use: to buy shop items to sell, like cooking oil, sweets, biscuits and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar solution for her stitching business, to uplift her life.

loans.name: Artur

texts.pt:
O Senhor Artur vive com seu filho menor de idade e o seu irmão mais novo na casa própria é divorciado, trabalhador e com presente emprestimo pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: ( três portas, três arros ), para dar continuidade com a sua obra.
 O seu sonho é voltar a casar e aumentar o seu nivel de escolaridade mas, com um filho menor para criar não pode trabalhar e estudar em simultâneo porque, lhe faltaria tempo para cuidar do messmo.
texts.en:
Artur is divorced and lives with his underage son and his youngest brother in a house he owns. He is a working man and is planning to use this loan to buy construction materials: three doors and three frames to continue with the construction works.

His dream is to get married again and study more. He cannot work and study at the same time, because that would not leave him time to take care of his young son.

loans.use: to buy three doors and three frames to continue with the construction works.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.pt:
O Senhor Angelo vive maritalmente na casa propria com os seus dois filhos. Ele é negóciante por conta propria. Com o presente empréstimo ele vai adiquirir material de construção nomeadamente: aros de madeira, portas e tijoleiras para melhorar as condições da sua residência.
Sonha em ser um empreededor no sector de transporte abrindo uma frota
texts.en:
Angelo lives in a common-law marriage. He owns the house where he lives with his two children. He is an independent businessman.

With this loan, he will purchase construction materials such as wooden frames, doors, and bricks to improve his home.

He dreams of becoming an entrepreneur in the transport sector, and starting his own fleet.

loans.use: to buy wooden frames, doors, and bricks to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, such as water spinach, cabbage, tomatoes, chilies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy insecticides, herbicides, and fertilizers to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosario, de 32 años de edad, solo estudio hasta primaria, no pudo seguir estudiando porque era la única que le ayudaba a su mamá a generar ingresos para la casa; está acompañada, tiene 3 hijos de 8, 4 y 5 años de edad.

Rosario, desde que estaba muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar y a cuidar animales de granja, cuando se acompañó se propuso mantener esta práctica, tomando en cuenta las enseñanzas de sus padres; ahora tiene una granja de pollos de engorde, pero también se dedica a la venta de verduras, su compañero se dedica a la venta de pescado, ella los compra en una laguna cercana a su casa y luego las va a vender casa por casa en una motocicleta.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para construir una galera donde albergar una mayor cantidad de pollos y para comprar más pollos y comprarles alimentos.

Rosario, sueña con darle el estudio a sus hijos, también sueña con construir una vivienda, porque la que tiene es de lámina y tener una granja más grande.
texts.en:
Rosario, 32, finished primary school. She could not continue studying because she was the only one helping her mother to generate some income for the family. She is married and has three children aged 8, 4, and 5.

Rosario’s parents taught her to work and take care of farm animals when she was a little girl. When she got married, she continued with this activity, remembering what she learned from them. Now, she owns a broilers farm, although she also sells vegetables. Her partner sells fish, bought in a nearby lagoon. He sells it door-to-door to his customers, using a motorcycle.

She will use this loan to build a pen with a larger capacity, and to buy more chickens and feed for them.

Rosario dreams of giving her children a good education. She also dreams of building a house, because the one she has is made of metal sheets. She would also like to have a bigger farm.

loans.use: to build a pen with a larger capacity, and to buy more chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Joneles

texts.en: Joneles is 30 years old, and is married with 2 children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda, and does tailoring. She is honest and hard working and desires to expand her business even though she is faced with the challenge of competition from people dealing in a similar business. Joneles wants money to buy more clothes for sewing for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sewing for her customers.

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
Noureen is a 31-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Noureen's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not in suitable condition to buy the above these items for his business purpose. Therefore, Noureen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband with these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income. For this financial assistance, Noureen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his tailoring business.

loans.name: Luis Gonzaga

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre casado con 53 años de edad, trabajador, humilde y muy dedicado su familia. Su labor es la cría y venta de aves, un negocio el cual inicio hace poco y del que obtiene muy buenos ingresos los cuales son invertidos para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos, alimentos para los mismos y hará unos arreglos en sus galpones.
Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta lleva muchos años de construida y su estado actual no es el mejor.
Las actividades que realiza esta hombre para sobrevivir con los suyos son dignas de aplausos y es aconsejable prestarle el beneficio de apoyo que necesita.
texts.en:
Luis is a 53-year-old married man who is hard-working, humble and very dedicated to his family. His work is raising and selling poultry. He started this business a short time ago, and he is obtaining a very good income from it, which he invests in covering the necessities his household deserves.

He is currently requesting a loan which he will invest in buying chickens and chicken feed, and in making some repairs to his enclosures.

His goal is to continue working until he fulfills his dream of improving the conditions of his home, since it was built many years ago, and its current state is not the best.

The work this man does to survive with his loved ones is commendably dignified, and it is worthwhile to provide him the benefit of the support he needs.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed, and to make some repairs to his enclosures.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a skillful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996. She is single and lives in a remote district with her family.

Nigora is a student, studying economics part-time. At the same time, she sews traditional Tajik women's dresses at home. This activity helps her to support her parents because her family is poor. Her father could not work due to a persistent health problem. Recently, he began working as an emigrant in Russia.

As an older child, Nigora helps her parents. Her lovely grandfather has been sick. She tries her best to support and look after him. She is famous around friends and neighbors for the beautiful dresses she offers. She has appealed to IMON and KIVA to pay for her grandfather's hospital treatment. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her grandfather's hospital treatment.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne y tambien para comprar sillas y mesas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Gloria, continues to make a living in the restaurant business. She is a hard working woman who provides for her family through this business. The borrower's dream is to expand the business of the restaurant. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat as well as to buy chairs and tables.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat as well as to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel trades in electronics, especially solar panels, spare parts, radios and many others. He started the business in 2005 and he supplements his income with proceeds from mechanics. He started the business so as he can earn a living.

Emmanuel wants money to buy solar panels, spare parts and radios. He has a dream of expanding business, but is faced with competition from similar business operators. Emmanuel is at the age of 31 and a father to three children.

loans.use: to buy more solar panels, spare parts and radios.

loans.name: Marisol Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marisol, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, mientras que sus dos hijos están estudiando.   

Marisol, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 4 años, actualmente los proveedores llevan los productos hasta su casa, la tienda está abierta al público desde las 6:00 a.m. a las 7:00 p.m. 
 
Marisol, necesita el dinero para comprar productos como aceite, jabón, detergentes, frijol, azúcar, arroz; su objetivo es darles a sus clientes una mejor atención.

Marisol, sueña con que sus hijos puedan estudiar en la universidad; también desea mejorar la tienda y vender más.
texts.en:
Marisol is 37 years old. She studied up to the third year of secondary school. She has a live-in partner who works in agriculture, while their two children are in school.

Marisol has operated a small store for four years. Currently, the suppliers bring the products to her house. The store is open to the public from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

Marisol needs the funds to buy products such as cooking oil, soap, detergents, sugar, and rice. Her objective is to provide better service to her customers.

Marisol dreams that her children will be able to study at the university. She also wants to improve the store and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy products such as cooking oil, soap, detergents, beans, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey, aged 37, is married with two children and they both attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a bar mainly selling beers and sodas, seven days a week.

To supplement his income he ventured into mobile disco for hire and entertaining people around his area. His dream is to expand and develop his business, so as to attract more customers. He is only limited by inadequate capital. He is seeking for a loan facility to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a new client to the institution. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school.

She is a teacher and she has been teaching for 15 years. However, her salary alone cannot meet all her family's financial needs. Therefore, she decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (UGAFODE) for financial assistance, so she can renovate her house.

Catherine applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy building materials (i.e., iron sheets), nails, iron bars, sand, and stones, and to pay for labor.

Catherine thanks UGAFODE for financial support, which she hopes will help her work on her house. She thanks UGAFODE and Kiva for financial assistance and for continuing with that support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is a guardian of the family and manages the entire household. He has been running his own business as a juice wholesaler for past six years. He needs to buy juice cottons in bulk and other commodities for reselling purposes, but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these commodities.

Therefore Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband to buy these commodities for reselling purposes, to earn a maximum profitable income. This profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of the family and business. Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his wholesale juice business.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ice cream is a favorite dessert of many people, especially in a tropical country like the Philippines. It’s quite refreshing during the hot, dry season. It’s also appealing during the rainy season.

Ronie, a 57-year-old from General Santos City, South Cotabato, chose to venture into ice cream-making in 2004. He took advantage of the good supply of fruits in the area and used them to make delicious ice cream. In almost eleven years, he was able to improve his business and employ ten helpers, including vendors. Ice cream vendors are commonly seen with movable carts roving in different communities, either urban or rural. They use a ringing bell to call the attention of residents to buy from them.

Ronie would like to make another cart and employ another vendor soon. He also needs additional supplies of fruits, milk, and other ice cream ingredients. He is making an appeal for a PHP 20,000 loan for this purpose. The additional income derived from this loan will provide for his family’s daily needs as well as his children's college expenses. It will also sustain the needs of his ten workers.

Ronie is married to Marilou. They want to bestow a successful business to their children someday. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

(*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.)

loans.use: to pay for another ice cream cart and buy additional fruits, milk, and other ice cream ingredients.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 36 years old, single.

Leny is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Leny requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her ducks.

Leny has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her ducks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with three children.

She is in agricultural business, farming onions in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming banana.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emiliza

texts.en:
Emiliza is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emiliza is 42 years old and has three children are presently in school.

Emiliza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emiliza requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Emiliza has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 31-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and one child. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for six years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories, but due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband with these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income. For this financial assistance, Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his tailoring business.

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en: Sokny’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokny makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco se sigue dedicando al negocio de peluqueria,el socio es una persona trabajador y emprendedor,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tintes.liquidos de ondulacion y tijeras. (Francisco tiene otra opcion sexual). 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisco continues working as a hair stylist. He is a very hard working, entrepreneurial person. Through his business he wants his family to succeed.

He seeks a loan to buy hair dyes, permanent wave solution and scissors. [Francisco is transgender.] He is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the required payments.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, permanent wave solution and scissors.

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en:
Bahruz is 28 years old. He is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. Bahruz has a small business at his land. He sells basic necessities, like coffee, sugar and cooking oil, but he also has a flourmill.

He needs the loan to stock his store with more products, such as rice, beans, bread, detergents, etc, so he can sell more and make more profits. Bahruz hopes to have two flourmills at his house, to be able to keep up with the demand, and sell more in his store. So he needs Kiva lenders’ support.

loans.use: to stock his store with more products, such as rice, beans, bread, and detergents.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
With the help of the lenders, Erlinda was able to buy ingredients in making dried fish since it is one of the products that she sells. She was able to buy scrap cloths as well in making doormats. She want to thank lenders for the certain amounts as she prays that God will return abundant blessings back to them. She considered the business growing since her profit is also increasing. She thank God for the medium of blessings that she used and for the customers who are continually supporting the products that she sells. Indeed, if you trust in God, nothing is impossible.

Because of the increase of sales, Erlinda needs to as well add the quantity of her products. She needs to buy 50 kilos of Squid, 20-30 kilos different kinds of fish. All of those will undergo the process of sun drying.  That’s why she applied for a loan of P10, 000 for her to buy those. The amount will be of great help in the business if ever granted. She hopes that lenders would consider her story once again.

Erlinda regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy kilos of squid and different kinds of fish for her business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 52 years old and married with five children. Estrella works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Estrella has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is a constructor. He makes renovation work in his local Eghegnadzor town. He lives there with his mother and grandmother, and is the only breadwinner for their family. Eduard receives several orders during a month and works day and night to complete these orders on time.

He has now applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for construction work. Eduard requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business.

Eduard has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
