Eduard hopes to receive Kiva lenders' support and continue his work with new tools.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for construction work.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Amos

texts.es:
El socio Amos se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas, espejos y parabrisas para carros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Amos continues working at a business selling parts for cars. He is a hard working person, who through his work is moving his children forward. His dream is to expand his business selling car parts.

Amos seeks a loan to buy tires, mirrors and windshield wipers for cars. He is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the required payments.

loans.use: to buy tires, mirrors and windshield wipers for cars.

loans.name: Guluza

texts.en:
Guluza is 59 years old, married with 3 children. She is from Agjabadi. She is a retired but she loves working. She learned to work from an early age, starting with small capital as a farmer.
About three years ago she decided to open a shop, this time selling foods which are not available in small shops of the town.

She sells tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc and this has done very well. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock, because expects sales to increase in the coming holiday season. Guluza’s dream is to have a larger shop in the village where she lives so that she can increase her income and provide a better a better standard of living for her family. She requires funds to expand her shop. So she needs Kiva lenders’ support.

loans.use: requires funds to expand her fruits and vegetables shop.

loans.name: Emadolin

texts.en:
Running a “sari-sari” (variety) store is not as simple as others think. Emadolin, 60, has to wake up very early in the morning and sleep late at night in order to meet the demands of customers who sometimes buy as early as 4:30am or as late as 10:30pm. She needs to be patient indeed or else customers will brand her as unfriendly and they will patronize other stores. It is her only source of income and it supports her daily needs. Now that she’s already at her retirement age, she still strives to improve her business. She’s single and has no children to depend on in case of emergency. She can only rely on her own savings and some help from generous people.

Emadolin is longing to have additional capital of PhP 15,000 that she will use to buy more dry goods and grocery items for sale in her variety store. She’s aiming that she can save some amount from additional income that will be derived from these goods. She can use the savings as emergency fund in case she will get sick. She dreams of a longer, happy life without serious illness.

Emadolin is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods and grocery items for sale in her variety store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Evangeline has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more banana to sell to customers.

Evangeline has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more banana to sell to customers.

loans.name: Herminia Maria

texts.es:
La adversidad que la ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para esta mujer dejar sus sueños atrás y querer salir adelante, Herminia a sus 57 años de edad, trabaja en un pequeño taller de confecciones, el cual lo monto en la sala de su casa hace poco por necesidad económica.
Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, de allí se obtiene muy buenos ingresos, los cuales permiten cubrir la mayoría de los gastos que su hogar amerita.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de máquinas, telas e hilos de alta costura. Con esto espera aumentar sus ventas y de tal manera sus ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Las circunstancias difíciles por las que ha pasado esta persona y su empuje para superarla la hacen merecedora de la ayuda que solicita.
texts.en:
The adversity that has followed her has not been an obstacle for this woman to leave her dreams behind and want to succeed. At 57 years old, Herminia works in a small dressmaking studio which she set up in the living room of her house not long ago due to economic necessity. She has had great progress with this and obtains a very good income which covers a majority of the expenses that her home deserves.

She is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of machines and high fashion fabrics and threads. With this she hopes to increase her sales and her profit in such a manner. Her biggest dream is to improve the conditions of her home. The difficult circumstances that this person has been through and her drive to overcome them, make her deserving of the help she requests.

loans.use: to buy machines and high fashion fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is 57 years old, lives in Salt, is a married woman with three kids. She is seeking a loan for her son, who is 24 years old. He is a student in the university and majoring in Film Design, but she is facing some problems in covering the university fees, due to the weak economic situation for the family, but she want to see him be a very successful man in the future.

Sanaa wants to see her son achieve all his dreams, therefore she decided to help him. She applied for a loan to cover his semester fees, so that one day he can get a good job and be an important man in the film industry.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees, for his BA in Film Design

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn, age 27, is a married father of one child, living with his family in Bilasuvar region. For the last two years, Huseyn has had his own business selling different products, like perfumes, lotions, women’s purses, shirts, new jeans for gentlemen and cosmetics. He sells his products as a street vendor and also by specific requests from his clients.

He is requesting a second loan from the institution for 1,200 AZN with the purpose of buying new clothing and shoes to sell, and also to repair the fence of his house. His objective is to improve his inventory to offer a wider variety of products and improve his earnings. His goals are to establish a shop for his business and to support his child with her studies.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and shoes to sell, and also to repair the fence of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy up to date salon products to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Her name is Marlyn, 53-year-old entrepreneur from Polomolok, South Cotabato. She’s been operating her “sari-sari” (variety) store business for eighteen years now. It has gradually progressed due to her patience and proper handling of capital. But as time passed by, many other stores proliferated in their community and it created a stiff competition in the same line of business. Therefore she continuously tries many techniques to make her store stable and competitive. She converted part of their house into a boarding house and ventured into load retailing for cellphones. In this way, her boarders are her captured customers for usual commodities and cellphone load. Somehow her income helps provide for their daily expenditures and higher education needs of her children.

It supplements the income of her husband, Bonifacio, a carpenter. But college education is really pocket-draining, so she strives really hard to increase her profit. She wants to add sacks of rice to her inventory and obtain more supplies of grocery items and beverages. She is requesting for PhP 30,000 loan for this purpose. Part of the loan will be allotted to buy load wallet for her e-loading business.

In due time, she hopes that her enterprises will advance fully and give her family a comfortable life. Marlyn regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Billiah

texts.en:
Billiah is aged 29 years .She is married and has two children to support and she has been practicing small scale farming for the last 5 years earning an income of KES. 15,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals for spraying for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.


She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and the surplus to expand her business.Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals for spraying for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Leonilina

texts.en:
Leonilina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonilina is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leonilina has a general store business in the Philippines. Leonilina requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in iordto purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonilina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Leonilina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send  her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marlit Del Carmen

texts.es: Marlit es una comerciante de 47 años, habitante del municipio de Arjona en donde reside con sus dos hijos quienes son su principal motivación y dependen económicamente de su actividad de venta de mercancías.  Desde muy niña siempre le apasionó vender artículos, su madre fue su instructora puesto que era comerciante, cuando se hizo una mujer independiente viajo al vecino país de Venezuela en donde estuvo por un prolongado tiempo y hace tres años retornó a Colombia en donde inició su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, calzado, prendas de vestir y medicamentos.  Su capital es muy escaso para cumplir con la demanda de pedidos, sin embargo está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en prendas de vestir y calzado.  Marlit tiene como meta a futuro adquirir un local grande y bien surtido.  Sus metas familiares son ahorrar para vacacionar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marlit is a 47-year-old retailer and resident of the Arjona municipality where she lives with her two children who are her main motivation and depend economically on her business of selling goods.

From very young, she was always passionate about selling items. Her mother was her instructor because she was a trader. When Marlit became an independent woman, she traveled to the neighboring country of Venezuela where she was for a long time. Three years ago, she returned to Colombia where she started her business of beauty products, footwear, clothing, and medicines sales. Her capital is too short to meet the demand of orders; however, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation] which will invest in clothing and footwear.

Marlit aims, as a future goal, to acquire a large and well-stocked business place. Her family goals are to save money to vacation with her children.

loans.use: to invest in clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José es un hombre con 56 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde, padre de cuatro hijos ya mayores de edad, los cuales adora con toda su alma. Su trabajo es la cría y venta de aves, labora todos los días durante 7 horas diarias.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de aves y hará un nuevo galpón.
La adversidad que lo ha perseguido  no ha sido obstáculo para este hombre querer rendirse y dejar atrás el sueño de dejarle el negocio a sus hijos.
Con su aporte este hombre podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
José is a hardworking and humble 56 year old man. He is the father of four adult children that he loves with all of his heart. He works raising and selling birds, which he does everyday for about seven hours a day.

José is seeing a loan to purchase birds and build a new barn. The adversity that has followed him has not stopped him from chasing his dream of leaving the business to his children. With your help, this man can make his dreams a reality, and he encourages you to make a loan.

loans.use: purchase birds and build a new barn.

loans.name: Chanvoeun's Group

texts.en:
Chanvoeun, 55, is divorced woman and lives in Battambang province. As a mother of five children, two of whom are depending on her. She supports the family through growing rice as the main source of income and has been involved in this business for ten years. Besides this, she spends her leisure time to works for others for a fee in order to earn additional income.

Lack of working capital is the major obstacle for her cassava farming business for this season. Therefore, she forms a group of three members to apply for a loan and this is her first cycle with VisionFund. Chanvoeun, who is the group leader, will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the farmland and take the rest of money to pay for the plowing fees. Her hope is to generate more income so that she can afford to buy more organic fertilizer to better support the farmland for next season.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to enhance her crop so that she can increase her income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubinais a 33-year-old mother of four children living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles, such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and up to now his business has been very steady.

Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.
Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools.
Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy spare parts and cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.
Rubina hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and some cutting tools for her husband's spare parts manufacturing business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is in the fishing business, and she also sells the fish she catches. She is married and her husband is a mason. Isabel needs a loan to buy a new and bigger fishing net to work better.

She is the mother of six children and all of them are going to school. Isabel would like to have a house at Achacachi for her entire family. The house where she lives is too small for her family, but at least she and her husband are the owners. In the picture, Isabel is showing us the boat she uses to go fishing.

loans.use: to buy a new and bigger fishing net.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a widow. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home to meet their day-to-day expenses. Safia is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing a difficulty in meeting daily business expenses. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch more dresses on time. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch more dresses on time.

loans.name: Kuña Maravillas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Maravilla integrado  por mujeres muy trabajadoras que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en equipo y por medio de las capacitaciones a través de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Juana quien se dedica a la Venta de Comidas tales como: Chipas, Bombas de mandioca, entre otros, comenta que le está yendo muy bien gracias al trabajo que viene haciendo, y con el mantiene a su familia, dándoles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer comidas, como mandioca, carne, condimentos, y otros, y otros, de manera a poder seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Maravilla group is made up of very hard working women who come together in order to help their families by working in teams and through trainings given by la Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members is Juana, who makes a living selling foods such as chipas (cheesy buns) and bombas de mandioca (manioc croquettes), among others. It is said that she does very well, thanks to the work she puts in. This is how she supports her family, providing them a life with dignity and without hardship. She seeks this loan to buy ingredients to make food, such as manioc flour, meat, condiments and others. In this way she will be able to continue working and fighting, just as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food, such as manioc flour, meat, condiments, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase supplies to make food, such as, vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, and others.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a responsible mother of three children, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 4 years. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi, because its current condition is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis.

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Nazia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Nazia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nazia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Nazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Rayhon

texts.en:
Rayhon was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is married and has two children. She has eight years of work experience keeping livestock and breeding them for further selling. She knows well how to take care after livestock. She is willing to buy the apparatus for milk. She wants to offer milk to local residents.

The reason of asking a loan from IMON is her daughter’s illness. More than half of her income is spent on her daughter’s treatment. She needs to treat her quickly at a medical clinic. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support. She worries and hopes her daughter will be healed.

loans.use: to treat her daughter at a medical clinic.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 54 years old, is married and supports three children. He has been a small scale farmer for the last 7 years earning an income of KES12,000 per month.

He has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision fund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and the surplus to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and improve family standards.

loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops, to enhance quality and improved yields.

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias a 58-year-old married man with six children, used the previous loan to hire labor and buy more produce such as beans, groundnuts and maize to sell in Hoima, Uganda. On realizing tangible benefits from his business, he managed to expand his produce store and transform his family's life style. For seven years, he has been operating a produce business dealing in maize, beans and groundnuts with the aim of earning daily income for the smooth running of his family. He also deals in rearing pigs to supplement the income from produce in order to pay school fees.

His dream is to develop his business and to supply to the city markets with better prices. Deogratias is requesting a loan to buy beans, groundnuts and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, groundnuts and maize to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 34, is engaged in “sari-sari” or variety store business in her community in General Santos City, South Cotabato. She sells various commodities that are essential to everyday living of the people in their area. These include toiletries, snacks, canned goods, condiments, and many others. Basically, Myrna earns enough to provide some of their basic needs but there are times that it’s not sufficient. Thus she adds rice, vegetables, charcoal, and brooms in her inventory to augment her income.

Aside from these, she ventured into load retailing or electronic load for cellphones. It is also a viable business because most cellphone owners use the prepaid plan and only few subscribe to postpaid plan. In prepaid arrangement, a person can budget his load usage because he can buy a 10-peso worth of load. Myrna and her husband, Rodolfo, a driver, work persistently to raise their children well. They are not contented to just make a daily living because they aspire to save more for the future.

With this forward-looking mindset, Myrna wants to make her business more profitable. She would like to avail of a loan amounting to PhP 15,000 to buy more supplies for her store. She will also set aside some amount for her e-loading business. She is hoping that additional income from this loan will not only sustain their everyday needs, but will also boost her savings for her children’s education. Someday she wants to see her children with a college diploma and stable career. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her store

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida es una emprendedora microempresaria que inició su negocio de tienda de víveres y abarrotes al palpar la oportunidad que había entre su comunidad, al no tener un negocio de este formato a su disposición.  Fue así como esta Viuda y madre de tres hijos con un gran espíritu de superación hace 13 años inició su negocio en un barrio del municipio de Cartagena de Indias, obteniendo los resultados esperados.  Todos los días a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. los residentes del sector pueden realizar sus compras de la canasta familiar; arroz, aceite, legumbre, productos de aseo personal y demás. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en víveres y abarrotes, compras que realizara en el mercado de Bazurto. Esta inversión permitirá que cumpla con su meta de mantener bien surtido su negocio y así poder obtener la rentabilidad esperada.
texts.en:
Zaida is an enterprising small business owner who opened a grocery store after noticing the opportunity in her community, as there was no grocery store in the area. Thirteen years ago, this widowed mother of three, with a great desire to get ahead, started this successful business in a neighborhood of the city of Cartagena de Indias.Everyday, from 7am to 9pm, the residents of this area are able to purchase basic goods, such as: rice, oil, beans, personal hygiene products, etc.

Zaida is currently applying for her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase food and groceries. These purchases will allow her to reach her goal of maintaining a well-stocked business and generating her desired profit.

loans.use: purchase food and groceries.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is 26 years old woman, and mother of 1 child, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession, her husband sells fruits e.g. apples, bananas, arapes etc.

Sidra's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn the maximum profit. But due to anunfavorable financial position, her husband is not able to purchase fruits for his business.

Therefore Sidra has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Nongnokkhian Group

texts.en: Bao’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Bao and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Bao and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Bao’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jejie

texts.en:
Jejie is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jejie is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jejie has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Jejie requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Jejie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Jejie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Mukhtiar

texts.en:
Mukhtiar is 34 years old and married. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income.

She needs to improve her business to pay for her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use the loan to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jeison Isad

texts.es:
Jeison es un hombre soltero con 24 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde, su labor es la cría y venta de ganado, un negocio heredado por su familia.
Obtiene muy buenos ingresos los cuales son invertidos en sus estudios y los gastos básicos que su hogar amerita.
Trabaja con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando y su estado actual no es el mejor.
Con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ganancias, Jeison se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos de cría.
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de progresar permiten ver, en este hombre, unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Jeison is a 24-year-old, single, hardworking and humble man. His activities consist in breeding and selling livestock, a business inherited from his family.

He gets good incomes which he invests in his studies and in the basic household expenses. He works with the purpose of improving his house, since it has deteriorated over time and its current state is not the best.

With the purpose of improving his sales and increasing his earnings, Jeison is requesting a loan that he will use to buy pigs for breeding.

His positive attitude and wishes to progress show that this man is highly motivated to get ahead, and he hopes to get a favorable answer to his request.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Mardy

texts.en:
The region of Mindanao in the Philippines has fertile land and favorable weather which is conducive for farming. Fruits and vegetables grow well because typhoons seldom visit the area. 

Mardy, 39, is selling fruits in one of the markets in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. As of now she offers mangoes and watermelon but hopes to add durian soon. The profits derived from her business helps provide for the basic needs of her family. However, the risk that she faces is the possibility of rotting if her fruits are not sold on time. Somehow, Mardy has learned the trade tips from her five years of experience in fruit vending. Now she desires to buy more fruits to display in her stall in order to attract more buyers. Aside from this, she plans to repair the roof of her stall to adapt in the rainy season. She implores your kind support to make these things possible. A loan worth PhP 10,000 will surely go a long way. May you be God’s blessing to her as she aspires to improve her business. 

Mardy is married to Narciso, a small businessman, and they have children who are studying. They work together towards their goal to uplift their lives and complete their children’s education.
 
She is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to display on her stall.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam used the previous loan to buy cement and sand and to pay for labor. She has ambitions of being a known land lord in her area with many rental houses. This is a business she started with a hope of raising more income for her family. She hopes to build many more rentals in order to gain more income. The unfortunate bit of her business is that Miriam is challenged by tenants who do not submit their rent on time.

She thanks Kiva and Hofokam who have enabled her to attain a number of rental houses and also improve on her standards of living. She has requested a loan to buy materials and plaster her house.

loans.use: to buy materials and plaster her house

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 35-year-old married woman who has four children. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruit from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

Her husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruit every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made with fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he could sell the maximum amount of fruit till evening and get maximum reward for his efforts.

Shamshad applied for a loan so that her husband can purchase more fruit and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of fresh and seasonal fruit for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Crispin

texts.es:
El Sr. Crispín tiene 67 años, está casado con la Sra. Mercedes, viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá, Don Crispín  proviene de una familia que se dedica netamente a la construcción,  desde muy joven acompañó a su padre como ayudante de albañil, así de apoco comenzó a trabajar solo, hoy en día ya tiene contrato de obra muy importante en la zona. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo, sus hijos ya son todos profesionales. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una mezcladora que le hace falta para su trabajo, para poder cumplir a cabalidad con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Crispin is 67 years old, and is married to Mercedes. They live in the city of Carapeguá. Crispin comes from a family that is completely dedicated to construction. Since he was very young, he accompanied his father as a mason's helper, and little by little began to work alone. Today he has very important work engagements in the area.

Thanks to his work and effort, all of his children are professionals. He seeks a loan to buy a cement mixer that he needs for work, in order to fully carry out his customers orders.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en: Proscovia Lives in Hoima Uganda. She is aged 57, married and a hard working woman charged with the responsibility of taking care of 3 children. She operates a retail shop mainly selling salt, sugar and cooking oil. She desires to grow and expand her business, as well as improving the standards of living for her family. She is seeking for credit to buy more salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.en:
Her name is Eduviges, 52 years old, resident of Las Pinas City, Philippines. She is married to Aladar, a driver. Although they have no children, Eduviges is thankful that she has a hardworking and loving husband. Life may be hard but God has been faithful to the couple.

Eduviges owns and oversees operation of her jeepney service. She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) of jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common and cheapest form of public transport throughout the many islands of the Philippines. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the second World War. The Filipinos saw possibilities to make out of these jeeps. They saw a real transportation means by making these jeeps about two meters longer and by putting two long seats in them, one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses to transport of people, goods, and even sometimes little animals.

To help her continue operations of her business, Eduviges is requesting a PHP 25000 loan which she will use to pay for spare parts like tires for her jeepney. It is very important that her unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient and safe service to ensure continuous income. Her husband drives it, so she is assured that her jeepney is well taken cared of. Her jeepney passenger service means a lot to her since this has been their main source of living. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Eudviges hopes that their transport service will continue to be successful. She also prays for a simple and happy life. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts for her jeepney.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is 43 years old and living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.
She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon.
Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she will be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.
She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Farhat thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc. for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Dúo Mercado 2 Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mercado 2

Juana Flor de Maria de 23 años, es  madre de un niño y se dedica a la venta de ropa, en el mercado de su localidad, ella en otras ocasiones a vendido otros productos, según la temporada, pero actualmente vende ropa.  Juana nuevamente solicita un nuevo crédito pues ya se acerca la temporada de vacaciones y necesita surtir su negocio antes que suban los precios. El sueño de Juana Flor es sacar adelante a su hijo y tener varios negocios.
texts.en: Dúo Mercado 2: Juana Flor de Maria is 23 years old and the mother of one child. She works selling clothing in a market in her community. She at other times has sold other products, depending on the season. Currently she sells clothing. Juana is once again requesting a loan as the vacation season is approaching and she needs to stock her business before prices go up. Juana Flor's dream is to get her son ahead and have several businesses.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sokleap's Group

texts.en: Sokleap’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sokleap makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factoy laborer and seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Lindo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Duo lindo amanecer
La señora Miriam Consuelo,de 28 años de edad vive en la colonia Sajcap Chimaltenango tiene 2 hijos quienes estudian en el colegio de la misma comunidad. Desde hace 4 años se dedican a vender producto de Avon, y como actividad secundaria se dedica a vender cajas de lechuga, pero debido a que las ganancias que obtiene es muy poca decidio asociarse para vender le cleire, esika(cosmeticos) y vender leña así como cajas de papa, para esto decidio solicitar su crédito y ampliar su negocio y de esa manera tendrán más trabajo y más ingresos y de esa forma ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dúo Lindo Amanecer Group

Miriam Consuelo is 28 years old and lives in the village of Sajcap, Chimaltenango. She has 2 children who attend school in the same community.

For 4 years she has sold Avon products, and as a secondary activity she sells boxes of lettuce. Since the income she makes from this is very low, she decided to sell two cosmetics brands (LeCleire and Ésika), and sell firewood and boxes of potatoes. For that reason she decided to seek a loan and increase her business, so that she will have more work and more income, in order to help her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and boxes of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.en:
Muhaiyo was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is married and has three children. She is a teacher at secondary school, with 22 years of work experience teaching. She well knows how to communicate and look after students.

She appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay her son's tuition fees at university. Her son graduated high school with excellence his studies and wishes to be professional architect. He is interested in design and up to date drawings from his childhood.

Muhaiyo loves her son and wishes him good luck in his achievements. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition fee for his BA to become an Architect.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood is 61 years old, widow doing business in animals’ purchase and sale for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 4 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 46 years old, married woman, with 5 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Shameem expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Dúo El Rosario Group

texts.es: La señora Ofelia, de 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos, vive al lado de su esposo en una colonia cerca de su pueblo.  Ella vende blusas de tela variada por unidad y docena empaquetada en diferentes tallas, colores y calidad,  para damas, caballeros y niños, en los diferentes mercados municipales y es vendedora ambulante  desde hace 15 años. Ella nos cuenta que su sueño es tener un local propio para no caminar tanto.  Nos dice que las fiestas patrias se aproxima y necesita comprar blusas, playeras, pants, short, calcetas, calcetines, todo en color blanco por docena para no quedarle mal a sus compradores y aprovechar las buenas fechas para tener ganancias.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por eso está solicitando otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ofelia is 33 years old, married, has three children and lives along with her husband in a community near her town.

She sells blouses of different fabrics for women, men and children. She sells per unit and by the dozen in packages of different sizes, colors and quality in the local markets. She has also sold her products as a street vendor for the past 15 years.

She says that her dream is to have a shop of her own instead of walking so much. National holidays are around the corner and she needs to buy blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, and socks. Everything needs to be in white and by the dozen in order to comply with her customer’s needs and take advantage of the holidays to get profits.

The money that she has is not enough and for that she is requesting another loan to buy what she needs.

loans.use: to buy new clothing.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 47 years old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one son and two daughters. Her husband has been running his own clothing business for 6 years. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore Nasreen is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Anghela Jhenny

texts.es:
Anghela es una joven mujer de 24 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, y su negocio es el comercio de abarrotes.
Ella es buena madre, gentil, responsable y  muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado de la zona ‘horizontes’ área donde el 95 por ciento de las viviendas cuentan con todos los servicios básicos, y donde la mayoría de sus calles y avenidas se encuentran asfaltadas y adoquinadas además de contar con unidades educativas.
Anghela es de piel obscura, ojos grandes y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en construcción y con su hijo que ya sabe caminar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes al menudeo como; harina, arroz, fideo, azúcar, etc. “empecé mi negocio vendiendo de forma ambulante, luego me asocie al sindicato del mercado para tener mi puesto fijo de venta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para compra de abarrotes por mayor. Su sueño es vender por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de abarrotes por mayor para abastecer su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Anghela solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes por mayor para abastecer su negocio y cuidar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Anghela is a young, 24 year old woman. She is married and has a one year old son. Her business is the sale of groceries. She is a good mother, kind, responsible and very hard working. Her business is located in the market in the "Horizontes" zone, an area where 95% of the homes have basic services, and where the majority of the streets and avenues are paved with asphalt or cobblestone. There are also schools there.

Anghela has dark skin, big eyes and a sturdy build. Her native tongue is Aymará, and she also speaks Spanish. She shares life with her husband who works in construction, and her son, who is already walking. They live in a rented room made of brick and cement with a roof of corrugated metal sheets.

Her business is the sale of groceries at retail, such as flour, rice, pasta, sugar, etc. "I began my business selling as a street vendor. Later I joined the union of the market in order to have a fixed place to sell . . . ." she adds.

The advantage of her business is that she can rely on daily sales. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy groceries at wholesale. Her dream is to sell at the wholesale level. She hopes to be able to buy groceries wholesale to stock her business. This is the first round of loans with the institution in her first year in this business. For those reasons Angela seeks a loan, to buy groceries wholesale to stock her business and care for her son.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale to stock her store and care for her son.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 25 years old is a single mother with 1 child aged 2 years.

Millicent is determined to raise her child and give her a good future.

Millicent inherited her poultry business from her mother. She started to raise 10 chicks at first with PhP 500 she borrowed from her mother to try to see if she could raise and sell the chickens. With only one chicken coop she raised and sold all her chickens and earn a net of 1500. She decided it is a good business and can still take care of her child. She now has 3 coops and raising 50 chicks and earning a net of PhP 7,500 and wants to expand.

Millicent is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 20,000 to buy 100 chicks, bag of feeds and vitamins to raise chickens and re-sell them.

The loan will help her to expand her business and increase her income to be able to support her and her child needs. Millicent wants to save for her child future education since she can only depend on herself to support her child.

loans.use: to buy 100 chicks, bag of feeds, vitamins to raise chickens and re-sell them.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en: Naziran  is 64 years old, widow and mother of 2 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community to support the needs of the family members.  Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia Albertina se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant, la socia es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Albertina is still woking in her restaurant business. She is a hard working person that supports her family with the help of this business. She is requesting this loan to buy cooking ingredients, like rice, vegetables and chicken.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients, like rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 58 years old, married woman, with 3 children. Razia  is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. This loan will enable her  to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Razia closer to her dream of providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee un taller de costura desde hace 24 años, tiene muchos cliente por su buen trabajo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  

She has owned a sewing workshop for 24 years now.  She has many customers due to her good work.  From what she receives from her sales she is able to resolve some home expenses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase thread, needles, variety of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc. so she can continue with her work which generates good profits.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, variety of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия замужняя женщина, проживающая в городе Сарбанд с мужем и троими детьми. Ее бизнес мен, он занимается торговлей деятельности. Сама Робия бизнес-леди. Она тоже имеет свой бизнес. Робия занимается торговлей деятельности, она продает детские футболки, шорты, брюки, обуви. Робия планирует приобрести больше одежды и расширить бизнес, но однако для приобретения товара ей не хватает немного средств. Робия в связи с этим обратилась за кредитом, чтобы перевозить партию одежды и расширить торговлю. Кредит поможет ей продвигать бизнес.
texts.en: Robiya is a married woman who lives in the city of Sarband with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman who is involved in trade, and she herself is a businesswoman. She also has her own business. Robiya sells children’s shirts, shorts, pants, and shoes. She is planning to purchase more clothing to expand her business, but she does not have enough money. Robiya applied for a loan to bring in more clothes and expand her inventory. The loan will help her develop her business.

loans.use: to bring in more clothing and expand her inventory

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is the father of three children and lives with them and his wife in Kapan town. Nver mainly is involved in taxi driving, but he also does some agricultural activities in Kapan town of Syunik region.

He has now applied for this loan to ask lenders to help him with make the partial payment of a car which he wants to drive as a taxi. The current car that Nver owns is old and damaged, so to be able to continue his work as a driver, Nver needs a new car.

So after saving some part of the money for a car, Nver decided to ask for the remaining amount from Kiva lenders so he is able to continue his work and get income for his family.

Nver has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This loan is very important for Nver and he hopes for your support.

loans.use: to make partial payment of a car to use it for driving a taxi

loans.name: Sayligul

texts.ru: 36 летняя мастерица швеи это Сайлигул. Она просто обожает шить и кроить. 19  лед Сайлигул идет по стопам снохе. Ее сноха раньше тоже занималась этой сфере деятельности. Сайлигул ни смотря, ни на что, старается зарабатывать и помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Она замужем и имеет детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Ее муж строитель. Сайлигул хочет отремонтировать дом. Для ремонта нужно стройматериалы, но для купли средств у нее нет денежных средств, и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Сайлигул надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This 36-year-old seamstress is Sayligul. She just loves to sew and tailor clothing. She has been following in the footsteps of her daughter-in-law for 19 years. Her daughter-in-law is also a seamstress. Sayligul tries to earn money to help her husband provide for the family no matter what. She is married and has children. Her children are in school and her husband is a construction worker. Sayligul wants to renovate her house. She needs construction materials for the renovations, but she does not have enough money to buy them, so she decided to apply for a loan. Sayligul hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Harisu

texts.en:
Harisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tsohuwan Rikochi village. Harisu joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Harisu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize. This season, Harisu has grand plans to harvest 80 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Harisu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to build a house/ renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase papayas, watermelons, melons, carrots, cucumbers, beets and other vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Alimirza

texts.ru: Алимирза, ему 34 года, женат, детей пока нет. У него среднее образование, Алимирза ответственен, честен, трудолюбив. У него хороший опыт в ведении сельскохозяйственного бизнеса, около 16 лет, сначала помогал родителям, потом стал заниматься бизнесом сам. Благодаря упорному труду Алимирзы, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров, 16 овец, лошадь. На 1,6 Га земли он выращивает арбузы, дыни, лук, помидоры и прочее для реализации. Для содержания скота имеются все условия, также летом скот отгоняет для откорма пастись на пастбище. Бизнес в целом развивается хорошо, однако, в этом году случилось непредвиденное - в следствие короткого замыкания перегорел двигатель насосной станции, вызвав нехватку воды для полива. Мероприятия, проводимые Алимирзой не спасли урожай, и он засох. Алимирза понес убытки на сумму 500,000 сом (KGS). Он узнал, что в Банке "Бай Тушум" есть возможность получить льготный кредит на восстановление бизнеса и обратился за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на обработку поливной земли для ее восстановления и покупку семян лука для засева. Урожай поможет восстановить убытки и нарастить бизнес Алимирзы.
texts.en: Alimirza is 34, married, and does not have any children yet. He has a high school education and is responsible, honest, and hardworking. He has a lot of experience in agriculture, about 16 years, having first helped his parents before starting a business on his own. Thanks to his hard work, Alimirza currently has five cows, 16 sheep, and a horse. He grows watermelon, melons, onions, tomatoes, and other crops to sell on a 1.6 hectare plot of land. He has everything necessary for taking care of livestock and sends them out to pasture in the summer for grazing and fattening. On the whole, business has been going well, except that this year something unexpected happened. A short circuit blew out the motor at the water pumping station, causing a water shortage for irrigation. Alimirza could not save his crops, which withered and died. His losses totaled 500,000 som (KGS). Alimirza found out that it was possible to get a soft loan through Bai-Tushum Bank to restore his business, and he applied for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to prepare irrigated land for recovery and to purchase onion seeds. The harvest will help restore his losses and rebuild his business.

loans.use: to rebuild his business and plant organic onions

loans.name: Cosma

texts.en:
Augustine is a 43-year-old man; he is married with five children, with four still attending school. He deals in cattle trading and a retail shop which he has operated for a period of 20 years.

Augustine has been taking loans from Ugafode, which he claims has enabled him to sustain his business and meet his family's financial needs, especially school fees.

He applied for a loan of ugx 5,000,000 to boost his cattle trade business. He is doing this in preparation for the December festive season.

He usually buys young bulls that he feeds on fodder for about three months and then sels them at a a profit. He will use a small portion of the loan to add capital in his retail shop, ie buying soap, rice, soda and more coffee.

Augustine hopes to to expand his business using the financial facility from Ugafode.

He thanks Ugafode for the continuous financial support which has enabled him to sustain his business and meet all his family financial obligations.

loans.use: to boost his cattle trade by buying more cattle for trade.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.es:
Los diversos factores que lo han llevado al fracaso en ocasiones anteriores, no son impedimento para intentar de nuevo y salir adelante con sus proyectos. Inocencio es un hombre con 69 años de edad, trabajador, humilde y lleno de vida, su labor es hacer sombreros artesanales y venderlos en el Municipio  de Tuchin.

Actualmente sus ventas han bajado mucho, pues este hombre cuenta con muy poco capital de trabajo, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales para realizar estos sombreros, espera aumentar sus ventas y de tal manera sus ganancias.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero el principal es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su estado actual no es el mejor.

Ayuda a este hombre con deseos de salir adelante, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
The various factors that have caused one to fail on prior occasions are not an obstacle to trying again and moving forward with one's projects.

Inocencio is a 69-year-old man, who is hard-working, humble, and full of life. He works making handcrafted hats and selling them in the municipal of Tuchin.

Currently, his sales have gone down a lot. This man has very little capital for his work, so he is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of the materials to make those hats. He hopes to increase his sales, and therefore his earnings.

He has many dreams, but the main one is to improve the condition of his house. A lot of time has passed since it was built, and its current state is not the best.

Help this man with a drive to succeed -- come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy the materials to make handcrafted hats

loans.name: Dúo Emprendedoras De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Emprendedoras de San Pedro La señora Emilia tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y está muy agradecida con Dios por el negocio que le ha prestado.  Ella tiene una venta de ropa de tela variada para damas, caballeros, niños y ropa de bebe, la cual está ubicada en la calle principal de su colonia.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo y tener mucha más ropa en venta, como chumpas de cuero y camisas originales, gorras para damas, caballeros y niños.  Ella comenta que tiene varios pedidos de pantalones de lona para dama y caballero, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y le urge entregar unas docenas que le han encargado.  Por eso se ve en la necesidad de pedir otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta y no quedarles mal a sus clientes que confían en ella.
texts.en:
Emilia is 28 years old. She is married and is very grateful to God for the business that he has provided her with.

She has a small clothes shop of assorted clothes for women, men, children, and babies. It is located on the main street in her community. Her dream is to continue to grow and have many more clothes to sell, like original leather jackets and shirts and hats for women, men and children.

She tells that she has various orders of jeans for men and women, but the money she has is not sufficient. It is urgent for her to deliver a few dozen orders that have been requested of her. For this reason, she finds it necessary to ask for another loan to buy what she needs and to not lose face with her clients who trust her.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

location.town: Vosquez de Vista Hermosa,San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Jasniris

texts.es: Jasniris reside en una urbanización del municipio de Cartagena de Indias en compañía de sus dos hijas menores de edad  a quienes solventa con su venta de pasabocas y refrescos, negoció que inició tras recibir una herencia de su difunto padre y en sociedad con un hermano compraron un kiosco cerca del sector de Bazurto.  Todos los días compra los ingredientes para la elaboración de sus pasabocas y a primera hora de la mañana los prepara desde su vivienda; empanadas, arepas de huevo, deditos de queso y demás, para posteriormente enviarlos a comercializar en el kiosco. Hoy en día cuenta con dos años de funcionamiento y excelentes resultados gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación,  en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en una vitrina, mecatos, bebidas gaseosas, víveres para la elaboración de los pasabocas y desechables.  Con esta inversión surtirá su negocio con nuevos productos y sus ventas se incrementaran.  Su meta de negocio a futuro es ubicar otro punto de la ciudad donde pueda tener una sucursal.  En lo personal desea continuar en su rol de madre responsable de sus hijas y lograr  que sean unas profesionales.
texts.en:
Jasniris lives in a residential area in the municipality of Cartagena de Indias along with her two young daughters, who she supports by selling snacks and soft drinks. She started her business after receiving an inheritance from her deceased father. Together, she and her brother bought a kiosk near the Bazurto sector. Every day she buys ingredients to make her snacks and, at morning's first hour, she prepares them at her home: empanadas, arepas with egg, cheese sticks, and others. Later, she sells them in her kiosk.

Jasniris has two years of experience working like this with excellent results, thanks to her effort and dedication. Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in a display glass, cakes, soft drinks, grocery items to make her snacks, and disposable supplies. With this investment, she will stock her business with new products to increase her sales. Jasniris' goal is to obtain another location in the city where she can open another branch. Her personal goal is to continue to be a responsible mother to her daughters and help them become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in a display window, cakes, soft drinks, grocery items to make tasty snacks, and disposable supplies.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 29 años de edad, soltero, tiene una hija de 14 años, y su negocio es la cerrajería.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘llojeta’ fundando el año 1972,  caracterizada por encontrarse sobre una ladera pendiente boscosa y flanqueada por dos ríos.
Jose es moreno, cabello crespo, usa lentes de aumento, de físico robusto.  Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela viven un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina. Su negocio es la cerrajería, él se ocupa de fabricar puertas, escaleras, barandas, techos, etc. De metal, “inicie hace 8 años, porque pasé unos cursos de soldadura que me introdujeron en el oficio…” comenta. la ventaja de negocio es que su negocio es conocido, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de arco de oxígeno y metal para trabajar. Su sueño es tener un negocio productivo, él desea realizar la compra de arco de oxígeno y metal para trabajar.
Es por esos motivos que jose solicita un préstamo para la compra de arco de oxígeno y metal para trabajar.
texts.en:
Jose is a 29 year old single man who has a 14 year old daughter and runs a metalwork business.

He is a good, enterprising and very responsible father. His business is located in the zone of 'Llojeta' which was founded in 1972. It's known for its location on the slopes of a forested hillside flanked by two rivers.

Jose is dark with curly hair, wears glasses and is well built. His native language is Aymará and he also speaks Spanish. He lives with his daughter, who is studying at school, in a rented room built of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof.

In his metalwork business, he deals with the manufacture of gates, stairs, railings and ceilings from metal. "I started eight years ago, because I did some welding courses which introduced me to the profession ..." he says.

The advantage his business has is that it has a good reputation but the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a blow torch and metal to work with.

His dream is to have a profitable business and to be able to buy a blow torch and metal to work with. It is for these reasons that Jose is applying for a loan in order to buy a blow torch and metal to work with.

loans.use: to buy a blow torch and metal to work with.

loans.name: Margarita De San Pedro Group

texts.es: La señora Margarita es la encargada de este grupo, tiene dos hermosas hijas, vive al lado de su esposo y tiene una venta de ropa de tela variada, calzado para damas, caballeros y niños en general, cristalería, ropa de bebe desde hace 10 años, la cual se encuentra ubicada en la calle principal de su colonia.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo y tener un local propio ya que esta alquilando por el momento.  Tiene varios pedidos de blusas finas, y pantalones de marca para damas y caballeros, pero el dinero que tiene lo le es suficiente,  por eso ella hace la séptima petición para poder comprar lo que le falta y no quedarle mal a sus compradores.  Ella está muy agradecida con ustedes por apoyarla con los prestamos que ha recibido durante 7 años y les pide a Dios que los bendiga grandemente.
texts.en:
Margarita is the person in charge of this group. She has two beautiful daughters and lives at her husband's side.

For the past 10 years, she has had a shop where she sells clothing of varying fabrics; shoes for women, men, and children; glassware; and baby clothes. It is located on the main street of her community.

Her dream is to continue growing, and to have her own location, as she is currently renting. She has several requests for fine blouses and brand name pants for women and men, but she doesn't have enough money. Therefore, she is making her seventh loan request, in order to buy what she is lacking and avoid upsetting her customers.

She is very grateful to you all for supporting her through the loans she has received over the past 7 years, and she asks God to bless you greatly.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 40 years old and a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Chantha’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Donexad Group

texts.en: Phuvieng is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Phuvieng and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Phuvieng and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Phuvieng and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Phuvieng and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 48-years old lady who lives with her husband and four sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her elder son involved in manufacturing business. Initially he was not a very skillful turner to work over a lathe machine. He has been learning the techniques of the lathe machine from professionals. Now he came to know that how to operate lathe machine, so that he can carry on his newly started business. Due to his lack of experience the lathe machine got damaged and needed maintenance.

Therefore, she requested a loan for her son so that he can fulfill the deficiencies of lathe machine and can buy additional tools, dies, spare parts etc. She is tension free now because she hopes that her son will be expert soon and can generate reasonable income as an expert turner.
Razia is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son for the repair of his lathe machine and to buy additional tools, dies and spare parts. .

loans.name: Grupo Ada Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GRUPO ADA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de dulces, venta de condimentos, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de carne, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de condimentos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años, y con la ayuda de su amiga decidió emprender este negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de condimentos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Grupo Ada" is starting its 2nd loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  They meet in the Santiago II central office.  The group has 9 members and is led by a board of directors where Virginia is the president.  The members of this group have a variety of businesses such as: the sale of sweaters, the sale of sweets, the sale of condiments, the sale of sports clothes, the sale of meat, and the sale of food.

The loan they are taking will benefit all of the small businesspeople in the group.  Virginia states that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Now she has a business selling condiments.  She learned this business on her own over a number of years, and with the help of her friend she decided to start up this business.

The loan that Virginia is taking now will be used to increase her working capital (to buy condiments at wholesale).  She will buy from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto, and will later sell in the fairs in the city of El Alto.  This way of working enables her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy condiments at wholesale

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María is 43 years old and lives in the municipality of Sahagun with her three children, two sons and one daughter; she’s a single mother that works hard to give to her family a good quality of life. She owns a racing cattle business since 2007, which has allowed her to survive and live comfortable. 

She wants to improve her business, that’s why she works hard and wants to invest in her business. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more pigs and chickens so she can have more inputs and more to offer to all her clients, and maybe get some more. 

You can help this mother to give to her family a good life through a loan that will help her make her business grow, help María now and watch her succeed.
texts.en:
María Elena is 43 years old and lives in the municipality of Sahagun with her three children, two sons and one daughter; she’s a single mother that works hard to give her family a good quality of life. She has owned a cattle raising business since 2007, which has allowed her to survive and live comfortably.

María Elena wants to improve her business, that’s why she works hard and wants to invest in her business. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more pigs and chickens so she can have more inputs and more to offer to all her clients.

You can help this mother give her family a good life through a loan that will help her make her business grow, help María Elena now and watch her succeed.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Dina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dina, de 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como jornalero y son padres de 3 hijos, los cuales todos están estudiando.

Dina, desde hace un año inicio a vender ropa; anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de panes y frescos en el cafetín de la escuela; la venta de ropa la hace al por mayor y menor.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar pantalones y camisas de hombre y de mujer y comprar accesorios de ropa para vender.
