El sueño de Dina, es ver a sus hijos graduarse de la universidad, además le gustaría mejorar su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dina, 32 years old, never had the opportunity to go to school. She has a partner who works as a day laborer and they are the parents of three children, who are all in school. 

Dina began selling clothing a year ago, previously she sold breads and beverages in the school cafeteria. The clothing sales include both retail and wholesale. 

The loan will be used to buy men's and women's pants and shirts and to buy clothing accessories to resell.

Dina's dream is to see her children graduate from university. She would also like to improve her home and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's pants and shirts as well as clothing accessories for resale.

loans.name: Outdoor Activity - N02T02Qthái Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lĩnh is 32 years old and she is married. She has been being peddling at markets and parking places for more than 10 years. Lĩnh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is hard because she has to work for long hours outdoors and the income is unstable.

The main hardship that Lĩnh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits, and general things to resell. In 2014, Lĩnh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Lĩnh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of N02T02QThái, which consists of 7 members. With her business profit, Lĩnh hopes for her children to go to school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to save more money.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and general things to resell.

loans.name: Mermaids - N05Qđại Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuyến is 30 years old and she is married. She has been selling fish for 9 years. Xuyến lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Xuyến faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell in order to increase her income each month. In 2014, Xuyến joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Xuyến has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of N05QĐại, which consists of 6 members.

With her business profit, Xuyến hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Lagomau

texts.en:
Lagomau is 42 years old with seven children. She runs a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. 

Lagomau has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, water tank, gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2008 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, water tank, gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Salota

texts.en:
Salota is a 23-year-old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business, selling 'elei' (traditional Samoan block printing) materials at the market to earn a living. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

Salota has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs and containers to assist her in running the business. She  hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs and containers.

loans.name: Vaisenia

texts.en: Vaisenia is a 39 year old mother with 3 children, she runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Vaisenia requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2015. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags,

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit resale business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling spices. Rosita is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Chanvoeut

texts.en: Chanvoeut is from Phnomsrok, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 45 years old. Her family owns 3 hectares of rice fields, 5 cows and 2 pigs. In 2012, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Chanvoeut makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for family expenses for fertilizer for the field and for pigs food.  Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for fees related to loom preparation.

loans.name: Malai

texts.en: Malai is from Phnomsrok, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 35 years old. Her family owns 2 hectares of rice fields and 2 cows. In 2012, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Malai makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother buy the fertilizer and diesel for the field and the food for the cows.  Thanks to the loan,  she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for fees related to loom preparation.

loans.name: Chanrith

texts.en: Chanrith is from  Phnomsrok, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 33 years old. Her family owns 3 hectares of rice fields. In 2013, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Chanrith makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses and to buy fertilizer for the field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for fees related to loom preparation.

loans.name: Keke

texts.en: Keke is 29-year-old mother with 3 children. She runs a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Keke requested a loan to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, and backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Leu

texts.en:
Leu is 21 years old and single. She runs a business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

Leu has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, a frying pan, containers and a gas stove to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, a frying pan, containers and a gas stove.

loans.name: Dúo Sol De Justicia Group

texts.es:
Duo Sol de Justicia
Las señora Lisbeth Magaly,es una persona muy visionaria, entusiasta y con mucho deseo de superación, pero debido a limitaciones económicas no ha podido agrandar su negocio ella se dedica a vender productos tooper, tornasol, y medicina natural entre otros ya que con esto ella puede sacar adelante a su familia,ella le ofrese sus productos a sus conocidas y ofrece un tipo de jornadas médicas, de esta forma logra ella también reunir sus pagos y estar al día en sus créditos y sacar adelante a sus familias, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos Tooper y medicina natural para vender.
texts.en:
Group: "Duo Sol de Justicia" ["Sun of Justice Duo"]

Lisbeth Magaly is a woman with great vision who is enthusiastic and has a great desire to excel. However, due to financial constraints she has not been able to grow her business. She makes a living selling tupperware and natural medicine products, among others. With this she can help to raise her family. She offers her products to people she knows and also a type of medical consultation. She makes payments to stay current on her loans and support her family. She is requesting this loan to purchase tupperware and natural medicine products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase tupperware and natural medicine products to sell.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: La vivienda en la que Ana habita es muy humilde y sencilla, pero ella se siente feliz de poder contar con un lugar propio para vivir y ofrecerles estabilidad a sus hijos de 7 y 13 años de edad con los que habita, también junto a su compañero de vida. Ana a pesar de no contar con mayores estudios se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, ya que recorre mercados y cantones para ofrecer sus productos. Ana desea mejorar el área del corredor y lavadero, ya que en la última tormenta se le lavo el piso que es de tierra y se le mojaron algunas de sus pertenencias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para arreglar el corredor y área del lavadero, de su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que esta parte de su vivienda es muy importante que tenga techo por el agua que guarda en la pila.
texts.en:
The home in which Ana lives is very humble and simple, but she feels happy to be able to have a place of her own to live and to offer stability to her children, ages 7 and 13, with whom she lives, along with her life companion. In spite of not having a lot of education, Ana has worked for two years selling clothing as a street vendor. She goes through markets and cantons to offer her products. 

Ana wants to improve the area of the veranda and the washing area, since in the last storm the floor, which is made of dirt, washed away and some of her belongings got wet. For this reason she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to fix up the veranda and the washing area of her house as soon as possible, since it is very important that this part of her house have a roof because of the water that she stores in the storage basin.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to fix up the veranda and the washing area in order to protect the water for daily use

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Her name is Nerissa, aged 42, from Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Oprinilo, with whom she has three children; one is in college, another is at the elementary level and one is working already. Almost half of the Filipino people live in rural areas. Although Nerissa's family do not have any luxuries they are happy and content for as long they are intact, sharing three simple meals a day.

Nerissa has been operating a small general store and a fruit and veggies farm for a number of years already. She grows mostly bananas, coconut, tomatoes, eggplants, and bitter melon. Bananas are almost a staple in a Filipino meal. She sells dry and packaged food and household items directly to consumers. She sells her produce to their town market, and to fruit stores that she regularly supplies, and to the local community.

To help her continue operations of her businesses, she is requesting a PHP 50000 loan which she will use to pay for frozen foods such as marinated pork and beef, "embotido" (pork roll), meatballs, rice, fertilizer and other grocery items. She already has regular customers for her frozen food which is a popular among the working community for its convenience in cooking. Her store and farm's earnings help provide for their daily needs and in sending her children to school.

Nerissa dreams to own a house and be able to send her children to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for some grocery items, frozen foods to sell at her store as well as fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 48-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Agnes has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Agnes has requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as flour, oil and other supplies to use in her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, oil and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita is 39 years old and has three children. She is married and all three of her children are in school. Crestita is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for nine years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Crestita would like to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like clothing retail business.

Merlinda dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 58 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Carolina is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Carolina has been in this business for nine years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Carolina is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Cristina Patricia

texts.es:
Cristina, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, vive con sus hermanas pero solo su hijo depende económicamente de ella.

Cristina, se dedica al comercio de semilla de marañón desde hace 3 años, el negocio lo aprendió de su mamá porque a eso dedico toda su vida; ella vende la semilla asada en la capital y este negocio lo desempeña junto a  su hermana.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar semilla de marañón para procesarla y salir a venderla, porque en esta época es más cara y así aprovechar para obtener más ganancias.

Cristina, siempre ha soñado con sacar a sus hijos adelante, tener su propia casa y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Cristina, who is 21 years old, went to school through sixth grade. She is the single mother of two children. She lives with her sisters, but only her children depend on her economically.

Cristina has been selling cashews for three years. She learned the business from her mother, because she did this work all her life. She sells roasted nuts in the capital, and she works in this business along with her sister.

She will use the loan to buy cashew nuts to process and sell, because in this season they are more expensive, and thus she will take advantage of this to obtain more earnings.

Cristina has always dreamed of raising her children, having her own house, and improving her economic condition.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts to process and sell

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 43 years old with seven children. She sells bananas and taro in her community to earn a living.

Sally requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedling), taro roots (seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2010, and hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedling), taro roots (seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ligaya earns additional income through her food vending business.

Ligaya dreams to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and married with one child.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cigarettes, junk food, home product care items and other groceries.

Nilda has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María, de 56 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es viuda, su esposo murió hace 2 años, tuvo 3 hijos, uno de ellos vive con ella y el otro viajo hacía los E.E.U.U. y en su casa viven 3 nietos. 

María, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, eso fue lo que le enseño su papá; cuando se caso siguió sembrando junto a su esposo, ese fue el medio con el cual sacaron adelante a sus hijos.- María, ademas de la agricultura, también le gusta la crianza de ganado, ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para comenzar a preparar el desayuno, ella ya no trabaja pero es la que lleva el desayuno y supervisa el trabajo, sus cultivos están a  1 kilómetro y medio de su casa.

El crédito sera utilizado para comprar 2 novillas que le están vendiendo.

Su sueño es tener 10 vacas lecheras y comprar un terreno para pastear su ganado.
texts.en:
Maria, age 56, did not have the chance to go to school. She is a widow since her husband died two years ago. She had three children, one of them lives with her and the other traveled to the United States; three grandchildren live in her home.

Maria has always worked in agriculture because that's what her Dad taught her. When she married she kept sowing together with her husband and that was the means to provide for their children. Maria likes raising cattle as well as agriculture and she gets up at 5:00 AM to begin preparing breakfast. She no longer works but she takes breakfast and supervises the work. Her crops are located one and one-half kilometers from her home.

The loan will be used to buy 2 heifers that are being sold to her.

Her dream is to have 10 dairy cows and to buy a plot of land to graze her cattle.

loans.use: to buy two heifers which are being sold to her.

loans.name: Phuorng's Group

texts.en:
Phuorng, a local farmer living in Preah Vihear province, is 46 years old and a married mother of eight children, seven of whom rely on her. Three of her seven dependent children are under school age.

The main source of family’s income comes from rice growing, which she has been involved for five years. To supplement income, she and her husband work as a handicrafting.

Phuorng is the second-cycled borrower to VisionFund and the past loan was helpful and enabled her to renovate the house to be more comfortable.

As the leader of a group of two, she will use her loan to buy solar lighting. She hopes that this purchase can help her relieve the financial burden for electricity cost so there is more money left to save to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy solar lighting to reducing the cost of electricity.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Faasalafa

texts.en:
Faasalafa is a 45 year old mother with six children who runs a business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Faasalafa requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Friendly Drug Store - N05T5Qtrungbsơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huế is 28 years old and she is married with one children. She has had a retail business selling medication for four years.

Huế lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village. Her difficulty is not having enough capital to invest in her business.

So she is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell.

In 2014, Huế joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business and she has successfully repaid two loans.

Huế is the group leader of the N05T5QTrungBSơn, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Huế hopes to improve her business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlene is 42 years old and has three children who attend school.

Arlene has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for five years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is 20 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Romelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Romelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Romelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada, su esposo es mecánico y presta servicio de transporte, juntos tiene 4 hijos, todos están estudiando y viven en casa de ella, también vive la madre de ella a quien cuida desde hace mucho tiempo. 

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de gas propano desde hace 14 años, ella decidió dedicar a esta actividad porque es la única forma de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, el horario de trabajo de ella es de aproximadamente 7 horas al día.  

Rosa, necesita el crédito para comprar un medio de transporte (carro) para distribuir los cilindros de gas, este préstamo le ayudará a mejorar la atención a sus clientes y por ende venderá más. 

Ella sueña con colocar su propia tienda distribuidora y tener  un negocio formal y estable, también sueña con construir una casa digna, ella considera que con las ganancias colocará una nueva sucursal en el municipio más cercano.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 31, went to school through sixth grade. She is married. Her husband is a mechanic and offers transportation services. Together they have four children. All of them are in school, and they live in her house. Her mother, whom she has cared for for a long time, also lives there.

Rosa has been selling propane gas for 14 years. She decided to work in this business because it is the only way to help her husband with the family expenses. Her work schedule is approximately seven hours a day.

Rosa needs the loan to buy a means of transportation (a car) in order to distribute the gas cylinders. This loan will help her to improve her service to her customers, and in the end, she will sell more.

She dreams of setting up her own distributing store and having a formal and stable business. She also dreams of building a dignified home. She is thinking that with the earnings she will set up a new branch in the closest town.

loans.use: to buy a means of transportation (a car) to distribute gas cylinders.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Cosechando Metas Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Cosechando Metas La encargada de este grupo es la señora Eva Kelita, quien tiene dos hijos, vive al lado de su esposo y tiene una tienda desde hace 10 años, situada en la calle principal de su colonia.  Ella dice que su sueño es llegar a ser una gran distribuidora de consumos de primera necesidad y así sus vecinos no tendrán que viajar al pueblo a comprar los artículos de tienda, como azúcar, maíz, frijol, pastas, jabón, gaseosas y más.  Ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprar varios granos básicos de la tienda, pastas, jabón y gaseosas por jumbos.  Por eso ella hace la petición de un nuevo préstamo para comprar lo que no tiene o lo que le hace falta para surtir mas su tienda de consumo diario. Ella está muy agradecida por la confianza y  apoyo que se le dará desde muy lejos.
texts.en:
The person in charge of the solidarity group Cosechando Metas (Harvesting Goals) is Señora Eva Kelita, who has two children. She lives with her husband and has had a store located on the principal street of her town for 10 years. She says that her dream is to become a big distributor of products of basic necessity, and thus her neighbors will not have to travel to the town to buy retail products such as sugar, corn, beans, pastas, soap, soft drinks, and other items. 

She doesn't have sufficient money to buy various basic grains, pastas, soap, and jumbo size soft drinks for the store. For this reason, she has applied for a new loan to purchase what she doesn't have or what she lacks to further stock her store with products for daily use. She is very grateful for the confidence and support that will be given her from far away.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

location.town: Vosquez de Vista Hermosa,San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 9, 21, 25 y 29 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es emprendedora, amable y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la localidad ‘Cotoca’, conocido por sus comidas típicas y su artesanía, especialmente de cerámicas.
Ana es morena, de físico robusto y baja estatura (de pie la segunda de la izquierda, viste polera negra). Debido a su deseo de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; panadería, cerrajería, tienda de barrio, venta de jugos, venta de huevo, venta de queso, venta de comida rápida y venta de cosméticos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano; ella se ocupa de comprar ropa por fardos, la separa según género y edad y la oferta a buen precio, “trabajo de forma ambulante, de esa forma expongo la ropa a diferentes clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa es barata, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor para ofertar a buen precio.
texts.en:
Ana is a 46-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has 4 children who are 9, 21, 25, and 29 years old. Her business is secondhand clothing sales. She is enterprising, lovable, and very responsible. She runs her business in the form of traveling saleswoman in 'Cotoca,' an area known for its typical foods and artisan goods, especially ceramics.

Ana has tanned skin, with a robust physique and short stature (in the photo: standing second from the left, wearing a black T-shirt). Due to her wishes to excel, she formed a communal bank with people whose businesses are: bakery, locksmith, neighborhood shop, juice sales, eggs sales, cheese sales, fast food sales, and cosmetics sales.

Ana buys clothes by the bundle, separates them according to type and age, and offers them at a good price. "I work as a traveling saleswoman. By doing this I exhibit different clothes to different customers," she comments. The advantage of her business is that her clothes are cheap; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to supply her purchase.

This is her first sequence of loans with the institution during the five years she has worked in this activity. For this reason, Ana is requesting a loan to buy secondhand clothing from wholesale to offer a good price.

loans.use: purchase secondhand clothing from wholesale to offer a good price

loans.name: Kelim Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Kelim lleva casi 5 años en el negocio de venta de pollo frito, su esposo es su principal apoyo para sufragar las principales necesidades de su vivienda. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas gracias a la demanda de sus clientes y ha logrado obtener buenos ingresos con dichas ventas. Para seguir mejorando sus ventas Doña Kelim solicita un crédito para mejorar la fachada del negocio y comprar materiales de construcción para el cocinero, de esta manera podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes una mejor fachada.
texts.en: Doña Kelim has worked in the business of selling fried chicken for almost 5 years. Her husband is the main support who pays for the necessities of her house. Little by little she is increasing her sales thanks to the demand of her customers, and from these sales she has obtained good income. To continue improving her sales, Doña Kelim is requesting a loan to improve the front of her business and to purchase construction materials for the kitchen. In this way, she will be able to offer a better appearance to her customers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for the kitchen

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sarah works hard to support her family.

She has a farming of rice business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice vending. Sarah is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her farming of rice business.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Potoae

texts.en: Potoae is a 43-year-old mother with six children and has a small business selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Potoae requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots,.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Rose is 25 years old and has one child who is in school.

Mary Rose has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Mary Rose requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

Mary Rose has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is 44 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Regie works very hard to provide for them.

Regie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Regie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Regie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, es madre de una hija y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

Martha, siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo, porque eso fue lo que le enseñaron sus padres, su pareja siembra maíz y maicillo a 2 kilómetros de su casa durante la mañana y en la tarde se dedica a su hija y a la iglesia.

El crédito que está solicitando será invertido para comprar maíz, abono y pesticidas para sembrar la milpa.

El sueño de Martha es, luchar para que su hijo se prepare académicamente y obtenga un titulo universitario; además sueña con construir su propia casa y comprar un vehículo para hacer viajes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 22 years old and finished high school. She has a partner and is mother to one daughter. Her partner works in agriculture. 

Martha has always worked in the fields, because that's what her parents taught her. Her partner cultivates corn and sorghum at 2 kilometers distance from the home in the morning and in the afternoon attends to her daughter and church matters.

The loan she's requesting will be invested in corn, fertilizer and pesticides for the cultivation of the cornfield. 

Martha's dream is to strive so her child will be academically prepared to obtain a university degree; she further dreams of building her own house and buying a vehicle to take trips and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, fertilizer and pesticides for the sowing of the cornfield.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Jamuna, 47, standing to the right, is a divorcee from a small village of Odisha, India. She has two daughters in her care who are pursuing their studies in college.

She makes leaf plates and bowls woven out of dry leaves and sells them in the nearby market. These plates are used for different purposes – mainly for serving food. Jamuna makes different types and sizes of plates depending upon the demand of her customers.

She, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Jamuna will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase machinery so she can weave the plates more frequently and quickly, and to purchase raw materials like leaves, thread, glue and plastic.

She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase machinery so she can weave plates more frequently and quickly, and to purchase raw materials like leaves, thread, glue and plastic.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Trushna is a 33-year-old widow woman who lives with her brother's family. She is the one standing to the left in the photograph.

She took over the family's responsibility after the death of her husband. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She did not want to be a burden on her brother, so she started a tailoring service five years ago. From this business, she earns 2,000 INR per month.

Trushna, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. Trushna will buy an extra sewing machine and more materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc., for her sewing business.

Trushna has a plan to start a tailoring training center, so she wants to take a loan for that. In the future, Trushna would like to save enough money so she can help and support her brother's family and be able to live independently.

The other member, Mirarani, is engaged in paddy (rice) cultivation.

loans.use: to buy an extra sewing machine and more materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc., for her sewing business, and to start a tailoring training center.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Suhasini, 59, is standing to the left in the photo. She is a differently abled woman who has been running a small food center for the last seven years to manage her household expenses. She has been running it on a partnership basis and has to share the profit with her partner.

She struggles hard to support her family out of this income. Her family includes her two sons and a daughter. Her sons have been employed somewhere to earn some additional income for their family.

Suhasini now wishes to scale up the venture by increasing her volume of business in the area. For this purpose, she seeks financial support and plans to use it for buying grocery supplies in a bulk amount from the wholesaler, as well as some utensils, etc. to serve more customers and increase her earnings from this venture.

Suhasini, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR, from which she will use her portion to buy edible oil, sugar, rice, flour, spices, and biscuits in bulk. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy edible oil, sugar, rice, flour, spices, and biscuits in bulk

loans.name: Sam An's Group

texts.en: Sam An is 32 years old and resides in Preah Vihear province. She is married with two dependent children; the older child is in school while the younger is too young for school. This family’s life relies on a handicraft business and rice growing. Having been with VisionFund for two loans, Sam An has used them to support the rice farming business, to buy household supplies and to buy school materials. Now, as the leader of a four-member group, she will use her loan to buy solar panels for her family. She hopes she can save more income, which is the main source used to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy solar panels to save more income by reducing the cost of electricity service and to allow her child to be able to study at night

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Ma. Nita

texts.en:
Ma. Nita is 57 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Ma. Nita works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Nita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future, Ma. Nita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ma. Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy thread and other supplies to use in her tailoring business.

Ma. Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy thread and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 44 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Mary Ann has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,posee un taller de calzado (repara y elabora calzado),el cual esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia,con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven vive  en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young borrower is 28 years old; his face is blurred as he lives in a high-risk area. The borrower owns a cobbler's studio where he repairs and produces footwear. The workshop is in his home. With profits from sales, the borrower can pay household costs. The borrower lives in a house with his family; the family owns the house.

The borrower is applying for another loan in order to buy leather, thread, glue, material and more to continue with his work and, alongside his family, to enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, material and more.

loans.name: Mere

texts.en: Mere is a 36-year-old mother with three children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Mere requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine, to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine,.

loans.name: Santos Milagro

texts.es:
Santos, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, su pareja es agricultor, pescador y jornalero, tienen 3 hijos y todos están estudiando.

Santos, se dedica a vender productos como perfumes y cosméticos, hoy en día coloco su propio negocio en la casa, esto le ayuda a tener un ingreso adicional y es una forma de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su horario de venta es de 6 horas al día.

Santos, necesita el préstamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar mercadería como jabones, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos que los clientes buscan, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos y la calidad de vida de sus hijos. 

Sus sueños son, tener una tienda fuerte y tener la oportunidad de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Santos is 31 years old and has a third-grade education. She is married. Her husband is a farmer, fisherman and labourer. The couple has three children, all of whom are in education.

Santos makes a living selling products such as cosmetics and perfumes. Her business is located in her home and it provides an additional income and allows her to support her husband with household costs. Santos makes sales for six hours every day.

Santos needs this loan in order to expand her business and buy merchandise, such as soaps, sugar, oil and other products that her customers need. This will help Santos to increase her income and improve her children's quality of life..

Santos' dreams are to have a shop that is doing well, and to have the opportunity to continue working.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy merchandise, such as soaps, sugar, oil and other products.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ivy is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ivy has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Ivy requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Ivy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ivy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 31 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Catherine is in the agricultural business raising goats in the Philippines. Catherine requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Catherine has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Menime

texts.en: Menime is a Samoan citizen. She is a 52-year-old mother with six children. She runs a business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. Menime requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube(seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlyn is 50 years old and five of her children are in school.

Merlyn has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Merlyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Merlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 47 years old and has three children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Elenita is in the agricultural business farming corn in the Philippines. Elenita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elenita has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Condiment Of Life - N22Ybíchhlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Điểm is 54 years old and married with three children. She has been producing and selling salt for more than 10 years.

Điểm lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, this job is hard but the income is not high.

The main hardship that Điểm faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary equipment for her salt producing process.

Điểm joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution to improve her business. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard.

She is the group leader of the 22YBích Hải Lôc, which consists of four members. With her business profit, Điểm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment for producing salt.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 55 years old now.

Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, gasoline, and other supplies to use in her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, gasoline, and other supplies to use in her busines

loans.name: Joveth

texts.en:
Joveth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joveth is 35 years old and three of her children are in school.

Joveth has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Joveth requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Joveth has been in this business for three years. In the future, Joveth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nidia Margarita

texts.es:
Nidia, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera, no tiene hijos y aún vive en casa de sus padres.

Nidia, se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cosméticos y otros productos, ella es consultora de proveedores como Avon, Liberalices y Epson, de esa manera ella obtiene ingresos para su casa y es una forma de ayudar a su familia.- Su trabajo lo realiza en los municipios más cercanos y en su comunidad, su horario de trabajo es de 7 horas al día.

Nidia, necesita el crédito para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros.  

Ella sueña con tener un lugar seguro para vivir y colocar su propio negocio en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Nidia, who is 34, has a sixth-grade education; she is single, has no children, and still lives at home with her parents.

Nidia sells perfumes, cosmetics, and other products for a living; she is a consultant for distributors such as Avon, Liberalices, and Epson. This is how she generates income for her home and it is a way for her to help her family. She does her work in the municipalities closest to her and in her community; her work schedule is 7 hours a day.

Nidia needs this loan to buy beauty products, such as perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other items.

She dreams of having a safe place to live and setting up her own business in the city.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, such as perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 39-year-old married woman, mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. She requests a loan for her son. He owns an iron shop to sell binding iron, used in making roofs. Due to the increased cost of iron, he is unable to buy new inventory to sell from his shop.

This is the reason that Maryam has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Maryam hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for her family. She thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC ,Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest this loan in her son's iron shop.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y sus dos nietos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia  con lo que obtine de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosaura is 66 years old and lives in her own home with her two children and her two grandchildren.  She sells clothing on foot in the different markets that are located close to her home and her earnings from this allow her to cover some of her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale so she can continue to make sales and have better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Vanna makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 62 años se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace más de 9 años,  vive en la comunidad de Copan en Honduras y junto a su esposa Virginia han trabajado para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos los cuales en la actualidad se han independizado y les ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Gracias a los frutos de su trabajo Santos ha adquirido una pequeña finca en una comunidad donde no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica y es por esta razón que está solicitando a Soluz Honduras un financiamiento para la compra de un Sistema Solar ya que actualmente utiliza  combustible para poder tener energía por unas horas y esto le genera un costo muy alto; por lo que al adquirir el sistema solar le ayudara  en la realización de su trabajo ya que podrá utilizar una mejor iluminación y a un costo más bajo.
texts.en: Santos is 62 years old and has worked in farming and ranching for over 9 years.  He lives in the community of Copan in Honduras and, along with his wife Virginia, he has worked to provide for his three children, who are now independent and help out with the household expenses.  Thanks to the fruits of his labor, Santos has bought a small farm in a community with no electricity, which is why he is requesting a loan from Soluz Honduras to buy a solar power system, as he is currently using gas to have a few hours of energy and it is very expensive.  Buying the solar power system will help him do his work, as he will be able to use better lighting for less money.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system, which will greatly benefit his farming and ranching business.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 26 years old, is married and supports three children. He has been a small scale farmer for the last five years earning an income of KES.15,000 per month.

He has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision fund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and the surplus to educate his children.His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and improve family standards.

loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

loans.name: Alejandro Antonio

texts.en:
Alejandro is a 35 years old father of two, who lives in the municipality of San Pedro de Urabá. He has a daughter who is 12 years old and a boy who is 10 years old. He has a farm where he grows different kind of products and it’s a job that he’s been doing for more than15 years.

He takes his business really seriously because it’s the only support that his family has and something that he loves. He wants to improve his sales so his profits can increase, he also would like to see his growing get bigger and his business last for a long time. He asked for a loan so he can buy some agro chemistries, fertilizers and some cattle so he diversifies his business.

For Alejandro his children are the reason for his work and sacrifice, so he dreams with giving to them the best education he can so they can be good professionals. You can help Alejandro to fulfill his dreams with a loan, something that will get him closer to his goals.

loans.use: buy some agro chemistries, fertilizers and some cattle

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 68 years old, is married and supports seven children. He has been a small scale farmer for the last seven years earning an income of KES.12,000 per month.

He has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision fund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and the surplus to educate his children.His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and improve family standard.

loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

loans.name: Lydis Del Carmen

texts.en:
Lydis is 50 years old and has 4 sons; she lives with them and her partner in the municipality of Sahagun. She owns a racing birds business that she started this year, all because she wants to be more independent and help with the economy in her home.

She wants to improve the location of her business and wants to be more competitive in the market. She knows that if she achieves that her business will be more successful. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more chickens and food for them.

She dreams with giving to her family a nice home to live, they already have one but isn’t in its best conditions, so with her profits she wants to fix it and make her family happy. You can help Lydis to accomplish this dream and to make her business more successful with a loan.

loans.use: buy more chickens and food for them

loans.name: Vilma Evelin

texts.es:
Vilma, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada desde hace 16 años, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y a la albañilería, sus hijos viven actualmente en casa de ella. 

Vilma, se dedica a la venta de pan en su comunidad desde hace 4 años, decidió realizar este trabajo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la alimentación de sus hijos, ella diariamente camina un aproximado de 7 kilómetros hasta vender sus productos y su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día. 

Vilma, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería (pan) y comprar otros productos que no tiene, para generar más ganancias.

Ella, sueña colocar su propio puesto de venta, además sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Vilma is 29 years old and has a second-grade education. She has been in a relationship for 16 years; her partner works in farming and carpentry; their children currently live at home with her.

Vilma has sold bread in her community for a living for 4 years. She decided to do this work to help her partner with the household expenses and their children's upkeep. She walks about 7 kilometers a day until her product is sold and her work schedule is 5 hours a day.

Vilma needs this loan to buy more merchandise (bread) and to buy other products that she does not have so she can generate more profits.

She dreams of setting up her own shopping stand and she also dreams of seeing her children graduate with university degrees.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (bread) and to buy other products that she does not have so she can generate more profits.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 30 years old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and one daughter, who are in school. Her husband has been running his own business of dyeing cloth for 5 years.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of colors, cylinder,and refill the gas for business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these merchandise. Therefore Maryam is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these items for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Maryam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase in her husband's cloth dyeing business.

loans.name: Davaakhuu

texts.en: Mrs. Davaakhuu is one of our most reliable clients who has borrowed many times for different purposes and paid each payment without delay. She together with her husband run vocational training center. This time she is requesting a loan of 800 USD to pay tuition fee for her son. Her son is third year student at technical college.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son at technical college

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica works as a school teacher and she lives with her daughter at her parents house and she is divorced.  Monica wants to take an upgrade class that will give her the chance to improve her situation and to be more qualified to give classes. Monica supports her daughter and also she helps her parents at their house with the expenses she hopes you can help her Monica is at her home in the picture

loans.use: to take an upgrade class

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 47 years old and single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jessie requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jessie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jessie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Socorro Del Carmen

texts.en:
Socorro is 53 years old and lives with his partner and two children in the municipality of Sahagun. She has a boy and a girl whom she loves very much and have become her reason to get up every day and work hard to give them a good quality of life. She has a raising cattle business, work that she has been doing for more than 10 years.

She inherited the business from her family, and her mother was the one who taught her everything about this job. Socorro wants to see her business last in time so it can give her and her family a good life. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy two cows so she can stock up and have more to offer.

Socorro dreams with improving the conditions of her house so her family can live in a place where they feel comfortable and proud. This woman is a worker who is looking for a little help, and you can make her a loan.

loans.use: buy two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, knife,

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 53 years old and married with four children. Felisa works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Felisa has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Felisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Estrellas De Wara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE WARA” iniciarán el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de celulares, venta de ropa para niños, venta de comida, venta de dulces, venta de chinelas, venta de refrescos, servicio de fotocopiadora. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de celulares; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace más de quince años, empezó vendiendo accesorios para celulares y en la actualidad vende celulares.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de celulares por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la  otorgación de créditos rápidos y oportunos que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas de Wara" communal bank will begin its fifth loan cycle through Pro Mujer's Santiago II office. The bank has eight members and is managed by a board of directors that has Lourdes as its president. The members have different businesses, selling mobile phones, children's clothing, meals, sweets, soft drinks, and slippers, and providing photocopying services.

This loan will benefit small-time entrepreneur's in Lourdes' group. Lourdes herself says that she joined Pro Mujer following an invitation from a friend, also a borrower at Pro Mujer. Lourdes currently has a business selling mobile phones. She says that she learned this trade more than 15 years ago; she began by selling phone accessories and now sells mobile phones.

This loan will be used to increase assets by buying mobile phones in bulk from wholesalers in the city of La Paz. Lourdes will then sell on the phones at her own business. This work allows Lourdes to earn an income to support her family financially; she is single but has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lourdes says that she likes that loans are granted quickly and at opportune times.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones in bulk.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Laila is 43 years old and three of her children are still in school.

Laila has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, chicken meat, flour, and spices for food vending.

Laila has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, chicken meat, flour, and spices for food vending.

loans.name: Loregen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Loregen works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Loregen is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle and pay for maintenance for her business.

Loregen has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle and pay for maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en: Ran, age 49, is a married mother of six dependent children, two of whom are still in school and need her support. She lives in Battambang province where she and her husband raise cows and catch fish to sell. In addition, they sometimes work as paid workers to supplement their income. Because she cannot catch as many fish as before, this causes her to lack working capital to support her business. Now, leading a group of two to apply for a loan from VisionFund, Ran will use her loan to buy fishing materials. She hopes that she can catch more fish in order to better support her family’s needs and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials so that she can catch more fish in order to earn more income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lanie is 47 years old and both of her children are still in school.

Lanie has a watch repair business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for watches and maintain her business.

Lanie has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for watches and maintain her business.

loans.name: Fale

texts.en: Fale is a 64-year-old mother with six children who runs a business selling ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Fale requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag, coolio, and a container to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag, coolio, and a container.

loans.name: Marie Eugene

texts.en:
Marie Eugene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marie Eugene is 39 years old and two of her children are presently in school.

Marie Eugene has a buy and sell of frozen foods business in the Philippines. Marie Eugene requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of hot dogs, sausages and other frozen foods.

Marie Eugene has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of hot dogs, sausages and other frozen foods.

loans.name: Chengying

texts.en:
Chengying, 55 years old, is working very hard to support her family alone. She has two children, both of whom are married and her eldest daughter has a child. Chengying feeds more than two thousands ducks in her hometown; her husband who works outside just left. Her son stays with her and helps her to take care of those ducks.

Every night, Chengying looks after those ducks personally, even feeding them at midnight. Chengying wants to sell those ducks for a good price in the future so that she can earn enough money to buy a big house for the family.

The next few months will be the best time to sell the ducks, Chengying needs to buy more fodder to meet demands so that the ducks are fattened by plentiful nutritious fodder. So, she requested ￥20,000 from MicroCred to purchase fodder. She believes that she can sell the ducks quickly and have a happy time.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for her ducks.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 62-year-old married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nenita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, chicken meat, spices and other materials for her food vending business.

Nenita has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, chicken meat, spices and other materials for her food vending business.

loans.name: Navruz

texts.ru: Навруз с раннего детства отличался от других дворовых мальчиков, своей ответственностью и умением жить и радоваться каждой минутой жизни. Повзрослев, Навруз остался на Родине и не уехал на заработки в другую страну, как многие мужчины района. Навруз не смог оставить своих родителей. Он чувствует большую ответственность за них (родителей). Навруз остался и как его отец продолжить животноводческую деятельность. Навруз доволен своей жизнью и планирует скоро женится. Чтобы жениться, необходимы средства, (провести свадьбу, купить приданное невесте) Навруз уже начал копить деньги. Он хочет расширить бизнес, увеличить доход, чтобы скорее накопить денег. С такими намерениями он обратился за кредитом. Навруз планирует купить пару теленок за счет заемных средств. Он верит,  что ему помогут и благодарит:)
texts.en:
As a young child, Navruz was already different from the other boys he played with; he was particularly responsible and at the same time he knew how to appreciate every every minute of his life.  As he grew up, he stayed in his own country and didn't go look for a job in a foreign country, like many other residents of his district did.  Navruz couldn't bear to leave his parents.  He feels particularly responsible for them.  So he stayed home and, like his father, he got involved in animal husbandry.

Navruz is happy with his life and he is planning to get married soon.  Getting married is expensive though (you need money for the wedding ceremony, and  for the bride's dower).  Navruz has started to save some money.  He wants to expand his business and increase his income, so that he can save even more.  It is with this goal in mind that he is taking a loan to buy two calves.  He is confident that he will receive some support and he thanks you in advance :)

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Djipo Group

texts.fr:
Mr GOMDAOGO EMILE est le responsable du groupe DJIPO. Il est marié et père de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 16 mois. 03 enfants vont à l’école  et il a 09 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis 12 ans et pratique aussi l’élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé,  il veut s’acheter 10 sacs d’engrais, 07 boîtes de graine de choux, 01 carton d’herbicide, et 100  litres de gasoil.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour construire et satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Il ambitionne prévenir une activité qui sera compatible avec l’âge car le jardinage nécessite plus d’effort.
texts.en:
Gomdaogo Emile is the leader of the 'Djipo' Group. He is married and father to seven children. The eldest is twenty-one years and the youngest is sixteen months old. Three of his children attend school and he is responsible for a total of nine people.

Gomdaogo Emile has been growing vegetables for twelve years and he also rears livestock. He buys all his supplies from local markets. He plans to use his loan to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer, 7 boxes of cabbage seed, 1 box of herbicide and 100 litres of fuel. The profits will be used to provide for the needs of his family and go towards building a house.

Gomdaogo Emile would like to find a way of earning a living that is more compatible with his age as agriculture requires a lot of effort.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer, 7 boxes of cabbage seed, 1 box of herbicide and 100 litres of fuel.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Gandé Group

texts.fr:
L e groupe a été crée depuis le 7 Novembre 2013.Les membres habitent dans le même village et ont une bonne attente.

Arame l'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 58ans.Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 3 garçons.

Elle s'active dans l'embouche bovine.Elle va acheter un bœuf de 100000f.Elle va compléter 40000f sur les 60000f qu'elle a reçu.

Avec ses bénéfices,elle fait du petit commerce de condiment.Elle appuie aussi son mari et ses enfants dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created on 7 November 2013. The members all live in the same village and get on very well together.

Arame, the group representative, is fifty-eight years old. She is married and mother to ten children, of whom three are boys. She raises cattle. She will buy one cow for 100,000 francs CFA (40,000 francs CFA will come from her own money and 60,000 francs CFA will come from this loan).

Arame plans to use her profits to support her other business selling food ingredients. She will also help her husband and children with their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Gandé Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée depuis 7 Novembre 2013.Les membres du groupe habitent dans le même village.Elles s'activent dans le petit commerce et l’élevage.

Arame l'emprunteur en vedette  est âgée de 29ans. Elle est marié et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 garçons.

Elle s'active dans l'élevage et le petit commerce.Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 2 moutons avec les 50000f dont 25000f chacun.Le reste et va acheter du pain au lait au four et le revend au marché hebdomadaire.

Les bénéfices servent à augmenter ses dépenses quotidiennes le jour de son tour de cuisine.Elle gère aussi ses besoins personnels comme la tontine et l'habillement des ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on 7 November 2013. The members all live in the same village. They all work as retailers or raise livestock.

Arame, the representative of the group, raises livestock and works in retail. She is twenty-nine years old, married and mother to four children, of whom two are boys. She plans to use her loan to buy two sheep for 25,000 francs CFA. She will also buy baked milk bread to sell at the weekly market. Her profits will allow her to pay more for her day-to-day cooking expenses. They will also be used to buy clothing for her children and increase her savings fund.

loans.use: to buy sheep and milk bread.

loans.name: Catalina  Del Carmen

texts.es: Catalina de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote desde hace 13 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia,con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de elotes por mayor, azúcar y leche para continuar con la elaboración de los alimentos y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Catalina, 58 years old, lives in her own house with her son and her life partner. She has worked selling corn tamales for 13 years. Her business is located in her residence. With the sales she makes, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She is again asking for a loan to purchase corn in bulk, sugar and milk to continue making the food and, in this way, have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 14, 7 y 1 años de edad, y de ellos los mayores se encuentran estudiando. María desde hace ya 3 años se dedica  a la venta de prendas de vestir y zapatos, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, dichos productos los distribuye entre sus vecinos y en los mercados cercanos, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con esta manera de ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar.
