María siempre ha deseado mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, es por ello que ha decidido encementar el piso de su vivienda, ya que es de tierra y causa enfermedades respiratorias a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso que es de tierra y causa enfermedades a su familia.
texts.en: María is a hard-working woman, 31 years old, who lives with her life partner and their 3 children, ages 14, 7, and 1, and of them the older ones are students. María, for the past 3 years, has worked selling clothing and shoes, work that she does as a street vendor. She sells these products to her neighbors and in the nearby markets, so she is happy to have this way of earning a living and bringing sustenance to her home. María always has wanted to improve her quality of life and that of her family, and for this she has decided to cement the floor of her house, since it is dirt and causes respiratory illnesses in her family. So, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, and gravel and pay labor costs to cement the floor which is dirt and causes illnesses in her family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and pay labor costs to cement the floor which is dirt and causes illnesses in her family.

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es: Moisés es un hombre de 48 años de edad, feliz mente casado con una linda familia, Moisés es uno de las  muchas personas que se han beneficiado con el apoyo del crédito, él cuenta que gracias a la inversión anterior logro comprar la mercadería que tanta falta hacia a su negocio,  y a Dios gracias le fue muy bien, por lo que ha considerado ahora que es posible remodelar su casa, porque ya se cuenta con algunos desperfectos; el comprara laminas, puertas, clavos, el nuevamente solicita su crédito para poder cubrir esta necesidad, Mises estaría efectuando sus pagos con las ganancias que ahora proceden de su negocio de ropa típica.
texts.en: Moisés is a 48-year-old man, happily married with a lovely family. Moisés is one of the many people who have benefited from the support of a loan. He says that, thanks to the previous investment, he managed to purchase the merchandise that he lacked in his business and that, thanks to God, it went very well, so that he thinks that it is now possible to remodel his house since it has some imperfections. He will purchase metal sheeting, doors, and nails and again asks for his loan to be able to cover this need. Moisés would be making his payments with the earnings that now come from his traditional clothing business.

loans.use: to remodel his home.

loans.name: Yadira Yamileth

texts.es: Yadira, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas, una está estudiando en la escuela y la otra tiene un año y vive con ellas en el municipio de Azacualpa Santa Bárbara. Yadira no recibe apoyo económico de parte de su nueva pareja quien la dejo sola con los gastos de manutención de sus hijas. Ella anteriormente tenía su negocio de una pulpería para la venta de productos de la canasta básica pero no le generó suficientes ingresos  y decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa, calzado, y cosméticos ya que le genera mayor ingreso para su hogar.  El prestamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo con la institución y es por 10,000 Lempiras, con este prestamo va surtir de más mercadería como pantalones, blusas, faldas, zapatos y otros para vender y aumentar sus ganancias. Con el negocio surtido va brindar mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es crecer como microempresaria y generar ganancias para ahorrar y darles el estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en: Yadira is 31 years old, is a single mother and has two daughters. One is going to school and the other is one year old and she lives with them in the municipality of Azacualpa Santa Bárbara. Yadira doesn't get economic support from her new partner who left her alone with the expenses of supporting her two daughters. She previously had a grocery store business to sell basic pantry items but it didn't generate enough income and she decided to work selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics since it generates more income for her household. The loan that she asks for is her third loan cycle with the institution and is for 10,000 lempiras. With this loan, she will stock up with more merchandise such as pants, blouses, skirts, shoes and more to sell and increase her earnings. With the business stocked, she will offer better customer service. Her goal is to grow as a micro-entrepreneur and generate earnings to save and provide her daughters with an education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as pants, blouses, skirts, shoes and others to sell.

loans.name: Fuifuiafa

texts.en:
Fuifuiafa is a 53-year-old mother with eight children.

She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living.

Fuifuiafa requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter and mayonnaise for the business. She will expand her business using her profit.

She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter, mayonnaise.

loans.name: Beatriz  Del Carme

texts.es: Beatriz de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de cerdos y tambien se dedica a la crianza de ganado, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar de una novilla, una vaca y tres cerdos para poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Beatriz is 30 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and their son. For several years, she has worked raising pigs and cattle. With her sales she is able to get ahead with the household expenses. She is asking for a loan again to be able to buy a heifer, a cow and three pigs to continue raising animals and making better profits.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, a cow and three pigs.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Theresa is 51 years old now.

Maria Theresa has a buy and sell jewelry business in the Philippines. Maria Theresa requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell.

Maria Theresa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maria Theresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 48 years old, married, and has four children. With three children in school, Lina works very hard to provide for them.

Lina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years and sells a variety of items.

Lina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn, 33, is a married woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lalyn has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Lalyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

In the future, Lalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El señor Santos de 43 años de edad es casado tiene cinco hijos de las edades entre 7 y 22 años, vive es su casa de habitación ubicada en la ciudad  de Santo Tomas la Unión y se dedica desde hace 25 a la carpintería. Esta actividad lo realiza desde la comunidad de su hogar, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  al cultivo de café. El señor Santos gracias a sus años de experiencia es uno de los mejores productores de café pero ahora su más grande impedimento para seguir produciendo café es no contar con el capital suficiente para la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de café de esta temporada, por tal  motivo solicita un préstamo de Q 4,500.00 para cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño del señor Santos es comprar un pik up para utilizarlo en su cultivo y trabajo de carpintería.
texts.en:
Santos is 43 years old. He is married and he has 5 children between the ages of 7 and 22. He lives in his house, located in the city of Santo Tomas la Unión and for 25 years, he has worked in carpentry. He does this activity from the community where he lives, but to improve his income he also grows coffee. Thanks to his years of experience, Santos is one of the best coffee growers, but now his biggest barrier to continue growing coffee is not having enough capital to buy fertilizer for his coffee crops this season. That is why he is asking for a loan of Q 4,500.00 to cover this need.

Santos's big dream is to buy a pick up to use it for his farming and carpentry.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un bazar ubicado en el mercado municipal, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que tiene y por los buenos precios, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos como recuerdos, bolsas de regalos, listones, agujas, hilos, etc. para surtir aun mas su negocio y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: This young woman's face is pixelated because she lives in a high risk area. She is 26 years old and she has a variety store located in the municipal market. She has a lot of clientele because of her variety of products and because she has good prices. With what she earns from her sales, she is able to cover the necessities of her home. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and their daughter. She is asking for a loan again to buy more products such as souvenirs, gift bags, ribbons, needles, thread, etc. to stock her business even more and thus be able to have, with her family, better financial stability.

loans.use: A loan of $500 helps this borrower to buy more products, such as souvenirs, gift bags, ribbons, needles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es: Adela de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos desde hace 35 años y tambien a la venta de ropa, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en: Adela is 63 years old. She lives in her own home with her family group. She has sold traditional snacks for 35 years. She also sells clothes. Her business is located close to her home. With her sales, she is able to cover some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, plantains, and all of the ingredients to make them. This way, she can continue supporting her home and covering any expense that come up.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn for tamales, plantains and all of the ingredients.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, 52, is a married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosalie has a buy and sell auto supplies business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more supplies to sell like oil, etc.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to sell like oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 59-year-old mother with eight children.

She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Rosa requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan for the business. She hopes to expand her business using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 44 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Monina works very hard to provide for them.

Monina runs a general store in the Philippines. Monina has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Monina requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Monina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her general store and livestock businesses.

She is now borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Jean dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Preah Vihear province who is 58 years old, Thon is married and has seven children, five of whom are depending on him.

His family’s income is from rice growing and a handicraft business.

This will be Thon’s fourth time with VisionFund. The previous loans have helped him to expand the business and upgrade his family’s living standards.

Leading a group of four members, Thon will use his loan to purchase solar panels to generate electricity to use in the house so as to save more money. He hopes that this solar panel will brighten the house and reduce the expense of electricity service.

loans.use: to purchase solar panels to brighten his house and save money so that he can use his evening time on his handicraft business to increase his daily income.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, 38, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Zenaida has a corn farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Zenaida requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leleai

texts.en:
Leleai is a 22-year-old woman with 2 children. She sells fish in her community to earn a living. Leleai requests a loan to buy a fishing net, container, flashlight, fishing gear, new canoe, and ice bag, to help her run the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, container, flashlight, fishing gear, new canoe, and an ice bag.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadith is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requests 24,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.

She earns additional income raising pigs.

Bernadith dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living raising pigs and is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccine for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings by growing sugarcane.

Cecile wishes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a 53-year-old married woman with four children, three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cristita has sold rice for 3 years and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase rice to sell at her stall.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell to her stall.

loans.name: Abla Akofa

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Avec quatre enfants à charge, Abla est une marchande de friperies qui s’approvisionne et revend ses marchandises au marché deux fois par mois. Abla demande ce crédit pour commander des douzaines d’habits pour enfants et pour dames. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Abla pourra bien prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abla is a married woman aged 30, living in Adidogomé. Raising four children, Abla is a used clothing retailer who stocks up and resells her merchandise at the market twice a month.

Abla is requesting this loan to order several dozen garments for children and for women. With the profit she will make, Abla will be able to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 12 dozen garments for children and nine garments for women.

loans.name: Iokapeta

texts.en:
Iokapeta is a 43-year-old mother with 1 child who sells taro and banana in her village to earn a living.

Iokapeta requestss a loan to buy taro roots seedlings, banana tube seedling, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and gloves to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and gloves.

loans.name: Jati Ayu Group

texts.en:
Having succeeded in the previous period, the Jati Ayu groups proceed to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received 24.000.000 IDR for group lending and individual persons got 3.000.000 IDR. Because most of them have been able to increase the number of pig populations, the current loan used to buy food and fix the cage.

Ni Nengah will use the loan to buy superior feed and build new pigpens. Ni Nengah already has 2 sows. She’s very happy with the effort can be developed. She hopes to become a big pig seller at her village and all the profits to improve the welfare of her family and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy superior feed and build new  cages

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is 35-years old lady, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband is a turner by profession and manufactures spare parts of vehicle. He has been operating lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufactures the spare parts of various vehicle. His lathe machine has become out of order and some tools have become wearing out due to continuously working which are need of replacement. He has spent his all savings to buy cast iron for manufacturing spare parts and does not have cash in hand to fix the lathe machine.
Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the deficiencies of the lathe machine. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her husband can easily operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband so he can fix his lathe machine to continue he manufacturing business.

loans.name: Animals Are Our Friends - N11Plaitphú Group

texts.en:
Mrs Châm is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She has worked in agriculture raising livestock for more than 10 years.
Châm lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Châm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.
In 2011, Châm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Châm has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the N11PLaiTPhú , which consists of 6 members.
With her business profit, Châm hopes for her children to go to school, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Niron's Group

texts.en:
Niron is a 44-year-old mother of four children and only one of whom is in school, living in a rural village of Battambang province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice, fishing and raising cow as the main source of her family’s income. Niron usually spend her spare time to work for other to get additional income to complement her family’s needs. She has been involved in her rice farming business for ten years. Recently, her rice has not grown well because of drought and causes her to have not enough working capital to do farming for this season.
Now, she is leading a group of two to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to grow her crop fruitfully. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to keep sending her child in school and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow her crop fruitfully, which enable her to earn more income so as to keep sending her child to school.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée  de 57ans, Akou est une femme qui habite à Adidogomé.  Ayant six enfants à charge, Akou  prépare et vend de la pâte de manioc au marché. Akou achète le nécessaire au marché deux fois par mois et sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de farine de manioc et des condiments. Avec le surplus de son revenu, Akou va pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires de ses enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Married and aged 57, Akou is a woman who lives in Adidogomé. With responsibility for six children, Akou prepares and sells manioc dough at the market. She buys the necessary ingredients at the market twice a month, and she is requesting this loan to buy some sacks of manioc flour and condiments.

With the surplus income, Akou will be able to cover school fees for her children when the fall term begins.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of manioc flour.

loans.name: Ho's Group

texts.en: Ho’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Ho makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dede

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant, Dede est une femme divorcée âgée de 51 ans habitant à Tokoin. Dede est une marchande  de bouillie  préparée à base du maïs à domicile qu’elle  revend dans une gare routière. Dede s’approvisionne du nécessaire pour la préparation six fois par mois au marché et désire donc demander ce prêt pour réaliser ses achats de sac de maïs et des bols de sucre afin de gagner une marge bénéficiaire assez importante pour inscrire son enfant dans une école de haut niveau scolaire.
texts.en:
The mother of one child, Dede is a divorced woman aged 51, living in Tokoin. Dede is a seller of maize porridge, prepared in her home and sold at a truck stop.

Dede buys the necessary ingredients for preparation of the porridge six times a month. She would like to request this loan to cover her purchases of a sack of maize and some bowlfuls of sugar so that she can make enough profit to register her child in an institution of higher learning.

loans.use: to buy one sack of maize and six bowlfuls of sugar.

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en:
Hidoyat was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is married and has two children. She works at traditional café “Chayhana” where people (mostly man) are drinking tea. She has two year of work experience. After getting married she faced with difficulties in her life. Her family was poor, her husband did not work. She was used to ensure and feed her children. She tried to find any job vacancy. She worked everywhere where she could get money to feed her family. About two years as she works at café as a cook. Her colleagues respect and appreciate her work and relation.

She has appealed to get a loan from IMON because she is sick now. She is willing to be treated and continue working to feed her family. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to be treated at a medical clinic.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Please meet Amalia, 52 years old, from San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She operates a store that sells various motor parts which is the main source of her family’s livelihood. Edilberto, her husband, is her business partner. Both of them can do the tasks of transacting with clients, purchasing, cashiering and management of the store.

Unfortunately they had slack sales during the early part of the year, January to April. It’s the usual case from her experience. Now she wants to recover the lapses on sales because customers are coming back again. She applied for a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 that she will use to buy additional motor parts to sell. This will strengthen the stability of her business and will pave the way to her dream of putting up another branch. She aspires to help others and wants to enjoy a more comfortable life.

She is a partner of good standing at CCT Credit Cooperative Bayugan Branch. She shares her experiences with her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional motor parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds for her poultry business.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonisa is 52 years old.

Leonisa has a watch repair business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy batteries and other materials for her watch repair business.

Leonisa has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy batteries and other materials for her watch repair business.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is aged 49, a hard working man laboring to look after eight children, who all attend school in Hoima Uganda. He drives a car for taxi and transport. In order to earn additional income he sells items like sugar, salt and cooking oil on a retail basis.

He intends to grow his business of transport so as the transportation of people and their goods from one place to another can be done cheaply. His main hindrance is inadequacy of capital and he is requesting a loan facility to buy a new car for transport.

loans.use: to buy a new car for taxi and transport.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente es un gran hombre de 42 años de edad, es feliz mente casado con una linda familia por la cual él se esmera y sacrifica día con día, Vicente está muy satisfecho con el crédito pues gracias a ello logro terminar una parte de la construcción de su casa, y ahora ya se encuentran en uso esa parte de la casa, pero aún hace falta una parte que le hace falta algunos detalles para terminar, esta es la razón por la cual Vicente solicita otro préstamo para finalizar la construcción de su casa, Compra de materiales  como arena, block y hierro. Él estaría cancelando el crédito con el apoyo de sus ingresos que provienen de su negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes. El gran sueño de Vicente es seguir mejorando su casa para darle a su familia una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Vicente is a great guy, 42 years old and happily married with a beautiful family for which he strives and makes sacrifices every day.

Vicente is very happy with the loan because, thanks to this, he managed to finish constructing part of his home which is now already in use. However, one part still requires some finishing touches and this is the reason why Vicente has applied for another loan.

In order to complete the construction of his house he will buy materials such as sand, blocks and iron. He would repay the loan using the income from his grocery business.

Vincent's dream is to continue improving his home in order to give his family a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mukisa

texts.en: Mugisa is a produce business man since 2003; he also trades in waragi and has rentals as the other sources of income. He is married and a father to 5 who are attending school, at the age of 35, Mugisa plans to educate all his children. Mugisa needs money to buy produce and waragi, his major challenge is that of lack of enough capital to enable him realize his dreams

loans.use: to buy produce and waragi

loans.name: Khammouan Group

texts.en: Xomphu understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Xomphu knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Xomphu purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Xomphu is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Arquimides Stanley

texts.es: Arquimides de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su taxi desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Arquimedes is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He has been providing rides in his taxi for 10 years. He has many customers who prefer his services, thanks to how responsible he is when driving. With the income from his job, he is able to pay for his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase tires and perform maintenance on his vehicle, since this is his only source of work, and to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tires and perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James Lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 33, a married man who loves working throughout the week. He started selling electronics items likes phones, cables flash disks among other items in 2011. In order to supplement his incomes he ventured into farming mainly cassava and maize.

He is optimistic of growing and expanding his business, so as to capitalize on the growing market for electronics items. He is requesting for a loan facility to buy more phones, cables and flash disks for sell.

loans.use: to buy more phones, cables and flash disks for sell.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, 54, is a married woman who lives in Preah Vihear province. She has four children; and only one of them is in school. She owns a handicraft business and grows rice to earn income for supporting her family. Sopheap has ever been with VisionFund for three cycle loans, which she paid back completely. Based on the previous loan, she has been able to expand her farming business and send her child to school.

Since she learned about the benefits of using solar lighting, she is leading a four-member group to apply for a Kiva loan and she is willing to spend it on buying solar lighting to use. She hopes that her child can study and do homework at night, after purchasing that solar lighting and she also hopes that it will reduce her cost of living.

loans.use: to buy solar lighting to brighten her house at night time, which will allow her child easily to do more homework.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pxeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol para el consumo y la venta, ademas tambien cultiva hortalizas, tiene 11 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para tener una buena siembra.
texts.en:
This young man, whose face has been blurred because he is 29 years old and lives in a high-risk area, works in the cultivation of corn and beans for consumption and sale. He also grows vegetables. He has worked in this for 11 years. With the income that he obtains from the sale of his products, he is able to pay for some of his household expenses.

He lives in his own house with his wife. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, etc. in order to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling charcoal in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling bananas. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a slab floor, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria es una gran mujer de 38 años de edad, es soltera con una gran visión de superación, ella está profundamente agradecida por el apoyo que ha recibido con el crédito pues gracias a ello logro comprar sus insumos agrícolas y semillas de papa y pilones de brócoli. A Dios gracias le fue muy bien porque logro una buena cosecha y venderlos a un buen precio en su mercado regional. Con el afán de seguir prosperando Candelaria solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de semillas de papa y abono químico para el cultivo de esta temporada. Ella tiene las esperanzas de seguir incrementando su cultivo para poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Candelaria, age 38, is a wonderful woman. She is single, and she has a great vision for self-improvement. She is profoundly grateful for the support that she has received with the loan. Thanks to the loan, she managed to buy agricultural supplies, potato seeds, and broccoli seedlings. Thank God it went very well for her because she managed a good harvest, and she sold it for a good price at her regional market.

Out of her desire to continue prospering, Candelaria is requesting a new loan to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizer for this season's crops. She hopes to continue increasing her crops in order to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Talila

texts.en:
Talila is a 51-year-old mother with six children. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Talila requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Mr. Ganzorig, 29 years old, lives with his wife and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been teaching dance to people for 11 years. His wife also teaches acrobatics to children.

Using his previous loan, he has renovated his house and surrounding environment. This time, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to rent a bigger place in order to teach dance to more people. In recent years, lots of people are seeking his dance tutoring, so he decided he needs more space.

loans.use: to rent a bigger place in order to teach dance to more people.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 57 years old and married with one child.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dolores has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Dolores aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is 41 years old and has five children. Rosebella is married, and two of her children are presently in school.

Rosebella is in the agricultural business of farming corn in the Philippines. Rosebella requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer, corn seed and other supplies.

Rosebella has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed and other supplies

loans.name: Miel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Ursula, Silvia Mercedes,  y Jiaribeth) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de productos básicos y accesorios de acero; se organizaron como grupo solidario hace 6 meses, para obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. 

Silvia Mercedes: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven afable de 25 años de edad con deseos de superación, casada con un pequeño hijo de año y medio de edad. Su esposo trabaja como técnico electricista, de manera temporal. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años estableció una pequeña pulpería, en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener el suficiente capital para establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women (Ursula, Silvia Mercedes, and Jiaribeth) of the Miskito ethnic group in the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurial women who work every day with the determination to grow their small businesses, in which they sell basic goods and accessories made from steel. They formed the group six months ago in order to obtain a loan from Pana Pana.

Silvia Mercedes is a member of the solidarity group. She is a friendly young woman who is 25 years old and has a desire to improve herself. She is married with a one and a half year old son. Her husband works seasonally as an electrician.

With the goal of contributing to her household expenses and having her own source of income, two years ago she established a small store, in a section that she rents in one of the local markets in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. She is is requesting a loan in order to purchase basic grains, snacks, and other products. Her dream is to have enough capital to establish a clothing store.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, snacks, and other products.

loans.name: Lundaajantsan

texts.en:
Mr. Lungaajaltsan, 58 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling second-hand clothes to the local people for more than nine years. His wife is a consultant at a cosmetics firm.

Using his previous loan, he has increased his working capital and stocked many clothes.

Now he is requesting a loan of $500 USD to pay the tuition fee for his son. His son studies at university and due to the academic year beginning in one week, the tuition fee must be paid as soon as possible. The borrower wants his son to be well educated and work as a banker.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for his son.

loans.name: Silone

texts.en:
Silone is a 34-year-old mother with six children. She runs a business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living.

Silone requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank and hand gloves.

loans.name: Vine

texts.en:
Vine is a 52-year-old mother with five children. She runs a business of a cattle farm in her village to earn a living.

Vine requested a loan to buy things for home improvement: cement, a wireless fence, roofing, and timber. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy things for home improvement: cement, a wireless fence, roofing, and timber.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is a 25 years-old married man, the sole breadwinner for his family. Two years ago Tural started working as an electronic repair man. He does this to meet his family needs.
He wants to expand his business. He has a small workshop and fixes old phones, computers there. He requires new repairing tools for fixing electronic equipment and hopes for Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: buy new repairing tools for fixing electronic equipment.

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.es:
Rita es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 3, 6 y 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, generosa y muy sacrificada. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, área caracterizada por su paisaje pintoresco, de árboles grandes e imponentes. 
Rita es morena, de baja estatura y físico mediano. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español )la segunda de la derecha, viste chompa amarilla). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra. Su necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevo a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, cerrajería, panadería, venta de cosméticos, venta de refrescos, artesanía en cuero y venta de queso. Su negocio es la venta de comida como la ‘patasca’; la característica de esta comida es el tiempo de cocción que se requiere, “se necesita entre 12 y 13 horas al fuego, es para degustarse en la mañana, bien temprano, incluso algunas personas consumen la patasca como una cura para la resaca", comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su comida es muy popular, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina, como; arroz, fideo, carne, aceite y otros. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para cocinar diariamente. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rita solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para cocinar diariamente.
texts.en:
Rita, age 39, is single. She has three children; ages 3, 6, and 15. Her business is selling food. She is a very good mother. She is generous and very self-sacrificing. She conducts her business in the southern part of the city. The area is known for its picturesque scenery and for its large and majestic trees. Rita has a dark complexion, is short, and has an average build. Her maternal language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. (She is the second one on the right, and she is wearing an amber sweater.)

She shares her life with her children, who go to school. They live in a rented room built of wood with a tin roof and dirt floor.

Her need to improve her business led her to form a bank of people with businesses like selling second-hand clothes, locksmith, bakery, selling cosmetics, selling soft drinks, leather handicrafts, and selling cheese. Her business is selling food like 'patasca' [pork stew with corn]. This food is known for the time it takes to cook. "You need between 12 and 13 hours on the fire. This is to savor very early in the morning. Some people consume patasca as a cure for a hangover," she says.

The advantage of her business is that her food is very popular. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy cooking supplies like rice, noodles, meat, cooking oil, and others.

Her dream is to improve her business. She wishes to buy cooking supplies in order to cook every day. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the one year that she has had this business. It is for these reasons that Rita is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies in order to cook every day.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies in order to cook every day.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 52-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two sons and three daughters.

Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 10 years. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Shamim is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr: Mariée, Tchilalo a en charge deux enfants. Tchilalo  est âgée de 31 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs. Tchilalo achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation quatre fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile. Tchilalo sollicite ce crédit pour commander le  sac de maïs et le tas de condiments en vue de gagner plus de bénéfices afin de soutenir les besoins de son foyer et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Married, Tchilalo is raising two children. Tchilalo is 31 and lives in Tokoin where she prepares and sells wrapped dough made from maize. She buys what she needs for preparing the maize four times a month at the market, and she sells her food in front of her house.

Tchilalo is asking for this loan to order a sack of maize and a pile of condiments so as to earn more profit, cover the needs of her household, and improve her day-to-day living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sack of maize and one pile of condiments.

loans.name: Claudel's Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario “Tiempos Mejores”, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Claudia, Rosa Cruz y Claudel), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 2 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios de venta de comida y pulperia, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Claudia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora de 47 años de edad, con deseos de superación y cualidades de líder, casada con 6 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar, estudios de sus hijos y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, ha establecido en un punto estratégico, a la orilla de la calle, una pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chivería, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group called "Better Times" is made up of three entrepreneurial women (Claudia, Rosa Cruz, and Claudel) who live in the city of Bilwi. They joined together two months ago with the goal of working together in order to access loans from Pana Pana, which would allow them to increase the inventory in their small businesses (including food stalls and small stores), improve their income, and thus improve bit by bit the quality of life of their families.

Claudia is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is 47 years old and has leadership qualities and a desire to improve herself. She is married with six young children who are studying in elementary school and high school. With the goal of contributing to her household expenses, her children's education, and having her own source of income, she has established a small store in a strategic location on the side of the street. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase basic grains, snacks, and other products. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snacks, and other products.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 43-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall. He sells different types of eatable items such as samosas, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, kabab paratha, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Rehana's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purposes so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But, due to their unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business.

Therefore, Rehana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business.

loans.name: Nerisa

texts.en:
Nerisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Nerisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as fish, meat, chicken meat, spices, and other materials for her food vending business.

Nerisa has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as fish, meat, chicken meat, spices, and other materials for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank and hand gloves,.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 45, is a married woman from Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has only one child. To make a living, she grows rice for sale. So far, she has been involved in this career for around 20 years. She is able to make an income of USD $4 per day, on average.

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and need to be fixed to provide a suitable living place for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation.

She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funds to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Sega

texts.en:
Sega is a 48-year-old mother with 5 children; she runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living.

Sega requested a loan to buy taro roots( seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, hand gloves and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, hand gloves and a backpack sprayer,.

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
NAI, 42 years old, is living in a community of Takeo province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.50 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now.

Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine.

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana ha demostrado ser una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, responsable y fiel cliente de nuestra institución. Tiene 46 años, casada y con un hijo adoptivo a su responsabilidad de 14 años quien cursa la primaria. Desde hace 18 años tiene su negocio de pulpería y venta de ropa, con la ayuda de su esposo. Actualmente está solicitando crédito por décima sexta vez, para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, pantalones, aceites, arroz, azúcar. Con el crédito que obtuvo anteriormente incremento su negocio y las ganancias le han servido para el mejoramiento económico de su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana has shown herself to be an enterprising, tenacious, and responsible woman. She is a loyal client of our institution. She is 46 years old, married, and has a 14 year old adopted son, who is in primary school and is her responsibility.

She has had a grocery store and clothing sales business for 18 years with the help of her husband.

She is currently requesting a loan for the 16th time in order to buy blouses, pants, cooking oil, rice, and sugar. With the loan that she previously got she expanded her business. The earnings served to improve her household finances.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, cooking oil, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is 39 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Romela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care product, milk, bread, spices, eggs, snacks foods, etc.

Romela has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, bread, spices, eggs, snacks foods, etc.

loans.name: Naheeda

texts.en:
Naheeda is a 49-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters; her children are students.

Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 10 years; her husband is only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for selling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore Naheeda is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business.

Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn the maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Naheeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Fahim

texts.en:
Fahim is a 53-year-old woman and the mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a grocery store. Her husband sells different types of eatable items, e.g., biscuits, toffees, chewing gums, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Fahim's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Fahim has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's grocery business.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is a blacksmith, who creates objects from wrought iron or steel by forging the metal, using tools to hammer, bend, and cut. He works in his small workshop in Ejmiatsin town, near his house. Vardan lives with his wife and two minor children, ages 13 and 12 years old.

Vardan applied for this loan to purchase raw materials and tools needed for his work. He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business.
Vardan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Vardan and he hopes for you support.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and tools needed for providing blacksmith service.
